 22072                                  ;============================================================================
 22073                                  ; ABORT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22074                                  ;============================================================================
 22075                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22076                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22077                                  
 22078                                  ;**
 22079                                  ;
 22080                                  ; Internal Abort call closes all handles and FCBs associated with a process.
 22081                                  ;  If process has NET resources a close all is sent out over the net.
 22082                                  ;
 22083                                  ;   DOS_ABORT
 22084                                  ;
 22085                                  ;   Modification history:
 22086                                  ;
 22087                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 22088                                  ;
 22089                                  ;	M038	SR	10/16/90	Free SFT with the PSP of the process
 22090                                  ;				being terminated only if it is busy.
 22091                                  ;
 22092                                  
 22093                                  ;Break   <DOS_ABORT -- CLOSE all files for process>
 22094                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22095                                  ;
 22096                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ABORT
 22097                                  ;
 22098                                  ; Inputs:
 22099                                  ;       [CurrentPDB] set to PID of process aborting
 22100                                  ; Function:
 22101                                  ;       Close all files and free all SFTs for this PID
 22102                                  ; Returns:
 22103                                  ;       None
 22104                                  ; All destroyed except stack
 22105                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22106                                  
 22107                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22108                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7685h
 22109                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:74F4h) 
 22110                                  
 22111                                  DOS_ABORT:
 22112 0000359B 368E06[3003]            	MOV     ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]	; SS override
 22113 000035A0 268B0E3200              	MOV     CX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]  ; Number of JFNs
 22114                                  reset_free_jfn:
 22115 000035A5 89CB                    	MOV     BX,CX
 22116 000035A7 51                      	PUSH    CX
 22117 000035A8 4B                      	DEC     BX                      ; get jfn (start with last one)
 22118                                  
 22119 000035A9 E8003E                  	CALL	_$CLOSE
 22120 000035AC 59                      	POP     CX
 22121 000035AD E2F6                    	LOOP    reset_free_jfn          ; and do 'em all
 22122                                  
 22123                                  ; Note: We do need to explicitly close FCBs. Reasons are as follows: If we
 22124                                  ; are running in the no-sharing no-network environment, we are simulating the
 22125                                  ; 2.0 world and thus if the user doesn't close the file, that is his problem
 22126                                  ; BUT... the cache remains in a state with garbage that may be reused by the
 22127                                  ; next process. We scan the set and blast the ref counts of the FCBs we own.
 22128                                  ;
 22129                                  ; If sharing is loaded, then the following call to close process will
 22130                                  ; correctly close all FCBs. We will then need to walk the list AFTER here.
 22131                                  ;
 22132                                  ; Finally, the following call to NET_Abort will cause an EOP to be sent to all
 22133                                  ; known network resources. These resources are then responsible for cleaning
 22134                                  ; up after this process.
 22135                                  ;
 22136                                  ; Sleazy, eh?
 22137                                  
 22138                                  	;context DS			; SS is DOSDATA
 22139 000035AF 16                      	push	ss
 22140 000035B0 1F                      	pop	ds  ; 09/09/2018
 22141                                  
 22142                                  	;CallInstall Net_Abort, MultNET, 29
 22143 000035B1 B81D11                  	mov	ax,111Dh
 22144 000035B4 CD2F                    	int     2Fh 	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR 
 22145                                  			;	    - CLOSE ALL REMOTE FILES FOR PROCESS
 22146                                  			; DS???, SS = DOS CS
 22147                                  ;if installed
 22148 000035B6 FF1E[A000]              	call	far [JShare+(4*4)]	; 4 = MFTCloseP
 22149                                  ;else
 22150                                  ;	call 	MFTCloseP
 22151                                  ;endif
 22152                                  
 22153                                  ; Scan the FCB cache for guys that belong to this process and zap their ref
 22154                                  ; counts.
 22155                                  					; SS override
 22156 000035BA 36C43E[4000]            	les     di,[ss:SFTFCB]		; grab the pointer to the table
 22157                                  
 22158                                  	;;;
 22159                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22160                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22161                                  SFTFCB_check:
 22162 000035BF 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es
 22163 000035C1 09F9                    	or	cx,di
 22164 000035C3 E325                    	jcxz	FCBScanDone
 22165 000035C5 57                      	push	di
 22166                                  SFTFCB_OK:
 22167                                  	;;;
 22168                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 22169 000035C6 268B4D04                	mov     cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]
 22170                                  	;jcxz	FCBScanDone
 22171                                  	; 27/06/2024
 22172                                  	;;;
 22173 000035CA E315                    	jcxz    SFTFCB_check2	
 22174                                  	;;;
 22175                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 22176 000035CC 8D7D06                  	LEA     DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]	; point at table
 22177 000035CF 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22178                                  FCBTest:
 22179                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22180 000035D3 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax ; is this one of ours
 22181 000035D7 7503                    	jnz	short FCBNext		; no, skip it
 22182                                  
 22183                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22184                                  %if 0
 22185                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22186                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ; yes, blast ref count
 22187                                  %else
 22188                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22189                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22190 000035D9 E87A13                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22191                                  %endif
 22192                                  
 22193                                  FCBNext:
 22194 000035DC 83C73B                  	add     di,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59 (for MSDOS 6.0)
 22195 000035DF E2F2                    	loop    FCBTest
 22196                                  
 22197                                  	; 27/06/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 22198                                  	;;;
 22199                                  SFTFCB_check2:
 22200 000035E1 5F                      	pop	di
 22201 000035E2 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di]
 22202 000035E5 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22203 000035E8 75D5                    	jne	short SFTFCB_check
 22204                                  	;;;
 22205                                  
 22206                                  FCBScanDone:
 22207                                  
 22208                                  ; Walk the SFT to eliminate all busy SFT's for this process.
 22209                                  
 22210 000035EA 31DB                    	XOR     BX,BX
 22211                                  Scan:
 22212 000035EC 53                      	push    bx
 22213 000035ED E8383D                  	call	SFFromSFN
 22214 000035F0 5B                      	pop     bx
 22215                                  	;jnc	short Scan1
 22216                                  	;retn
 22217                                  
 22218                                  	; 18/12/2022
 22219                                  	;jc	short NO_Question ; retn
 22220                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22221 000035F1 7232                    	jc	short RET2
 22222                                  
 22223                                  ;M038
 22224                                  ; Do what the comment above says, check for busy state
 22225                                  
 22226                                  Scan1:
 22227                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0
 22228                                  	;jz	short scan_next  ; MSDOS 3.3
 22229                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22230 000035F3 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1
 22231                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 22232                                  				; Is Sft busy? ;M038
 22233 000035F7 7517                    	jnz	short scan_next ; no
 22234                                  ;
 22235                                  ; we have a SFT that is busy. See if it is for the current process
 22236                                  ;
 22237 000035F9 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22238                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22239 000035FD 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 22240 00003601 750D                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22241 00003603 36A1[3E03]              	mov     ax,[SS:USER_ID]		; SS override
 22242                                  	;sub	ax,[es:di+2Fh] ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM ; 03/02/2024
 22243                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 22244 00003607 2639452F                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 22245 0000360B 7503                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22246                                  
 22247                                  ; This SFT is labelled as ours.
 22248                                  
 22249                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22250                                  %if 0
 22251                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22252                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 22253                                  %else
 22254                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22255                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22256 0000360D E84613                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22257                                  %endif
 22258                                  
 22259                                  scan_next:
 22260 00003610 43                      	inc     bx
 22261 00003611 EBD9                    	jmp     short Scan
 22262                                  
 22263                                  ;============================================================================
 22264                                  ; CLOSE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22265                                  ;============================================================================
 22266                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22267                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22268                                  
 22269                                  ;**	Internal Close and Commit calls to close a local or NET SFT.
 22270                                  ;
 22271                                  ;	DOS_CLOSE
 22272                                  ;	DOS_COMMIT
 22273                                  ;	FREE_SFT
 22274                                  ;	SetSFTTimes
 22275                                  ;
 22276                                  ;	Revision history:
 22277                                  ;
 22278                                  ;	   AN000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 22279                                  ;	   A005   PTM 3718 --- lost clusters when fastopen installed
 22280                                  ;	   A011   PTM 4766 --- C2 fastopen problem
 22281                                  
 22282                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 22283                                  
 22284                                  ;Break <DOS_CLOSE -- CLOSE FILE from SFT>
 22285                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22286                                  ;
 22287                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_CLOSE
 22288                                  ;
 22289                                  ; Inputs:
 22290                                  ;	[THISSFT] set to the SFT for the file being used
 22291                                  ; Function:
 22292                                  ;	Close the indicated file via the SFT
 22293                                  ; Returns:
 22294                                  ;	sf_ref_count decremented otherwise
 22295                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 22296                                  ;	Carry set if error
 22297                                  ;	    AX has error code
 22298                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 22299                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22300                                  
 22301                                  ;hkn; DOS_CLOSE called from fcbio.asm and handle.asm. DS alreday set up.
 22302                                  
 22303                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22304                                  ; DOSCODE:6E2Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22305                                  
 22306                                  ; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 22307                                  ; DOSCODE:6E1Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 22308                                  
 22309                                  ; 23/07/2018 - IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987 - Offset 39D0h
 22310                                  
 22311                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22312                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:76FEh
 22313                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7579h) 
 22314                                  
 22315                                  DOS_CLOSE:
 22316 00003613 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 22317                                  	;mov	bx,[ES:DI+5]
 22318 00003617 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 22319                                  
 22320                                  ; Network closes are handled entirely by the net code.
 22321                                  
 22322                                  	;;test	bx,8000h
 22323                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_isnet
 22324                                  	; 17/12/2022
 22325                                  	;test	bh,80h
 22326 0000361B F6C780                  	test	bh,(sf_isnet>>8)
 22327 0000361E 7406                    	JZ	short LocalClose
 22328                                  
 22329                                  	;CallInstall Net_Close,MultNET,6
 22330 00003620 B80611                  	mov     ax,1106h
 22331 00003623 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - CLOSE REMOTE FILE
 22332                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 22333                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 22334                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 22335                                  			; CF clear if successful
 22336                                  RET2:		; 03/02/2024
 22337 00003625 C3                      	retn
 22338                                  
 22339                                  ; All closes release the sharing information.
 22340                                  ; No commit releases sharing information
 22341                                  ;
 22342                                  ; All closes decrement the ref count.
 22343                                  ; No commit decrements the ref count.
 22344                                  
 22345                                  LocalClose:
 22346 00003626 E86FE2                  	call	ECritDisk
 22347 00003629 E87301                  	CALL	SetSFTTimes
 22348 0000362C E8F600                  	CALL	FREE_SFT		; dec ref count or mark as busy
 22349                                  
 22350                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 22351                                  	;Context DS
 22352 0000362F 16                      	push	ss
 22353 00003630 1F                      	pop	ds
 22354                                  
 22355 00003631 50                      	push	ax
 22356 00003632 53                      	push	bx
 22357 00003633 E88D4A                  	call	ShareEnd
 22358 00003636 5B                      	pop	bx
 22359 00003637 58                      	pop	ax
 22360                                  
 22361                                  ; Commit enters here. AX from commit MUST be <> 1, BX is flags word
 22362                                  
 22363                                  CloseEntry:
 22364 00003638 50                      	PUSH	AX
 22365                                  
 22366                                  ; File clean or device does not get stamped nor disk looked at.
 22367                                  
 22368                                  	;test	bx,0C0h
 22369                                  	; 17/12/2022
 22370 00003639 F6C3C0                  	test	bl,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 22371                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 22372 0000363C 7403                    	JZ	short rdir
 22373                                  	; 14/11/2022
 22374 0000363E E9AB00                  	JMP	FREE_SFT_OK		; either clean or device
 22375                                  	;jnz	short FREE_SFT_OK ; 24/07/2019	
 22376

 22759                                  ;
 22760                                  ; Procedure Name : FREE_SFT
 22761                                  ;
 22762                                  ; ES:DI -> SFT. Decs sft_ref_count. If the count goes to 0, mark it as busy.
 22763                                  ; Flags preserved. Return old ref count in AX
 22764                                  ;

 22766                                  ;

 22784                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22785                                  ;
 22786                                  ; Procedure Name : DirFromSFT
 22787                                  ;
 22788                                  ;   DirFromSFT - locate a directory entry given an SFT.
 22789                                  ;
 22790                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:DI point to SFT
 22791                                  ;		DS = DOSDATA
 22792                                  ;   Outputs:
 22793                                  ;		EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk
 22794                                  ;		CurBuf points to buffer
 22795                                  ;		Carry Clear -> operation OK
 22796                                  ;		    ES:DI point to entry

 22799                                  ;		Carry SET   -> operation failed
 22800                                  ;		    registers trashified

 22871                                  ;**	DOS_Commit - UPdate Directory Entries
 22872                                  ;

 22874                                  ;		(DS) = DOSGROUP

 22886                                  DOS_COMMIT:
 22887                                  	;hkn; called from srvcall. DS already set up.
 22888 00003770 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]

 22890 00003774 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 22891                                  	;test	bx,0C0h

 22905                                  ;ELSE

 22908 00003785 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - COMMIT REMOTE FILE
 22909                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 22910                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 22911                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 22912                                  			; CF clear if successful
 22913                                  localcommit_retn: ; 18/12/2022	
 22914 00003787 C3                      	retn
 22915                                  ;ENDIF
 22916                                  
 22917                                  ; Perform local commit operation by doing a close but not releaseing the SFT.
 22918                                  ; There are three ways we can do this. One is to enter a critical section to
 22919                                  ; protect a potential free. The second is to increment the ref count to mask
 22920                                  ; the close decrementing.
 22921                                  ;
 22922                                  ; The proper way is to let the caller's of close decide if a decrement should
 22923                                  ; be done. We do this by providing another entry into close after the
 22924                                  ; decrement and after the share information release.
 22925                                  
 22926                                  ; DOSCODE:6FA0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22927                                  ; DOSCODE:6F8Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 22928                                  
 22929                                  LOCAL_COMMIT:
 22930 00003788 E80DE1                  	call	ECritDisk
 22931                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22932 0000378B E80AE1                  	call	ECritDisk	;PTM.
 22933 0000378E E80E00                  	call	SetSFTTimes
 22934 00003791 B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 22935 00003794 E8A1FE                  	call	CloseEntry
 22936                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22937 00003797 9C                      	PUSHF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 22938 00003798 E81617                  	call	DEV_OPEN_SFT	;PTM.  increment device count	;AN000;
 22939 0000379B 9D                      	POPF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 22940                                  	;call	LCritDisk	;PTM.				;AN000;
 22941                                  	; 18/12/2022
 22942 0000379C E926E1                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 22943                                  ;localcommit_retn:
 22944                                  ;	retn

 22946                                  ;Break	<SetSFTTimes - signal a change in the times for an SFT>
 22947                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22948                                  ;
 22949                                  ; Procedure Name : SetSFTTimes
 22950                                  ;
 22951                                  ;   SetSFTTimes - Examine the flags for a SFT and set the time appropriately.
 22952                                  ;   Reflect these times in other SFT's for the same file.
 22953                                  ;
 22954                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:DI point to SFT
 22955                                  ;		BX = sf_flags set appropriately
 22956                                  ;   Outputs:	Set sft times to current time if File & dirty & !nodate
 22957                                  ;   Registers modified: All except ES:DI, BX, AX
 22958                                  ;
 22959                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22960                                  
 22961                                  	; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22962                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM

 22964                                  SetSFTTimes:
 22965                                  
 22966                                  ; 04/02/2024
 22967                                  %if 0
 22968                                  ;	File clean or device does not get stamped nor disk looked at.
 22969

 22973                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device

 22975                                  	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 22976

 22983                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_close_nodate
 22984                                  	;retnz				; nodate => no timestamp

 22986                                  %else

 22991 000037A3 75E2                    	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 22992                                  %endif
 22993                                  
 22994 000037A5 50                      	push	ax
 22995 000037A6 53                      	push	bx
 22996 000037A7 E8A7D3                  	call	DATE16			; Date/Time to AX/DX
 22997                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Fh],ax
 22998 000037AA 2689450F                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_date],AX
 22999                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Dh],dx
 23000 000037AE 2689550D                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_time],DX
 23001 000037B2 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 23002                                  ;if installed
 23003                                  	;call	JShare + 14 * 4
 23004 000037B4 FF1E[C800]              	call	far [JShare+(14*4)]	; 14 = ShSU
 23005                                  ;else
 23006                                  ;	call	ShSU
 23007                                  ;endif
 23008 000037B8 5B                      	pop	bx
 23009 000037B9 58                      	pop	ax

 23034                                  ;BREAK <DOS_MkDir - Make a directory entry>
 23035                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23036                                  ;
 23037                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_MkDir
 23038                                  ;
 23039                                  ; Inputs:
 23040                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 23041                                  ;		terminated)
 23042                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 23043                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 23044                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 23045                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 23046                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 23047                                  ; Function:
 23048                                  ;	Make a new directory
 23049                                  ; Returns:
 23050                                  ;	Carry Clear
 23051                                  ;		No error
 23052                                  ;	Carry Set
 23053                                  ;	    AX is error code
 23054                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 23055                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 23056                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 23057                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 23058                                  ;		error_access_denied
 23059                                  ;			Already exists, device name
 23060                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 23061                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23062                                  
 23063                                  ;hkn; called from path.asm. DS already set up.
 23064                                  
 23065                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23066                                  ; DOSCODE:6FC6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23067                                  
 23068                                  ; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 23069                                  ; DOSCODE:78FFh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)

 23081                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 23082                                  			; SDA first filename pointer -> fully-qualified directory name
 23083                                  			; SDA CDS pointer -> current directory
 23084                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 23085                                  			; CF clear if successful

 23317                                  ;BREAK <DOS_ChDir -- Verify a directory>
 23318                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23319                                  ;
 23320                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ChDir
 23321                                  ;
 23322                                  ; Inputs:
 23323                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 23324                                  ;		terminated)
 23325                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string

 23683                                  ;	TITLE	DISK - Disk utility routines
 23684                                  ;	NAME	Disk
 23685                                  
 23686                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 23687                                  ;
 23688                                  ;	SWAPCON
 23689                                  ;	SWAPBACK
 23690                                  ;	DOS_READ
 23691                                  ;	DOS_WRITE
 23692                                  ;	get_io_sft

 23694                                  ;	FIRSTCLUSTER
 23695                                  ;	SET_BUF_AS_DIR

 23697                                  ;	DREAD
 23698                                  ;	CHECK_WRITE_LOCK
 23699                                  ;	CHECK_READ_LOCK

 23701                                  ;	Revision history:
 23702                                  ;
 23703                                  ;		A000   version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 23704                                  ;
 23705                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23706                                  ;
 23707                                  ; M065 : B#5276. On raw read/write of a block of characters if a critical
 23708                                  ;		error happens, DOS retries the entire block assuming that
 23709                                  ;		zero characters were transferred. Modified the code to take
 23710                                  ;		into account the number of characters transfered before
 23711                                  ;		retrying the operation.
 23712                                  ;

 23714                                  ;

 23717                                  
 23718                                  ;Break	<SwapCon, Swap Back - Old-style I/O to files>
 23719                                  
 23720                                  ; **** Drivers for file input from devices ****
 23721                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23722                                  ;   Indicate that there is no more I/O occurring through another SFT outside
 23723                                  ;   of handles 0 and 1
 23724                                  ;
 23725                                  ;   Inputs:	DS is DOSDATA
 23726                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set to false.
 23727                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 23728                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23729

 23731                                  
 23732                                  ; DOSCODE:71E3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23733                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23734

 23736                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 23776                                  ; DOSCODE:71FDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23777                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23778                                  
 23779                                  ;Break	<DOS_READ -- MAIN READ ROUTINE AND DEVICE IN ROUTINES>
 23780                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23781                                  ;
 23782                                  ; Inputs:
 23783                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 23784                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 23785                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to read
 23786                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 23787                                  ; Function:
 23788                                  ;	Perform read operation
 23789                                  ; Outputs:
 23790                                  ;    Carry clear
 23791                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 23792                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes read
 23793                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 23794                                  ;    Carry set
 23795                                  ;	AX is error code
 23796                                  ;	CX = 0
 23797                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 23798                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 23799                                  ;
 23800                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23801                                  
 23802                                  ;hkn; called from fcbio.asm, handle.asm and dev.asm. DS is be set up.
 23803                                  
 23804                                  ; DOSCODE:71E9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23805                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23806                                  
 23807                                  ; 07/02/2024
 23808                                  ; 06/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 23809                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7B76h
 23810                                  
 23811                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7997h)
 23812                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:71FDh)
 23813                                  
 23814                                  DOS_READ:
 23815 00003A02 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 23816                                  
 23817                                  ; Verify that the sft has been opened in a mode that allows reading.
 23818

 24344                                  ;Break	<DOS_WRITE -- MAIN WRITE ROUTINE AND DEVICE OUT ROUTINES>
 24345                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24346                                  ;
 24347                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_WRITE
 24348                                  ;
 24349                                  ; Inputs:
 24350                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 24351                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 24352                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to write
 24353                                  ; Function:
 24354                                  ;	Perform write operation
 24355                                  ;	NOTE: If CX = 0 on input, file is truncated or grown
 24356                                  ;		to current sf_position
 24357                                  ; Outputs:
 24358                                  ;    Carry clear
 24359                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 24360                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes written
 24361                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24362                                  ;    Carry set
 24363                                  ;	AX is error code
 24364                                  ;	CX = 0
 24365                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24366                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 24367                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24368                                  	
 24369                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24370                                  ; DOSCODE:742Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24371                                  
 24372                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24373                                  ; DOSCODE:7418h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24374                                  
 24375                                  ; 08/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24376                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7D8Fh
 24377                                  
 24378                                  DOS_WRITE:
 24379 00003C03 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 24380                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 24381 00003C07 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 24382                                  	;;and	al,0Fh
 24383                                  	;AND	AL,access_mask
 24384                                  	; 07/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 24385                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 & Win Me)

 24390                                  BadMode:
 24391 00003C11 E96304                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR
 24392                                  
 24393                                  ; NOTE: The following check for writting to a Read Only File is performed
 24394                                  ;	    ONLY on FCBs!!!!
 24395                                  ;	We ALLOW writes to Read Only files via handles to allow a CREATE
 24396                                  ;	    of a read only file which can then be written to.
 24397                                  ;	This is OK because we are NOT ALLOWED to OPEN a RO file via handles
 24398                                  ;	    for writting, or RE-CREATE an EXISTING RO file via handles. Thus,
 24399                                  ;	    CREATing a NEW RO file, or RE-CREATing an existing file which
 24400                                  ;	    is NOT RO to be RO, via handles are the only times we can write
 24401                                  ;	    to a read-only file.
 24402                                  
 24403                                  Check_FCB_RO:
 24404                                  	;;test	word [es:di+2],8000h
 24405                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],sf_isFCB
 24406                                  	;JZ	short WRITE_NO_MODE	; Not an FCB
 24407                                  	
 24408                                  	;test	byte [es:di+3],80h
 24409 00003C14 26F6450380              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode+1],(sf_isFCB>>8)
 24410 00003C19 7407                    	JZ	short WRITE_NO_MODE	; Not an FCB
 24411                                  
 24412                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],1
 24413 00003C1B 26F6450401              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr],attr_read_only
 24414 00003C20 75EF                    	JNZ	short BadMode 		; Can't write to Read_Only files via FCB

 24417 00003C25 E80BDC                  	call	IsSFTNet
 24418 00003C28 7406                    	JZ	short LOCAL_WRITE
 24419                                  
 24420                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 24421                                  ;	transfer NET_WRITE
 24422                                  ;ELSE
 24423                                  	;mov	ax,1109h
 24424 00003C2A B80911                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|9
 24425 00003C2D CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - WRITE TO REMOTE FILE
 24426                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 24427                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 24428                                  			; CX = number of bytes, SS = DOS CS, SDA DTA field -> user buffer
 24429                                  			; Return: CF set on error, CX = bytes written
 24430 00003C2F C3                      	retn
 24431                                  ;ENDIF

 24673                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24674                                  ;
 24675                                  ; Procedure Name : get_io_sft
 24676                                  ;
 24677                                  ;   Convert JFN number in BX to sf_entry in DS:SI We get the normal SFT if
 24678                                  ;   CONSWAP is FALSE or if the handle desired is 2 or more. Otherwise, we
 24679                                  ;   retrieve the sft from ConSFT which is set by SwapCon.
 24680                                  ;
 24681                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24682                                  
 24683                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24684                                  ; DOSCODE:7583h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24685                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24686                                  ; DOSCODE:756Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24687                                  
 24688                                  GET_IO_SFT:
 24689                                  	;test	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0FFh
 24690 00003D54 36803E[5703]00          	cmp	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0			;smr;SS Override
 24691 00003D5A 7512                    	JNZ	short GetRedir
 24692                                  GetNormal:
 24693 00003D5C 16                      	push	ss
 24694 00003D5D 1F                      	pop	ds
 24695 00003D5E 06                      	PUSH	ES
 24696 00003D5F 57                      	PUSH	DI

 24699 00003D65 8CC6                    	MOV	SI,ES
 24700 00003D67 8EDE                    	MOV	DS,SI
 24701 00003D69 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 24702                                  RET44P:

 24713                                  
 24714                                  ;Break	<DIRREAD -- READ A DIRECTORY SECTOR>
 24715                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24716                                  ;
 24717                                  ; Procedure Name : DIRREAD
 24718                                  ;
 24719                                  ; Inputs:
 24720                                  ;	AX = Directory block number (relative to first block of directory)
 24721                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 24722                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = First sector of first cluster of directory
 24723                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster
 24724                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 24725                                  ; Function:
 24726                                  ;	Read the directory block into [CURBUF].
 24727                                  ; Outputs:
 24728                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM] = Next cluster (after the one skipped to)
 24729                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] Set
 24730                                  ;	ES:BP unchanged
 24731                                  ;	[CURBUF] Points to Buffer with dir sector
 24732                                  ;	Carry set if error (user said FAIL to I 24)
 24733                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed.
 24734                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24735                                  
 24736                                  ;hkn; called from dir.asm. DS already set up to DOSDATA.
 24737                                  
 24738                                  ; 08/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24739                                  
 24740                                  DIRREAD:
 24741                                  
 24742                                  ; Note that ClusFac is the sectors per cluster. This is NOT necessarily
 24743                                  ; the same as what is in the DPB! In the case of the root directory, we have
 24744                                  ; ClusFac = # sectors in the root directory. The root directory is detected
 24745                                  ; by DIRStart = 0.
 24746                                  
 24747 00003D7A 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX
 24748                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 24749 00003D7C 3916[DC0A]              	cmp	[DIRSTART_HW],dx
 24750 00003D80 7509                    	jnz	short SubDir
 24751                                  	;CMP	word [DIRSTART],0
 24752                                  	; 21/09/2023
 24753 00003D82 3916[C205]              	cmp	[DIRSTART],dx ; 0
 24754 00003D86 7503                    	jnz	short SubDir
 24755 00003D88 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 24756 00003D89 EB0C                    	JMP	short DoRead
 24757                                  
 24758                                  ; Convert the sector number in AX into cluster and sector-within-cluster pair
 24759                                  
 24760                                  SubDir:
 24761 00003D8B 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 24762                                  	;and	dl,[es:bp+4]
 24763 00003D8D 26225604                	AND	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]

 24769 00003D95 D3E8                    	SHR	AX,CL
 24770                                  
 24771                                  ;	(DX) = position in cluster
 24772                                  ;	(AX) = number of clusters to skip
 24773                                  
 24774                                  DoRead:

 24776 00003D9B 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX

 24778                                  
 24779                                  ;	(CX) = number of clusters to skip.
 24780                                  ;	(AH) = remainder
 24781

 24783

 24980                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24981                                  ;
 24982                                  ; Procedure Name : DREAD
 24983                                  ;
 24984                                  ; Inputs:
 24985                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 24986                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 24987                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	      (LOW)
 24988                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 24989                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 24990                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case call to HARDERR needed
 24991                                  ; Function:
 24992                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk read. If BIOS reports
 24993                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 24994                                  ; Outputs:
 24995                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILED to INT 24)
 24996                                  ; DS,ES:BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 24997                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 25000                                  DREAD:

 25002 00003E7C 7497                    	jz	short dirread_retn	; Carry clear
 25003                                  ;hkn; SS override

 25005 00003E84 E89A00                  	call	HARDERRRW

 25007 00003E89 74EE                    	JZ	short DREAD

 25047                                  CHECK_WRITE_LOCK:

 25049                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],8
 25050 00003E99 26F6450408              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr],attr_volume_id ;volume id

 25052                                  	;;call	SET_ACC_ERR_DS

 25060                                  	;call	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25061                                  	;retn
 25062                                  	; 16/12/2022
 25063 00003EA0 E9D201                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25064                                  
 25065                                  write_cont:				;
 25066 00003EA3 51                      	PUSH	CX			;save reg
 25067 00003EA4 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;
 25068 00003EA6 7501                    	JNZ	short Not_Truncate	;
 25069 00003EA8 49                      	dec	cx			;(cx) = -1; check for lock on whole file
 25070                                  Not_Truncate:				;
 25071 00003EA9 B080                    	MOV	AL,80H			;check write access
 25072 00003EAB E87541                  	call	LOCK_CHECK		;check lock
 25073 00003EAE 59                      	POP	CX			;restore reg
 25074 00003EAF 7305                    	JNC	short WRITE_OK		;lock ok
 25075 00003EB1 E87301                  	call	WRITE_LOCK_VIOLATION	;issue I24
 25076 00003EB4 73ED                    	JNC	short write_cont	;retry
 25077                                  WRITE_OK:				;

 25127                                  ;	TITLE	DISK2 - Disk utility routines
 25128                                  ;	NAME	Disk2
 25129                                  
 25130                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 25131                                  ;
 25132                                  ;	DskRead
 25133                                  ;	DWRITE
 25134                                  ;	DSKWRITE
 25135                                  ;	HarderrRW
 25136                                  ;	SETUP
 25137                                  ;	BREAKDOWN
 25138                                  ;	READ_LOCK_VIOLATION
 25139                                  ;	WRITE_LOCK_VIOLATION
 25140                                  ;	DISKREAD
 25141                                  ;	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25142                                  ;	SET_ACC_ERR
 25143                                  ;	SETSFT
 25144                                  ;	SETCLUS
 25145                                  ;	AddRec
 25146                                  ;
 25147                                  ;	Revision history:
 25148                                  ;
 25149                                  ;		AN000 version 4.00 Jan. 1988
 25150                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk read/write optimization
 25151                                  
 25152                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25153                                  ; DOSCODE:7699h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 25154                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 25155                                  ; DOSCODE:7685h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 25156                                  
 25157                                  ;Break	<DSKREAD -- PHYSICAL DISK READ>
 25158                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25159                                  ;
 25160                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKREAD
 25161                                  ;
 25162                                  ; Inputs:
 25163                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 25164                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25165                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25166                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25167                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25168                                  ; Function:
 25169                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 25170                                  ; Outputs:
 25171                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 25172                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 25173                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 25174                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 25175                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)
 25176                                  ; SI Destroyed, others preserved
 25177                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25178                                  
 25179                                  DSKREAD:
 25180 00003ECE 51                      	PUSH	CX
 25181                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; 04/05/2019
 25182 00003ECF 268A6617                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 25183                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+1]
 25184 00003ED3 268A4601                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 25185 00003ED7 53                      	PUSH	BX
 25186 00003ED8 06                      	PUSH	ES
 25187 00003ED9 E8D710                  	call	SETREAD
 25188 00003EDC EB22                    	JMP	short DODSKOP
 25189                                  
 25190                                  ;Break	<DWRITE -- SEE ABOUT WRITING>
 25191                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25192                                  ;
 25193                                  ; Procedure Name : DWRITE
 25194                                  ;
 25195                                  ; Inputs:
 25196                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 25197                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25198                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25199                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25200                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25201                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case HARDERR called
 25202                                  ; Function:
 25203                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk write. If BIOS reports
 25204                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 25205                                  ; Output:
 25206                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently, user FAILed to I 24)
 25207                                  ; BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 25208                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25209                                  
 25210                                  	;entry	DWRITE
 25211                                  DWRITE:
 25212 00003EDE E81100                  	CALL	DSKWRITE
 25213 00003EE1 74EA                    	jz	short dw_ret_label	; Carry clear (retz)
 25214                                  
 25215                                  ;hkn; SS override
 25216 00003EE3 36C606[7505]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:READOP],1	; Write
 25217 00003EE9 E83500                  	call	HARDERRRW
 25218 00003EEC 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1			; Check for retry
 25219 00003EEE 74EE                    	JZ	short DWRITE
 25220                                  
 25221                                  ; 09/02/2024
 25222                                  %if 0
 25223                                  	CMP	AL,3			; Check for FAIL
 25224                                  	CLC
 25225                                  	JNZ	short NO_CAR2 		; Ignore
 25226                                  	STC
 25227                                  NO_CAR2:
 25228                                  dw_ret_label:
 25229                                  	retn
 25230                                  %else
 25231                                  	; 09/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 25232 00003EF0 EB99                    	jmp	short fail_ignore
 25233                                  %endif
 25234                                  
 25235                                  ;Break	<DSKWRITE -- PHYSICAL DISK WRITE>
 25236                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25237                                  ;
 25238                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKWRITE
 25239                                  ;
 25240                                  ; Inputs:
 25241                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 25242                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25243                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25244                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25245                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25246                                  ; Function:
 25247                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 25248                                  ; Outputs:
 25249                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 25250                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 25251                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 25252                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 25253                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)
 25254                                  ; SI Destroyed, others preserved
 25255                                  ;
 25256                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25257                                  
 25258                                  	;entry	DSKWRITE
 25259                                  DSKWRITE:
 25260 00003EF2 51                      	PUSH	CX
 25261                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; 04/05/2019

 25349                                  ;Break	<SETUP -- SETUP A DISK READ OR WRITE FROM USER>
 25350                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25351                                  ;
 25352                                  ; Procedure Name : SETUP
 25353                                  ;
 25354                                  ; Inputs:
 25355                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT (value also in THISSFT)
 25356                                  ;	DMAAdd contains transfer address
 25357                                  ;	CX = Byte count
 25358                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 25359                                  ;   WARNING Stack must be clean, two ret addrs on stack, 1st of caller,
 25360                                  ;		2nd of caller of caller.
 25361                                  ; Outputs:
 25362                                  ;	    CX = byte count
 25363                                  ;	    [THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters if file
 25364                                  ;		      = Pointer to device header if device or NET
 25365                                  ;	    ES:DI Points to SFT
 25366                                  ;	    [NEXTADD] = Displacement of disk transfer within segment
 25367                                  ;	    [TRANS] = 0 (No transfers yet)
 25368                                  ;	    BytPos = Byte position in file
 25369                                  ;
 25370                                  ;	The following fields are relevant to local files (not devices) only:
 25371                                  ;
 25372                                  ;	    SecPos = Position of first sector (local files only)
 25373                                  ;	    [BYTSECPOS] = Byte position in first sector (local files only)
 25374                                  ;	    [CLUSNUM] = First cluster (local files only)
 25375                                  ;	    [SECCLUSPOS] = Sector within first cluster (local files only)
 25376                                  ;	    [THISDRV] = Physical unit number (local files only)
 25377                                  ;
 25378                                  ;      RETURNS ONE LEVEL UP WITH:
 25379                                  ;	   CX = 0
 25380                                  ;	   CARRY = Clear
 25381                                  ;	IF AN ERROR IS DETECTED
 25382                                  ; All other registers destroyed
 25383                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25384                                  
 25385                                  ;hkn; called from disk.asm. DS has been set up to DOSDATA.
 25386                                  
 25387                                  ; DOSCODE:770Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)

 26109                                  ; 25/07/2018
 26110                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 26111                                  ;Break   <DskRdBufScan -- Disk Read Buffer Scan>
 26112                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26113                                  ;
 26114                                  ; Procedure Name : DskRdBufScan
 26115                                  ;
 26116                                  ; Inputs:
 26117                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors read. (These constitute a block of
 26118                                  ;            sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
 26119                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
 26120                                  ;       [TEMP_VAR2]:[TEMP_VAR] = Transfer address (destination data address).
 26121                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
 26122                                  ;
 26123                                  ; Function:
 26124                                  ;	The Buffer Queue is scanned: the contents of any dirty buffers are
 26125                                  ;	"read" into the transfer memory block, so that the transfer memory
 26126                                  ;	reflects the most recent data.
 26127                                  ;
 26128                                  ; Outputs:
 26129                                  ;       Transfer memory updated as required.
 26130                                  ;
 26131                                  ; Uses:
 26132                                  ;       DS,AX,BX,CX,SI,DI destroyed.
 26133                                  ;       SS override for all global variables.
 26134                                  ;
 26135                                  ; Notes:
 26136                                  ;       FIRST_BUFF_ADDR is set-up to contain the LAST buffer to check, rather
 26137                                  ;	than the FIRST.
 26138                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26139                                  ;M039: Created
 26140                                  
 26141                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26142                                  ; DOSCODE:78F0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 26143                                  
 26144                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 26145                                  ; DOSCODE:78DCh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 26146                                  
 26147                                  ; 09/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26148                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8313h
 26149                                  
 26150                                  ;procedure DskRdBufScan,NEAR
 26151                                  ;
 26152                                  ;ASSUME  DS:NOTHING
 26153                                  
 26154                                  DskRdBufScan:
 26155 00004160 36833E[7100]00          	cmp	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount],0 ; Any dirty buffers?
 26156 00004166 743C                    	je	short bufx		     ; -no, skip all work.
 26157                                  
 26158 00004168 368B1E[0706]            	mov     bx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]
 26159 0000416D 89DE                    	mov     si,bx
 26160 0000416F 01D1                    	add     cx,dx
 26161 00004171 83D600                  	adc     si,0
 26162                                  
 26163 00004174 E8A223                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;DS:DI -> 1st buf in queue.
 26164                                  	;mov	ax,[di+2]
 26165 00004177 8B4502                  	mov     ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]
 26166 0000417A 36A3[1711]              	mov     [ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],ax
 26167                                  		
 26168                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 26169                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 26170                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.DRIVE]
 26171                                  	; 15/12/2022
 26172 0000417E 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 26173                                  
 26174                                  ;       BX:DX = Extent start.
 26175                                  ;       SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 26176                                  ;          AL = Drive #.
 26177                                  ;       DS:DI-> 1st buffer in queue.
 26178                                  ;[FIRST_BUFF_ADDR] = Address offset of last buffer in queue.
 26179                                  
 26180                                  bufq:	
 26181                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 26182 00004182 3A4504                  	cmp     al,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID] ;Same drive?
 26183 00004185 7514                    	jne	short bufq1        	;  -no, jump.
 26184                                  
 26185                                  ;       Cmp32   bx,dx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 26186                                  ;       ja	short bufq1		;Jump if Extent start > buffer sector.
 26187                                  
 26188                                  	;cmp	bx,[di+8]
 26189 00004187 3B5D08                  	cmp	bx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 26190 0000418A 7503                    	jne	short bufq01
 26191                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 26192 0000418C 3B5506                  	cmp	dx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 26193                                  bufq01:
 26194 0000418F 770A                    	ja	short bufq1
 26195                                  
 26196                                  ;       Cmp32   si,cx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 26197                                  ;       ja	short bufq2		;Jump if Extent end >= buffer sector.
 26198                                  
 26199                                  	;cmp	si,[di+8]
 26200 00004191 3B7508                  	cmp	si,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 26201 00004194 7503                    	jne	short bufq02
 26202                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+6]
 26203 00004196 3B4D06                  	cmp	cx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 26204                                  bufq02:
 26205 00004199 770A                    	ja	short bufq2
 26206                                  bufq1:	
 26207 0000419B 363B3E[1711]            	cmp     di,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR]	;Scanned entire buffer queue?
 26208 000041A0 8B3D                    	mov	di,[di]
 26209                                  	;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ; Set-up for next buffer.
 26210 000041A2 75DE                    	jne	short bufq		; -no, do next buffer
 26211                                  bufx:
 26212 000041A4 C3                      	retn				;Exit.
 26213                                  
 26214                                  ;       Buffer's sector is in Extent: if it is dirty, copy its contents to
 26215                                  ;	transfer memory; otherwise, just re-position it in the buffer queue

 26237                                  ;            block. (Note: the upper word of the sector # may be ignored

 26296                                  ;       DS:DI -> current buffer.
 26297                                  bufq3:

 26309                                  	;jmp	short bufx
