 27314                                  ;Break   <DskWrtBufPurge -- Disk Write Buffer Purge>
 27315                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27316                                  ;
 27317                                  ; Procedure Name : DskWrtBufPurge
 27318                                  ;
 27319                                  ; Inputs:
 27320                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors to write. (These constitute a block of
 27321                                  ;	     sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
 27322                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
 27323                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
 27324                                  ;
 27325                                  ; Function:
 27326                                  ;       Purge the Buffer Queue and the Secondary Cache of any buffers which
 27327                                  ;	are in Extent; they are being over-written.
 27328                                  ;
 27329                                  ; Outputs:
 27330                                  ;       (Same as Input.)
 27331                                  ; Uses:
 27332                                  ;       All registers except DS,AX,SI,DI preserved.
 27333                                  ;       SS override for all global variables.
 27334                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27335                                  ;M039: Created
 27336                                  
 27337                                  ;procedure   DskWrtBufPurge,NEAR
 27338                                  ;
 27339                                  ;ASSUME  DS:NOTHING
 27340                                  
 27341                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27342                                  ; DOSCODE:7C0Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27343                                  
 27344                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27345                                  ; DOSCODE:7BD4h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27346                                  
 27347                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 27348                                  ; DOSCODE:8714h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 27349                                  
 27350                                  ; NOTE: Secondary (Buffer) Cache is not used in PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 27351                                  
 27352                                  ; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:BB93h)
 27353                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - DOSCODE:7C0Eh)
 27354                                  
 27355                                  DskWrtBufPurge:
 27356                                  	;SaveReg <bx,cx>
 27357 00004530 53                      	push	bx
 27358 00004531 51                      	push	cx
 27359                                  
 27360 00004532 368B1E[0706]            	mov	bx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]	;BX:DX = Extent start (sector #).
 27361 00004537 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 27362 00004539 01D1                    	add	cx,dx
 27363 0000453B 83D600                  	adc	si,0                    ;SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 27364                                  
 27365                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27366                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 27367                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.DRIVE]
 27368                                  	; 15/12/2022
 27369 0000453E 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 27370                                  
 27371                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27372                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 27373                                  %if 0
 27374                                  
 27375                                  ;	BX:DX = Extent start.
 27376                                  ;	SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 27377                                  ;	AL = Drive #
 27378                                  
 27379                                  	cmp	word [ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT],0 ;Secondary cache in-use?
 27380                                  	je	short nosc		; -no, jump.
 27381                                  
 27382                                  ;	If any of the sectors to be written are in the secondary cache (SC),
 27383                                  ;	invalidate the entire SC. (This is an optimization; we really only
 27384                                  ;	need to invalidate those sectors which intersect, but that's slower.)
 27385                                  
 27386                                  	cmp	al,[ss:CurSC_DRIVE]	;Same drive?
 27387                                  	jne	short nosc		; -no, jump.
 27388                                  
 27389                                  	push    ax
 27390                                  	mov     ax,[ss:CurSC_SECTOR]
 27391                                  	mov     di,[ss:CurSC_SECTOR+2]	;DI:AX = SC start.
 27392                                  
 27393                                  	;Cmp32	si,cx,di,ax		;Extent end < SC start?
 27394                                  	;jbe	short sc5		; -yes, jump.
 27395                                  
 27396                                  	cmp	si,di
 27397                                  	jne	short sc01
 27398                                  	cmp	cx,ax
 27399                                  sc01: 
 27400                                  	jbe	short sc5
 27401                                  
 27402                                  	add	ax,[ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT]
 27403                                  	adc	di,0                    ;DI:AX = SC end + 1.
 27404                                  	
 27405                                  	;Cmp32	bx,dx,di,ax             ;Extent start > SC end?
 27406                                  	;jae	short sc5		; -yes, jump.
 27407                                  
 27408                                  	cmp	bx,di
 27409                                  	jne	short sc02
 27410                                  	cmp	dx,ax
 27411                                  sc02:
 27412                                  	jnb	short sc5
 27413                                  
 27414                                  	mov	word [ss:SC_STATUS],0	;Extent intersects SC: invalidate SC.
 27415                                  sc5:	
 27416                                  	pop     ax
 27417                                  
 27418                                  %endif
 27419                                  
 27420                                  ;	Free any buffered sectors which are in Extent; they are being over-
 27421                                  ;	written.
 27422                                  
 27423                                  nosc:	
 27424 00004542 E8D41F                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;DS:DI -> first buffer in queue.
 27425                                  
 27426                                  _bufq:	
 27427                                  	;cmpo	al,[di+4]
 27428 00004545 3A4504                  	cmp     al,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID] ;Same drive?
 27429 00004548 7527                    	jne	short bufq5		; -no, jump.
 27430                                  
 27431                                  ;       Cmp32   bx,dx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 27432                                  ;       ja	short bufq5		;Jump if Extent start > buffer sector.
 27433                                  
 27434                                  	;cmp	bx,[di+8]
 27435 0000454A 3B5D08                  	cmp	bx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 27436 0000454D 7503                    	jne	short bufq04
 27437                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 27438 0000454F 3B5506                  	cmp	dx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 27439                                  bufq04:
 27440 00004552 771D                    	ja	short bufq5
 27441                                  
 27442                                  ;       Cmp32   si,cx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 27443                                  ;       jbe	short bufq5		;Jump if Extent end < buffer sector.
 27444                                  
 27445                                  	;cmp	si,[di+8]
 27446 00004554 3B7508                  	cmp	si,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 27447 00004557 7503                    	jne	short bufq05
 27448                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+6]
 27449 00004559 3B4D06                  	cmp	cx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 27450                                  bufq05:
 27451 0000455C 7613                    	jbe	short bufq5
 27452                                  
 27453                                  ;	Buffer's sector is in Extent, so free it; it is being over-written.
 27454                                  
 27455                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 27456 0000455E F6450540                	test	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty ;Buffer dirty?
 27457 00004562 7403                    	jz	short bufq4		; -no, jump.
 27458 00004564 E8C922                  	call	DEC_DIRTY_COUNT		; -yes, decrement dirty count.
 27459                                  bufq4:
 27460                                  	;mov	word [di+4],20FFh
 27461 00004567 C74504FF20              	mov     word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],((buf_visit<<8)|0FFh)
 27462                                  
 27463 0000456C E8BC1F                  	call	SCANPLACE
 27464 0000456F EB02                    	jmp     short bufq6
 27465                                  bufq5: 
 27466 00004571 8B3D                    	mov     di,[di]
 27467                                  	;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 27468                                  bufq6: 
 27469 00004573 363B3E[1711]            	cmp	di,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR]	;Scanned entire buffer queue?
 27470 00004578 75CB                    	jne	short _bufq		; --no, go do next buffer.
 27471                                  	
 27472                                  	;RestoreReg <cx,bx>
 27473 0000457A 59                      	pop	cx
 27474 0000457B 5B                      	pop	bx
 27475 0000457C C3                      	retn
 27476                                  
 27477                                  ;EndProc DskWrtBufPurge
 27478                                  
 27479                                  ;Break   <DIV32 -- PERFORM 32 BIT DIVIDE>
 27480                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27481                                  ;
 27482                                  ; Procedure Name : DIV32
 27483                                  ;
 27484                                  ; Inputs:
 27485                                  ;       DX:AX = 32 bit dividend   BX= divisor
 27486                                  ; Function:
 27487                                  ;       Perform 32 bit division:  DX:AX/BX = CX:AX + DX (rem.)
 27488                                  ; Outputs:
 27489                                  ;       CX:AX = quotient , DX= remainder
 27490                                  ; Uses:
 27491                                  ;       All registers except AX,CX,DX preserved.
 27492                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27493                                  ;M039: DIV32 optimized for divisor of 512 (common sector size).
 27494                                  
 27495                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27496                                  ; DOSCODE:7C94h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27497                                  
 27498                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27499                                  ; DOSCODE:7C5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27500                                  
 27501                                  DIV32:
 27502 0000457D 81FB0002                	cmp	bx,512
 27503 00004581 7515                    	jne	short div5
 27504                                  
 27505 00004583 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 27506 00004585 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax           ; CX:AX = Dividend
 27507 00004587 81E2FF01                	and	dx,(512-1)      ; DX = Remainder
 27508 0000458B 88E0                    	mov	al,ah
 27509 0000458D 88CC                    	mov	ah,cl
 27510 0000458F 88E9                    	mov	cl,ch
 27511 00004591 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 27512 00004593 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 27513 00004595 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 27514 00004597 C3                      	retn
 27515                                  div5:	
 27516 00004598 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 27517 0000459A 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx
 27518 0000459C 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27519 0000459E F7F3                    	div	bx              ; 0:AX/BX
 27520 000045A0 91                      	xchg	cx,ax
 27521 000045A1 F7F3                    	div	bx              ; DX:AX/BX
 27522 000045A3 C3                      	retn
 27523                                  
 27524                                  ;Break   <SHR32 -- PERFORM 32 BIT SHIFT RIGHT>
 27525                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27526                                  ;
 27527                                  ; Procedure Name : SHR32
 27528                                  ;
 27529                                  ; Inputs:
 27530                                  ;	DX:AX = 32 bit sector number
 27531                                  ; Function:
 27532                                  ;       Perform 32 bit shift right
 27533                                  ; Outputs:
 27534                                  ;	AX = cluster number
 27535                                  ;	ZF = 1 if no error
 27536                                  ;	   = 0 if error (cluster number > 64k)
 27537                                  ; Uses:
 27538                                  ;       DX,CX
 27539                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27540                                  ; M017	- SHR32 rewritten for better performance
 27541                                  ; M039	- Additional optimization
 27542                                  
 27543                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27544                                  ; DOSCODE:7CBBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27545                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27546                                  ; DOSCODE:7C81h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27547                                  
 27548                                  SHR32:
 27549                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 27550 000045A4 268A4E05                	mov	cl,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 27551 000045A8 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch	    ;ZF=1
 27552 000045AA E306                    	jcxz	norota
 27553                                  rotashft2:
 27554 000045AC D1EA                    	shr	dx,1	    ;ZF reflects state of DX.
 27555 000045AE D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1	    ;ZF not affected.
 27556 000045B0 E2FA                    	loop	rotashft2
 27557                                  norota:
 27558 000045B2 C3                      	retn
 27559                                  
 27560                                  ;============================================================================
 27561                                  ; DIR.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 27562                                  ;============================================================================
 27563                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27564                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27565                                  
 27566                                  ;	TITLE	DIR - Directory and path cracking
 27567                                  ;	NAME	Dir
 27568                                  
 27569                                  ;Break	<FINDENTRY -- LOOK FOR AN ENTRY>
 27570                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27571                                  ;
 27572                                  ; Procedure Name : FINDENTRY,SEARCH
 27573                                  ;
 27574                                  ; Inputs:
 27575                                  ;	[THISDPB] set
 27576                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 27577                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Starting directory sector number
 27578                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster of directory
 27579                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 27580                                  ;	[NAME1] = Name to look for
 27581                                  ; Function:
 27582                                  ;	Find file name in disk directory.
 27583                                  ;	"?" matches any character.
 27584                                  ; Outputs:
 27585                                  ;	Carry set if name not found
 27586                                  ;	ELSE
 27587                                  ;	Zero set if attributes match (always except when creating)
 27588                                  ;	AH = Device ID (bit 7 set if not disk)
 27589                                  ;	[THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters
 27590                                  ;	DS = DOSGROUP
 27591                                  ;	ES = DOSGROUP
 27592                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer into directory buffer
 27593                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:SI = Pointer to First Cluster field in directory entry
 27594                                  ;	[CURBUF] has directory record with match
 27595                                  ;	[NAME1] has file name
 27596                                  ;	[LASTENT] is entry number of the entry
 27597                                  ; All other registers destroyed.
 27598                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27599                                  
 27600                                  ;hkn; called from rename.asm and dir2.asm. DS must be already set up at
 27601                                  ;hkn; this point.
 27602                                  
 27603                                  SEARCH:
 27604                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27605                                  	; DOSCODE:7C90h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27606                                  
 27607                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27608                                  	; DOSCODE:7CCAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27609                                  
 27610                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27611                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 45B3h
 27612                                  	; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 27613                                  
 27614                                  	; 24/01/2024
 27615                                  
 27616                                  	; 13/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27617                                  	; DOSCODE:8797h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 27618                                  
 27619                                  	;entry	FindEntry
 27620                                  FINDENTRY:
 27621 000045B3 E8DE05                  	call	STARTSRCH
 27622 000045B6 A0[6B05]                	MOV	AL,[ATTRIB]
 27623                                  	;and	al,9Eh
 27624 000045B9 24DE                    	AND	AL,~attr_ignore		; Ignore useless bits
 27625                                  	;cmp	al,8
 27626 000045BB 3C08                    	CMP	AL,attr_volume_id	; Looking for vol ID only ?
 27627 000045BD 7503                    	JNZ	short NOTVOLSRCH	; No
 27628 000045BF E83402                  	CALL	SETROOTSRCH		; Yes force search of root
 27629                                  NOTVOLSRCH:
 27630 000045C2 E84C01                  	CALL	GETENTRY
 27631                                  	;JNC	short SRCH
 27632                                  	;JMP	SETESRET
 27633                                  	; 24/01/2024
 27634 000045C5 724F                    	jc	short SETESRET
 27635                                  
 27636                                  	;entry	Srch
 27637                                  SRCH:
 27638                                  	;;;
 27639                                  	; 13/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 27640 000045C7 C706[A50A]0000          	mov     word [LNE_COUNT],0	; reset long name entry count
 27641                                  SRCH2:
 27642                                  	;;;
 27643                                  
 27644 000045CD 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 27645 000045CE 8E1E[E405]              	MOV	DS,[CURBUF+2]
 27646                                  
 27647                                  ;	(DS:BX) = directory entry address
 27648                                  
 27649 000045D2 8A27                    	mov	ah,[BX]

 27803                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27804                                  ;
 27805                                  ; Procedure Name : MetaCompare
 27806                                  ;
 27807                                  ; Inputs:
 27808                                  ;	DS:SI -> 11 character FCB style name NO '?'
 27809                                  ;	    Typically this is a directory entry. It MUST be in upper case
 27810                                  ;	ES:DI -> 11 character FCB style name with possible '?'
 27811                                  ;	    Typically this is a FCB or SFT. It MUST be in upper case
 27812                                  ; Function:
 27813                                  ;	Compare FCB style names allowing for ? match to any char
 27814                                  ; Outputs:
 27815                                  ;	Zero if match else NZ
 27816                                  ; Destroys CX,SI,DI all others preserved
 27817                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27818                                  
 27819                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27820                                  	; DOSCODE:7D3Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27821                                  
 27822                                  MetaCompare:
 27823 0000468B B90B00                  	MOV	CX,11
 27824                                  WILDCRD:
 27825 0000468E F3A6                    	REPE	CMPSB
 27826 00004690 7407                    	JZ	short MetaRet 		; most of the time we will fail.
 27827                                  CHECK_META:
 27828 00004692 26807DFF3F              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1],"?"
 27829 00004697 74F5                    	JZ	short WILDCRD
 27830                                  MetaRet:
 27831 00004699 C3                       	retn				; Zero set, Match

 27874 000046B0 750F                    	jnz	short nextentry_cont
 27875 000046B2 833E[DC0A]00            	cmp	word [DIRSTART_HW],0

 27877                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:bp+9]

 27880                                  	;jmp	short GETENT
 27881 000046BD 7255                    	jb	short GETENT
 27882                                  NONE:		; 14/02/2024
 27883 000046BF F9                      	stc
 27884 000046C0 C3                      	retn
 27885

 27887                                  	;;;

 27892 000046CB 7223                    	JB	short SAMECLUS

 27976                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27977                                  ;
 27978                                  ; Procedure Name : GETENTRY
 27979                                  ;
 27980                                  ; Inputs:
 27981                                  ;	[LASTENT] has directory entry
 27982                                  ;	ES:BP points to drive parameters
 27983                                  ;	[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[ENTLAST] set for DIR involved
 27984                                  ; Function:
 27985                                  ;	Locates directory entry in preparation for search
 27986                                  ;	GETENT provides entry for passing desired entry in AX
 27987                                  ; Outputs:
 27988                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer to next directory entry in CURBUF
 27989                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:DX = Pointer to first byte after end of CURBUF
 27990                                  ;	[LASTENT] = New directory entry number
 27991                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS] set via DIRREAD
 27992                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 27993                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27994                                  
 27995                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27996                                  GETENTRY:
 27997                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27998 00004711 A1[4803]                	MOV	AX,[LASTENT]
 27999                                  
 28000                                  	;entry	GETENT
 28001                                  GETENT:
 28002 00004714 A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 28003                                  ;
 28004                                  ; Convert the entry number in AX into a byte offset from the beginning of the
 28005                                  ; directory.
 28006                                  ;
 28007 00004717 B105                    	mov	cl,5			; shift left by 5 = mult by 32
 28008 00004719 D3C0                    	rol	ax,cl			; keep hight order bits
 28009 0000471B 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 28010                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28011                                  	;and	ax,0FFE0h
 28012                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28013                                  	;and	ax,~(32-1)		; mask off high order bits
 28014                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28015 0000471D 24E0                    	and	al,0E0h ; ~31
 28016 0000471F 83E21F                  	and	dx,1Fh
 28017                                  	;and	dx,32-1			; mask off low order bits
 28018                                  ;
 28019                                  ; DX:AX contain the byte offset of the required directory entry from the
 28020                                  ; beginning of the directory. Convert this to a sector number. Round the
 28021                                  ; sector size down to a multiple of 32.
 28022                                  ;
 28023                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+2]
 28024 00004722 268B5E02                	MOV	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 28025 00004726 80E3E0                  	and	bl,0E0h
 28026                                  	;AND	BL,255-31		; Must be multiple of 32
 28027 00004729 F7F3                    	DIV	BX
 28028                                  	; 14/02/2024
 28029                                  	;MOV	BX,DX			; Position within sector
 28030                                  				; NOTE: This BX value is not used in DIRREAD
 28031                                  				; Erdogan Tan - 14/02/2024
 28032                                  	;PUSH	BX
 28033 0000472B 52                      	push	dx
 28034                                  	;
 28035 0000472C E84BF6                  	call	DIRREAD
 28036 0000472F 5B                      	POP	BX
 28037                                  	;retc
 28038 00004730 72BD                    	jc	short nextentry_retn
 28039                                  SETENTRY:
 28040 00004732 8B16[E205]              	MOV	DX,[CURBUF]
 28041                                  	;;;add	dx,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 28042                                  	;;add	dx,20 ; MSDOS 6.0 
 28043                                  	;add	dx,24 ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 14/02/2024	
 28044 00004736 83C218                  	ADD	DX,BUFINSIZ
 28045 00004739 01D3                    	ADD	BX,DX
 28046                                  	;add	dx,[es:bp+2]
 28047 0000473B 26035602                	ADD	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]  ; Always clears carry
 28048                                  	; 29/12/2022
 28049                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS contains a 'CLC' here, at DOSCODE:7E15h
 28050                                  	; 27/06/2024
 28051                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM contains 'CLC' here, at DOSCODE:8931h
 28052 0000473F F8                      	clc
 28053 00004740 C3                      	retn
 28054                                  
 28055                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28056                                  
 28057                                  ; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28058                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8933h
 28059                                  
 28060                                  sft_fcb_table:
 28061 00004741 00<rep 14h>             	times 20 db 0
 28062                                  sftfcb.cluster:
 28063 00004755 00000000                	dd	0
 28064                                  sftfcb.direntry:
 28065 00004759 0000                    	dw	0
 28066                                  sftfcb_entry_size equ $ - sftfcb.cluster ; = 6
 28067                                  
 28068 0000475B 00<rep 72h>             	times 114 db 0	; 6*20 = 120 ; entry size = 6 bytes 
 28069                                  
 28070                                  SRCH_CLUSTER:
 28071 000047CD 0000                    	dw	0
 28072                                  SRCH_CLUSTER_HW:
 28073 000047CF 0000                    	dw	0

 28077                                  ;Break	<SETDIRSRCH SETROOTSRCH -- Set Search environments>
 28078                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28079                                  ;
 28080                                  ; Procedure Name : SETDIRSRCH,SETROOTSRCH
 28081                                  ;
 28082                                  ; Inputs:
 28083                                  ;	BX cluster number of start of directory
 28084                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28085                                  ;	DI next cluster number from fastopen extended info. DOS 3.3 only
 28086                                  ; Function:
 28087                                  ;	Set up a directory search
 28088                                  ; Outputs:
 28089                                  ;	[DIRSTART] = BX
 28090                                  ;	[CLUSFAC],[CLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC] set
 28091                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28092                                  ; destroys AX,DX,BX
 28093                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28094                                  
 28095                                  	;;;
 28096                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28097                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:89C3h
 28098                                  	;;;
 28099                                  SETDIRSRCH:
 28100 000047D1 A1[EE0A]                	mov	ax,[ROOTCLUST_HW]

 28103 000047D6 7504                    	jnz	short SETDIRSRCH_FAT32
 28104

 28110 000047DC A3[DC0A]                	mov	[DIRSTART_HW],ax

 28112                                  
 28113 000047E2 891E[C205]              	mov	[DIRSTART],bx
 28114                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]

 28116                                  	;inc	al
 28117 000047EA 40                      	inc	ax
 28118 000047EB A2[7705]                	mov	[CLUSFAC],al
 28119                                  
 28120 000047EE 56                      	push	si
 28121                                  
 28122                                  	; 03/03/2025 (MiniDOS)
 28123                                  	;;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],2
 28124                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success
 28125                                  	;jnz	short UNP_OK
 28126

 28129                                  
 28130 000047F4 5E                      	pop	si
 28131 000047F5 C3                      	retn

 28452                                  ;============================================================================
 28453                                  ; DIR2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 28454                                  ;============================================================================
 28455                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28456                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28457                                  ; 14/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28458                                  
 28459                                  ;	TITLE	DIR2 - Directory and path cracking
 28460                                  ;	NAME	Dir2
 28461                                  
 28462                                  ;Break	<GETPATH -- PARSE A WFP>
 28463                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28464                                  ;
 28465                                  ; Procedure Name : GETPATH
 28466                                  ;
 28467                                  ; Inputs:
 28468                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:\" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 28469                                  ;		terminated; d:/ (note forward slash) indicates a real device).
 28470                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28471                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28472                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28473                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28474                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 28475                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28476                                  ;	[THISDPB] set to DPB if disk otherwise garbage.
 28477                                  ; Function:
 28478                                  ;	Crack the path
 28479                                  ; Outputs:
 28480                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk if disk file
 28481                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Unk if char device
 28482                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28483                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28484                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28485                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28486                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28487                                  ;	   Zero set
 28488                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28489                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28490                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28491                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28492                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28493                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28494                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28495                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28496                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path or attribute mismatch
 28497                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28498                                  ;	ELSE
 28499                                  ;	   [CurBuf] = -1 if root directory
 28500                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28501                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28502                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points into [CURBUF] to dir_first field for entry
 28503                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28504                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28505                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28506                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28507                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28508                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28509                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28510                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it.
 28511                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28512                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28513                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28514                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28515                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28516                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28517                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28518                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28519                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 28520                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28521                                  
 28522                                  ;hkn; called from delete.asm, finfo.asm, mknode.asm and rename.asm.
 28523                                  ;hkn; DS already set up at this point.
 28524                                  
 28525                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28526                                  
 28527                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28528                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8B99h
 28529                                  
 28530                                  GETPATH:
 28531                                  	;mov	word [CREATING],0E500h
 28532 0000497E C706[7E05]00E5          	MOV	WORD [CREATING],DIRFREE*256+0 ; Not Creating, not DEL *.*
 28533                                  
 28534                                  ; Same as GetPath only CREATING and DELALL already set
 28535                                  
 28536                                  	;entry	GetPathNoSet
 28537                                  GetPathNoSet:
 28538                                  	;;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 28539                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 28540                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28541 00004984 E850C9                  	call	set_exerr_locus_disk
 28542                                  	;
 28543 00004987 C706[E205]FFFF          	MOV	word [CURBUF],-1	; initial setting
 28544                                  
 28545                                  ; See if the input indicates a device that has already been detected. If so,
 28546                                  ; go build the guy quickly. Otherwise, let findpath find the device.
 28547                                  
 28548 0000498D 8B3E[B205]              	MOV	DI,[WFP_START]		; point to the beginning of the name
 28549                                  	;cmp	word [DI+1],5C3Ah
 28550                                  	;CMP	WORD [DI+1],'\' << 8 + ':'
 28551 00004991 817D013A5C              	cmp	word [DI+1],':\'
 28552 00004996 7435                    	JZ	short CrackIt
 28553                                  
 28554                                  ; Let ChkDev find it in the device list
 28555                                  
 28556 00004998 83C703                  	ADD	DI,3
 28557                                  	; 18/08/2018
 28558                                  	;MOV	SI,DI			; let CHKDEV see the original name
 28559                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28560                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28561                                  	;mov	si,di ; not required ! (it is written in CHKDEV proc already!)
 28562 0000499B E87300                  	CALL	CHKDEV
 28563 0000499E 722B                    	JC	short InternalError
 28564                                  
 28565                                  Build_devJ:
 28566 000049A0 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 28567 000049A3 A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 28568                                  	; 15/02/2024
 28569                                  	;;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 28570                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; In the particular case of
 28571                                  					; "finding" a char device
 28572                                  					; set LOCUS to Unknown. This makes
 28573                                  					; certain idiotic problems reported
 28574                                  					; by a certain 3 letter OEM go away.
 28575                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28576 000049A6 E825C9                  	call	set_exerr_locus_unk
 28577                                  
 28578                                  ; Take name in name1 and pack it back into where wfp_start points. This
 28579                                  ; guarantees wfp_start pointing to a canonical representation of a device.
 28580                                  ; We are allowed to do this as GetPath is *ALWAYS* called before entering a
 28581                                  ; wfp into the share set.
 28582                                  ;
 28583                                  ; We copy chars from name1 to wfp_start remembering the position of the last
 28584                                  ; non-space seen +1.  This position is kept in DX.
 28585                                  
 28586                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 28587 000049A9 16                      	push	ss
 28588 000049AA 07                      	pop	es

 28592 000049AE 8B3E[B205]              	mov	di,[WFP_START]

 28595                                  MoveLoop:

 28604

 28606                                  ; at this point.

 28625                                  	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]	; get current directory pointer

 28645

 28648                                  ;      has been uncertainly changed.
 28649                                  ; SI = offset in DOSGroup into path to end of current directory text. This
 28650                                  ;      may be -1 if no current directory part has been used.
 28651

 28653 000049EB 740A                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; then we must crack from root
 28654                                  	;;;

 28658                                  	; 03/03/2025 (MiniDOS)

 28662

 28668                                  ; 03/03/2025 (MiniDOS)

 28700                                  					; Go to Got_Srch_cluster

 28718                                  	;;; 15/02/2024

 28724                                  	POP	CX

 28728                                  %endif

 28730                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 28731                                  ;
 28732                                  ; We must cract the path beginning at the root. Advance pointer to beginning
 28733                                  ; of path and go crack from root.
 28734                                  
 28735                                  NO_CURR_D:
 28736 000049F7 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 28737                                  	;LEA	SI,[SI+3]		; Skip "d:/"
 28738                                  	; 15/02/2024

 28740 000049FE C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 28741 00004A02 EB37                    	JMP	short ROOTPATH
 28742                                  
 28743                                  ; We are able to crack from the current directory part. Go set up for search
 28744                                  ; of specified cluster.
 28745                                  
 28746                                  GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER:
 28747 00004A04 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 28748 00004A08 E8C6FD                  	call	SETDIRSRCH
 28749                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 28750                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 28751                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28752 00004A0B 733E                    	jnc	short FINDPATH ; 17/08/2018
 28753                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28754                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 28755                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 28756                                  SETFERR:
 28757 00004A0D 30C9                    	XOR	CL,CL			; set zero
 28758 00004A0F F9                      	STC
 28759 00004A10 C3                      	retn
 28760                                  
 28761                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28762                                  ;
 28763                                  ; Procedure Name : ChkDev
 28764                                  ;
 28765                                  ; Check to see if the name at DS:DI is a device. Returns carry set if not a
 28766                                  ;   device.
 28767                                  ; Blasts CX,SI,DI,AX,BX
 28768                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28769                                  
 28770                                  CHKDEV:
 28771 00004A11 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 28772                                  	;MOV	DI,SS
 28773                                  	;MOV	ES,DI
 28774                                  	; 27/06/2024
 28775 00004A13 16                      	push	ss
 28776 00004A14 07                      	pop	es
 28777                                  
 28778 00004A15 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28779 00004A18 B90900                  	MOV	CX,9
 28780                                  TESTLOOP:
 28781 00004A1B E8D80F                  	call	GETLET
 28782                                  
 28783 00004A1E 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'
 28784 00004A20 740E                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 28785 00004A22 E82510                  	call	PATHCHRCMP
 28786 00004A25 7407                    	JZ	short NOTDEV
 28787 00004A27 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 28788 00004A29 7405                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 28789

 28791 00004A2C E2ED                    	LOOP	TESTLOOP
 28792                                  NOTDEV:
 28793 00004A2E F9                      	STC
 28794 00004A2F C3                      	retn
 28795                                  
 28796                                  TESTDEVICE:
 28797                                  	;ADD	CX,2
 28798                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28799 00004A30 41                      	inc	cx
 28800 00004A31 41                      	inc	cx
 28801 00004A32 B020                    	MOV	AL,' '
 28802 00004A34 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28803                                  	;MOV	AX,SS
 28804                                  	;MOV	DS,AX
 28805                                  	; 27/06/2024
 28806 00004A36 16                      	push	ss
 28807 00004A37 1F                      	pop	ds
 28808                                  	;call	DEVNAME
 28809                                  	;retn
 28810                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28811 00004A38 E97A01                  	jmp	DEVNAME
 28812                                  
 28813                                  ;Break	<ROOTPATH, FINDPATH -- PARSE A PATH>
 28814                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28815                                  ;
 28816                                  ; Procedure Name : ROOTPATH,FINDPATH
 28817                                  ;
 28818                                  ; Inputs:
 28819                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but,
 28820                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path which is assumed to start at
 28821                                  ;		the root (no leading '/').
 28822                                  ; Function:
 28823                                  ;	Search from root for path
 28824                                  ; Outputs:
 28825                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but:
 28826                                  ;	If root directory specified, [CURBUF] and [NAME1] are NOT set, and
 28827                                  ;	[NoSetDir] is ignored.
 28828                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28829                                  
 28830                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28831                                  	; DOSCODE:7F47h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28832                                  
 28833                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28834                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8C9Dh
 28835                                  
 28836                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:7F82h)
 28837                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:829Eh)
 28838                                  
 28839                                  ROOTPATH:
 28840 00004A3B E8B8FD                  	call	SETROOTSRCH
 28841                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28842 00004A3E 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 28843                                  	;CMP	BYTE [SI],0
 28844 00004A40 3824                    	cmp	[si],ah ; 0
 28845 00004A42 7507                    	JNZ	short FINDPATH
 28846                                  
 28847                                  	;;;
 28848                                  	;; 15/02/2024
 28849                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:82A6h
 28850                                  	;mov	word [CURBUF],0FFFFh
 28851                                  	;;;
 28852                                  
 28853                                  ; Root dir specified
 28854 00004A44 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 28855 00004A47 A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 28856                                  	; 24/09/2023
 28857                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; Sets "device ID" byte, sets zero
 28858                                  					; (dir), clears carry.
 28859 00004A4A C3                      	retn
 28860                                  
 28861                                  ; Inputs:
 28862                                  ;	[ATTRIB] Set to get through directories
 28863                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Set to find last element
 28864                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28865                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path (no leading '/').
 28866                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 28867                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Phys sec # of first sector of directory
 28868                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Cluster # of next cluster
 28869                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors per cluster
 28870                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28871                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28872                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28873                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28874                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28875                                  ;	[CREATING] and [DELALL] set
 28876                                  ; Function:
 28877                                  ;	Parse path name
 28878                                  ; Outputs:
 28879                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28880                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28881                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28882                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
 28883                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28884                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28885                                  ;	   Zero set
 28886                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28887                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28888                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28889                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28890                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28891                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28892                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28893                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28894                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path
 28895                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28896                                  ;	ELSE
 28897                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28898                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28899                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points to fcb_FIRCLUS field for entry
 28900                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28901                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28902                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28903                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28904                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28905                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28906                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28907                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it,
 28908                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28909                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28910                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28911                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28912                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28913                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28914                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28915                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28916                                  ; Destroys all other registers
 28917                                  
 28918                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28919                                  	; DOSCODE:7F58h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 28920                                  
 28921                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28922                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8CAEh
 28923                                  
 28924                                      	;entry	FINDPATH
 28925                                  FINDPATH:
 28926 00004A4B 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 28927 00004A4C 56                      	PUSH	SI
 28928 00004A4D 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 28929 00004A4F 8B0E[C205]              	MOV	CX,[DIRSTART]		; Get start clus of dir being searched
 28930 00004A53 833E[B605]FF            	CMP	word [CURR_DIR_END],-1
 28931 00004A58 7415                    	JZ	short NOIDS		; No current dir part
 28932 00004A5A 3B3E[B605]              	CMP	DI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 28933 00004A5E 750F                    	JNZ	short NOIDS		; Not to current dir end yet
 28934 00004A60 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 28935                                  	;;;
 28936                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28937 00004A64 A1[DC0A]                	mov	ax,[DIRSTART_HW]
 28938                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 28939 00004A67 2689454B                	mov	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],ax
 28940                                  	;;;
 28941                                  	;mov	[es:di+73],cx
 28942 00004A6B 26894D49                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],CX	; Set current directory cluster
 28943                                  NOIDS:
 28944                                  
 28945                                  ; Parse the name off of DS:SI into NAME1. AL = 1 if there was a meta
 28946                                  ; character in the string. CX,DI may be destroyed.
 28947                                  ;
 28948                                  ;	invoke	NAMETRANS
 28949                                  ;	MOV	CL,AL
 28950                                  ;
 28951                                  ; The above is the slow method. The name has *already* been munged by
 28952                                  ; TransPath so no special casing needs to be done. All we do is try to copy
 28953                                  ; the name until ., \ or 0 is hit.
 28954                                  
 28955                                  	;MOV	AX,SS
 28956                                  	;MOV	ES,AX
 28957                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28958 00004A6F 16                      	push	ss
 28959 00004A70 07                      	pop	es
 28960                                  
 28961                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 28962 00004A71 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28963 00004A74 B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  ' ; 2020h
 28964 00004A77 AA                      	STOSB
 28965 00004A78 AB                      	STOSW
 28966 00004A79 AB                      	STOSW
 28967 00004A7A AB                      	STOSW
 28968 00004A7B AB                      	STOSW
 28969 00004A7C AB                      	STOSW
 28970                                  
 28971                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 28972 00004A7D BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 28973 00004A80 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; bits for CL
 28974                                  GetNam:
 28975                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28976                                  	;INC	CL ; ?*! ; MSDOS 6.0	;AN000; KK increment volid count
 28977                                  
 28978                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28979                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28980                                  	;inc	cl ; not required !
 28981                                  	
 28982 00004A82 AC                      	LODSB
 28983 00004A83 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'	; 2Eh
 28984 00004A85 7412                    	JZ	short _SetExt
 28985 00004A87 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 28986 00004A89 7424                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 28987 00004A8B 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 28988 00004A8D 7420                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 28989 00004A8F 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'	; 3Fh
 28990 00004A91 7503                    	JNZ	short StoNam
 28991 00004A93 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 28992                                  StoNam: 
 28993 00004A96 AA                      	STOSB
 28994 00004A97 EBE9                    	JMP	short GetNam
 28995                                  _SetExt:
 28996 00004A99 BF[5305]                	MOV	DI,NAME1+8
 28997                                  GetExt:
 28998 00004A9C AC                      	LODSB
 28999 00004A9D 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29000 00004A9F 740E                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29001 00004AA1 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 29002 00004AA3 740A                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29003 00004AA5 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'
 29004 00004AA7 7503                    	JNZ	short StoExt
 29005 00004AA9 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 29006                                  StoExt: 
 29007 00004AAC AA                      	STOSB
 29008 00004AAD EBED                    	JMP	short GetExt
 29009                                  _GetDone:
 29010 00004AAF 4E                      	DEC	SI
 29011 00004AB0 88E1                    	MOV	CL,AH  ; 0 or 1 ; 29/12/2022
 29012 00004AB2 80C980                  	OR	CL,80H
 29013 00004AB5 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of this element
 29014 00004AB6 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 29015 00004AB7 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 29016 00004AB9 7503                    	JNZ	short check_device
 29017 00004ABB E9B700                  	JMP	_BADPATH		; NUL parse (two delims most likely)
 29018                                  check_device:
 29019 00004ABE 56                      	PUSH	SI			; Start of next element
 29020                                  	;MOV	AL,[SI]
 29021                                  	; 15/02/2024
 29022 00004ABF 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29023                                  	; 23/09/2023
 29024                                  	;cmp	byte [si],0
 29025 00004AC1 7508                    	JNZ	short NOT_LAST
 29026                                  
 29027                                  ; for last element of the path switch to the correct search attributes
 29028                                  
 29029 00004AC3 8A3E[6D05]              	MOV	BH,[SATTRIB]
 29030 00004AC7 883E[6B05]              	MOV	[ATTRIB],BH
 29031                                  
 29032                                  NOT_LAST:
 29033                                  
 29034                                  ; check name1 to see if we have a device...
 29035                                  
 29036 00004ACB 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 29037                                  
 29038                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 29039                                  	;context ES
 29040 00004ACC 16                      	push	ss
 29041 00004ACD 07                      	pop	es
 29042 00004ACE E8E400                  	call	DEVNAME 		; blast BX
 29043 00004AD1 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 29044 00004AD2 7208                    	JC	short FindFile		; Not a device
 29045 00004AD4 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL			; Test next char again
 29046                                  	;JZ	short GO_BDEV
 29047                                  	;JMP	FILEINPATH		; Device name in middle of path
 29048                                  	; 27/06/2024
 29049 00004AD6 7528                    	jnz	short FILEINPATH_j
 29050                                  
 29051                                  GO_BDEV:
 29052 00004AD8 5E                      	POP	SI			; Points to NUL at end of path

 29338                                  ;

 29358                                  ;Break <DevName - Look for name of device>

 29360                                  ;
 29361                                  ; Procedure Name : DevName
 29362                                  ;
 29363                                  ; Inputs:
 29364                                  ;	DS,ES:DOSDATA

 29366                                  ;	ATTRIB set so that we can error out if looking for Volume IDs
 29367                                  ; Function:
 29368                                  ;	Determine if file is in list of I/O drivers
 29369                                  ; Outputs:
 29370                                  ;	Carry set if not a device
 29371                                  ;	ELSE
 29372                                  ;	Zero flag set
 29373                                  ;	BH = Bit 7,6 = 1, bit 5 = 0 (cooked mode)
 29374                                  ;	     bits 0-4 set from low byte of attribute word

 29377                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 29450                                  ;BREAK <Build_device_ent - Make a Directory entry>
 29451                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29452                                  ; Procedure Name : Build_device_ent
 29453                                  ;
 29454                                  ; Inputs:
 29455                                  ;	[NAME1] has name
 29456                                  ;	BH is attribute field (supplied by DEVNAME)
 29457                                  ;	[DEVPT] points to device header (supplied by DEVNAME)
 29458                                  ; Function:
 29459                                  ;	Build a directory entry for a device at DEVFCB
 29460                                  ; Outputs:

 29462                                  ;	SI points to dir_first field
 29463                                  ;	AH = input BH

 29524                                  ;Break	<ValidateCDS - given a CDS, validate the media and the current directory>
 29525                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29526                                  ;
 29527                                  ;   ValidateCDS - Get current CDS. Splice it. Call FatReadCDS to check
 29528                                  ;   media. If media has been changed, do DOS_Chdir to validate path.
 29529                                  ;   If invalid, reset original CDS to root.
 29530                                  ;
 29531                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisCDS points to CDS of interest
 29532                                  ;		SS:DI points to temp buffer
 29533                                  ;   Outputs:	The current directory string is validated on the appropriate
 29534                                  ;		    drive
 29535                                  ;		ThisDPB changed
 29536                                  ;		ES:DI point to CDS
 29537                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)

 29722                                  ; 28/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29723                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - offset 43BDh
 29724                                  
 29725                                  ;Break	<CheckThisDevice - Check for being a device>
 29726                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29727                                  ;
 29728                                  ;   CheckThisDevice - Examine the area at DS:SI to see if there is a valid
 29729                                  ;   device specified. We will return carry if there is a device present. 
 29730                                  ;   The forms of devices we will recognize are:
 29731                                  ;
 29732                                  ;	[path]device
 29733                                  ;
 29734                                  ;   Note that the drive letter has *already* been removed. All other forms
 29735                                  ;   are not considered to be devices. If such a device is found we change
 29736                                  ;   the source pointer to point to the device component.
 29737                                  ;
 29738                                  ;   Inputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 29739                                  ;		DS:SI contains name
 29740                                  ;   Outputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 29741                                  ;		DS:SI point to name or device
 29742                                  ;		Carry flag set if device was found
 29743                                  ;		Carry flag reset otherwise
 29744                                  ;   Registers Modified: all except ES:DI, DS
 29745                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29746                                  
 29747                                  CheckThisDevice:
 29748 00004D0E 57                      	push	di
 29749 00004D0F 56                      	push	si
 29750 00004D10 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 29751                                  
 29752                                  ; Check for presence of \dev\ (Dam multiplan!)
 29753                                  
 29754 00004D12 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI]
 29755 00004D14 E8330D                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; is it a path char?
 29756 00004D17 7517                    	JNZ	short ParseDev		; no, go attempt to parse device
 29757 00004D19 46                      	INC	SI			; simulate LODSB
 29758                                  
 29759                                  ; We have the leading path separator. Look for DEV part.
 29760                                  
 29761 00004D1A AD                      	LODSW
 29762 00004D1B 0D2020                  	OR	AX,2020h
 29763 00004D1E 3D6465                  	cmp	ax,"de"
 29764                                  	;CMP	AX,"e"<< 8 + "d"
 29765 00004D21 752D                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; not "de", assume not device
 29766 00004D23 AC                      	LODSB
 29767 00004D24 0C20                    	OR	AL,20h
 29768 00004D26 3C76                    	CMP	AL,"v"                  ; Not "v", assume not device
 29769 00004D28 7526                    	JNZ	short NotDevice
 29770 00004D2A AC                      	LODSB
 29771 00004D2B E81C0D                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; do we have the last path separator?
 29772 00004D2E 7520                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; no. go for it.
 29773                                  
 29774                                  ; DS:SI now points to a potential drive. Preserve them as NameTrans advances
 29775                                  ; SI and DevName may destroy DS.
 29776                                  
 29777                                  ParseDev:
 29778 00004D30 1E                      	push	ds
 29779 00004D31 56                      	push	si			; preserve the source pointer
 29780 00004D32 E8590C                  	call	NameTrans		; advance DS:SI
 29781 00004D35 803C00                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0		; parse entire string?
 29782 00004D38 F9                      	STC				; simulate a Carry return from DevName
 29783 00004D39 750B                    	JNZ	short SkipSearch	; no parse. simulate a file return.
 29784                                  
 29785                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 29786 00004D3B 16                      	push	ss
 29787 00004D3C 1F                      	pop	ds
 29788                                  
 29789                                  ; M026 - start - fix ported from ROMDOS2 for bug # 2849
 29790                                  ;
 29791                                  ; SR;
 29792                                  ; We have to set Attrib before invoking DevName. Otherwise, the value from
 29793                                  ; a previous DOS call is used and DevName thinks it is not a device if the
 29794                                  ; old call set the volume attribute bit.
 29795                                  
 29796 00004D3D A0[6D05]                	mov	al,[SATTRIB]
 29797 00004D40 A2[6B05]                	mov	[ATTRIB],al		;set Attrib for DevName
 29798                                  
 29799                                  ; M026 - end
 29800                                  
 29801 00004D43 E86FFE                  	call	DEVNAME
 29802                                  
 29803                                  SkipSearch:
 29804 00004D46 5E                      	pop	si
 29805 00004D47 1F                      	pop	ds
 29806                                  
 29807                                  ; SI points to the beginning of the potential device. If we have a device
 29808                                  ; then we do not change SI. If we have a file, then we reset SI back to the
 29809                                  ; original value. At this point Carry set indicates FILE.
 29810                                  
 29811                                  CheckReturn:
 29812 00004D48 5F                      	pop	di			; get original SI
 29813 00004D49 7302                    	JNC	short Check_Done	; if device then do not reset pointer
 29814 00004D4B 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 29815                                  Check_Done:
 29816 00004D4D 5F                      	pop	di
 29817 00004D4E F5                      	CMC				; invert carry. Carry => device
 29818 00004D4F C3                      	retn
 29819                                  NotDevice:
 29820 00004D50 F9                      	STC
 29821 00004D51 EBF5                    	JMP	short CheckReturn
 29822

 29872                                  ;Break	<IOFUNC -- DO FUNCTION 1-12 I/O>
 29873                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29874                                  ;
 29875                                  ; Procedure Name : IOFUNC
 29876                                  ;
 29877                                  ; Inputs:
 29878                                  ;	DS:SI Points to SFT
 29879                                  ;	AH is function code
 29880                                  ;		= 0 Input
 29881                                  ;		= 1 Input Status
 29882                                  ;		= 2 Output
 29883                                  ;		= 3 Output Status
 29884                                  ;		= 4 Flush
 29885                                  ;		= 5 Input Status - System WAIT invoked for K09 if no char
 29886                                  ;				   present.
 29887                                  ;	AL = character if output
 29888                                  ; Function:
 29889                                  ;	Perform indicated I/O to device or file
 29890                                  ; Outputs:
 29891                                  ;	AL is character if input
 29892                                  ;	If a status call
 29893                                  ;		zero set if not ready
 29894                                  ;		zero reset if ready (character in AL for input status)
 29895                                  ; For regular files:
 29896                                  ;	Input Status
 29897                                  ;		Gets character but restores position
 29898                                  ;		Zero set on EOF
 29899                                  ;	Input
 29900                                  ;		Gets character advances position
 29901                                  ;		Returns ^Z on EOF
 29902                                  ;	Output Status
 29903                                  ;		Always ready
 29904                                  ; AX altered, all other registers preserved
 29905                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29906                                  
 29907                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 30499 00004FAC 53                      	push	bx

 30515 00004FB4 51                      	PUSH	CX
 30516 00004FB5 50                      	PUSH	AX

 30518                                  SETCALLHEAD:
