 35692 00005E1C 58                      	pop	ax
 35693 00005E1D 5E                      	pop	si
 35694 00005E1E 1F                      	pop	ds
 35695                                  Cleanup_retn:
 35696 00005E1F C3                      	retn
 35697                                  
 35698                                  	; The reply was IGNORE. See if we are allowed to ignore.
 35699                                  
 35700                                  CheckIgnore:
 35701                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],20h
 35702 00005E20 36F606[4B03]20          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_IGNORE ; Can we?
 35703                                  CheckRI:	; 29/02/2024
 35704 00005E26 74C9                    	jz	short DoFail			; No, do fail
 35705 00005E28 EBD6                    	jmp	short CleanUp
 35706                                  
 35707                                  	; The reply was RETRY. See if we are allowed to retry.
 35708                                  
 35709                                  CheckRetry:

 35713                                  	;JMP	short CleanUp
 35714                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35715 00005E30 EBF4                    	jmp	short CheckRI
 35716                                  	
 35717                                  	; The reply was ABORT.
 35718                                  DoAbort:
 35719 00005E32 16                      	push	ss
 35720 00005E33 1F                      	pop	ds
 35721                                  
 35722 00005E34 803E[5703]00            	CMP	byte [CONSWAP],0
 35723 00005E39 7403                    	JZ	short NOSWAP2
 35724 00005E3B E8AADB                  	call	SWAPBACK
 35725                                  NOSWAP2:

 35727                                  	; turn this abort into a fail.
 35728                                  
 35729                                  	;test	[fAborting],0FFh
 35730                                  	;jnz	short DoFail

 35736                                  
 35737 00005E45 C606[7C05]02            	MOV	BYTE [EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_HARD_ERROR ; 2
 35738 00005E4A 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 35739                                  
 35740                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 35741                                  	; the PDB as necessary.
 35742                                  
 35743 00005E4C E95410                  	jmp	exit_inner
 35744                                  
 35745                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35746                                  ;
 35747                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 35748                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 35749                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 35750                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 35751                                  ;
 35752                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 35753                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 35754                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 35755                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 35756                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 35757                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 35758                                  ;
 35759                                  ; output:   none.
 35760                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35761                                  
 35762                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 35763                                  	
 35764                                  reset_environment:
 35765                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35766                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 35767                                  
 35768                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 35769                                  
 35770 00005E4F 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 35771                                  
 35772                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter
 35773                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 35774                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 35775                                  
 35776 00005E50 B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 35777                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 35778                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 35779 00005E52 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 35780                                  
 35781                                  					; SS override
 35782 00005E54 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 35783                                  
 35784                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 35785                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 35786                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 35787                                  					; On process exit.
 35788 00005E5A B82211                  	mov	ax, 1122h
 35789 00005E5D CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PROCESS TERMINATION HOOK
 35790                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 35791                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 35792 00005E5F B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate
 35793 00005E61 E8F6B0                  	call	_$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR	; and who to go to
 35794                                  
 35795 00005E64 59                      	POP	CX			; get ThisPDB
 35796 00005E65 06                      	push	es
 35797 00005E66 53                      	push	bx			; save return address
 35798                                  
 35799 00005E67 368B1E[3003]            	MOV	BX,[SS:CurrentPDB] 	; get currentPDB
 35800 00005E6C 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX
 35801 00005E6E A11600                  	MOV	AX,[PDB.PARENT_PID]	; get parentPDB
 35802                                  
 35803                                  	; AX = parentPDB, BX = CurrentPDB, CX = ThisPDB
 35804                                  	; Only free handles if AX <> BX and BX = CX and [exit_code].upper
 35805                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process
 35806                                  	
 35807 00005E71 39D8                    	CMP	AX,BX
 35808 00005E73 7418                    	JZ	short reset_return	; parentPDB = CurrentPDB
 35809 00005E75 39CB                    	CMP	BX,CX
 35810 00005E77 7514                    	JNZ	short reset_return	; CurrentPDB <> ThisPDB
 35811 00005E79 50                      	PUSH	AX			; save parent
 35812                                  
 35813                                  					; SS override
 35814                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 35815 00005E7A 36803E[7C05]03          	CMP	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS ; 15/08/2018
 35816 00005E80 7406                    	JZ	short reset_to_parent 	; keeping this process
 35817                                  
 35818                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks
 35819                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 35820                                  
 35821                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process
 35822 00005E82 E85D10                  	call	arena_free_process
 35823                                  
 35824                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal
 35825                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that
 35826                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 35827                                  
 35828                                  	;invoke	DOS_ABORT
 35829 00005E85 E813D7                  	call	DOS_ABORT
 35830                                  
 35831                                  reset_to_parent:
 35832                                  					; SS override
 35833 00005E88 368F06[3003]            	POP	word [SS:CurrentPDB]	; set up process as parent
 35834                                  
 35835                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 35836                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA
 35837 00005E8D 16                      	push	ss
 35838 00005E8E 1F                      	pop	ds	
 35839                                  
 35840 00005E8F B0FF                    	MOV	AL,-1
 35841                                  
 35842                                  	; make sure that everything is clean In this case ignore any errors,
 35843                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.
 35844                                  
 35845                                  	;EnterCrit critDisk
 35846 00005E91 E804BA                  	call	ECritDisk
 35847                                  	;invoke	FLUSHBUF
 35848 00005E94 E86108                  	call	FLUSHBUF
 35849                                  	;LeaveCrit critDisk
 35850 00005E97 E82BBA                  	call	LCritDisk
 35851

 35856                                  
 35857                                  	call	CHECK_VIRT_OPEN
 35858                                  %endif
 35859                                  
 35860 00005E9A FA                      	CLI
 35861 00005E9B C606[2103]00            	MOV	BYTE [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 35862

 35864                                  	;;;

 35866                                  	;;;

 35874

 35879 00005EC3 E88FA5                  	call	restore_world
 35880

 35903

 35905 00005ED9 9F                      	LAHF

 35907 00005EDC 2402                    	AND	AL,2
 35908 00005EDE B4F2                    	MOV	AH,0F2h

 35916                                  	;PUSH	word [CS:EXITHOLD]
 35917

 35919 00005EE1 FF36[8205]              	PUSH	word [EXITHOLD+2]

 35927                                  
 35928 00005EF0 CF                      	IRET			; Long return back to user terminate address
 35929                                  
 35930                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35931                                  ;
 35932                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 35933                                  ;
 35934                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 35935                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 35936                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 35937                                  ;
 35938                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35939                                  
 35940                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 35941 00005EF1 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35942                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 35943 00005EF2 B8[BB0E]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 35944 00005EF5 2D[AB0E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 35945                                  					; Change to dosdata to access
 35946                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 35947                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35948                                  	
 35949                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35950 00005EF8 1E                      	push	ds
 35951                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 35952 00005EF9 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35953                                  
 35954                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate
 35955                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 35956                                  
 35957 00005EFE 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 35958 00005F00 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 35959 00005F02 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 35960                                  
 35961                                  	;MOV	AL,[CS:DI+ErrMap24]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 35962 00005F04 8A85[AB0E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 35963 00005F08 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 35964                                  NoTrans:
 35965                                  	;MOV	[CS:EXTERR],AX
 35966 00005F0A A3[2403]                	mov	[EXTERR],AX
 35967 00005F0D 1F                      	pop	ds
 35968                                  	;assume	ds:nothing
 35969 00005F0E 58                      	POP	AX
 35970                                  
 35971                                  	; Now Extended error is set correctly. Translate it to get correct
 35972                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.
 35973                                  
 35974 00005F0F 56                      	PUSH	SI
 35975                                  					; ERR_TABLE_24 is in DOSCODE 
 35976 00005F10 BE[5B0E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 35977 00005F13 E8ACA7                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields
 35978 00005F16 5E                      	POP	SI

 35981                                  ;============================================================================
 35982                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 35983                                  ;============================================================================
 35984                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35985                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35986                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35987                                  
 35988                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 35989                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 35990                                  
 35991                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 35992                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35993                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 35994                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 35995                                  ;
 35996                                  ;	IsEof
 35997                                  ;	UNPACK
 35998                                  ;	PACK
 35999                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 36000                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 36001                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 36002                                  ;	FAT_operation
 36003                                  ;
 36004                                  ;	Revision history:
 36005                                  ;
 36006                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 36007                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 36008                                  ;
 36009                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 36010                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 36011                                  
 36012                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36013                                  
 36014                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36015                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A40Ch
 36016                                  
 36017                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 36018                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36019                                  ;
 36020                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 36021                                  ;
 36022                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 36023                                  ;
 36024                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 36025                                  ;		BX has fat value
 36026                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 36027                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 36028                                  ;
 36029                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36030                                  
 36031                                  IsEOF:
 36032                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36033                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36034                                  	;;;
 36035 00005F18 E89801                  	call	IsFAT32			; is it FAT32 drive ?
 36036 00005F1B 730D                    	jnc	short IsEOF_FAT		; no, it has 12 or 16 bit FAT
 36037                                  
 36038                                  	; FAT32 fs
 36039 00005F1D 36813E[E80A]FF0F        	cmp	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW],0FFFh
 36040 00005F24 7503                    	jnz     short IsEOF_other1	; not EOF
 36041 00005F26 83FBF8                  	cmp     bx,0FFF8h		; 32 bit compare
 36042                                  IsEOF_other1:
 36043 00005F29 C3                      	retn 				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36044                                  
 36045                                  IsEOF_FAT:
 36046                                  	;;;
 36047                                  
 36048                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36049 00005F2A 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 36050 00005F30 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 36051                                  
 36052                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 36053                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 36054                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 36055                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 36056                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 36057                                  
 36058 00005F32 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 36059 00005F36 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 36060                                  
 36061 00005F38 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 36062                                  IsEOF_other:
 36063 00005F3C C3                      	retn
 36064                                  EOF16:
 36065 00005F3D 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 36066 00005F40 C3                      	retn				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36067                                  
 36068                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36069                                  
 36070                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36071                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36072                                  ;
 36073                                  ; Procedure Name : UNPACK
 36074                                  ;
 36075                                  ; Inputs:
 36076                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36077                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36078                                  ; Outputs:
 36079                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36080                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 36081                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36082                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 36083                                  ;
 36084                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36085                                  ;
 36086                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36087                                  
 36088                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36089                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A44Eh
 36090                                  	;
 36091                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS .SYS - DOSCODE:9511h)
 36092                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C368h)
 36093                                  
 36094                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36095                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36096                                  
 36097                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36098                                  UNPACK:
 36099                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 36100 00005F41 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 36101 00005F43 7519                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 36102                                  
 36103                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36104                                  %if 0
 36105                                  	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 36106                                  	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 36107                                  	retn				; done
 36108                                  %else
 36109                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A435h
 36110                                  	;;;
 36111                                  up_1:
 36112 00005F45 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 36113 00005F49 7513                    	jne	short up_cont
 36114 00005F4B 8B3E[350F]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 36115 00005F4F 09FF                    	or	di,di
 36116 00005F51 893E[EC0A]              	mov	[CCONTENT_HW],di
 36117 00005F55 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]
 36118 00005F59 7502                    	jnz	short unpack_retn
 36119 00005F5B 09FF                    	or	di,di
 36120                                  unpack_retn:
 36121 00005F5D C3                      	retn	; [CCONTENT_HW]:DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36122                                  	;;;	
 36123                                  
 36124                                  %endif
 36125                                  
 36126                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 36127                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36128                                  	;;;
 36129                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0

 36286                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36287                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36288                                  ;
 36289                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 36290                                  ;
 36291                                  ; Inputs:
 36292                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 36293                                  ;	DX = Data
 36294                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 36295                                  ; Outputs:
 36296                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 36297                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 36298                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36299                                  ;	No other registers affected
 36300                                  ;
 36301                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 36302                                  ;
 36303                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36304                                  
 36305                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36306                                  
 36307                                  	; INPUT:
 36308                                  	;  [CLUSDATA_HW]:DX = cluster data/content
 36309                                  	;  [CLUSTNUM_HW]:BX = cluster number (to be updated)
 36310                                  	;  ES:BP = pointer to DPB
 36311                                  
 36312                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36313                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36314                                  PACK:
 36315                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start
 36316 00005FF0 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we packing cluster 0
 36317 00005FF2 7513                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 36318                                  
 36319                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36320                                  %if 0
 36321                                  	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 36322                                  	retn				; done
 36323                                  %else
 36324                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36325                                  	;;;
 36326 00005FF4 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 36327 00005FF8 750D                    	jnz	short p_cont
 36328                                  
 36329                                  	;push	ax
 36330                                  	;mov	ax,[CLUSDATA_HW]	; Cluster Data/Content (High Word)
 36331                                  	;mov	[CL0FATENTRY_HW],ax
 36332                                  	;pop	ax
 36333 00005FFA FF36[EA0A]              	push	word [CLUSDATA_HW]
 36334 00005FFE 8F06[350F]              	pop	word [CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 36335                                  
 36336 00006002 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx
 36337 00006006 C3                      	retn
 36338                                  	;;;
 36339                                  %endif
 36340                                  
 36341                                  p_cont:					; M014 - end
 36342                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0

 36345 0000600C 8B35                    	MOV	SI,[DI]
 36346 0000600E 740B                    	JZ	short ALIGNED 		; byte (not nibble) aligned
 36347 00006010 51                      	PUSH	CX			; move data to upper 12 bits
 36348 00006011 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 36349 00006013 D3E2                    	SHL	DX,CL
 36350 00006015 59                      	POP	CX
 36351 00006016 83E60F                  	AND	SI,0FH			; leave in original low 4 bits
 36352 00006019 EB2B                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN
 36353                                  
 36354                                  ALIGNED:
 36355                                  
 36356                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36357                                  	;;;
 36358 0000601B E89500                  	call	IsFAT32
 36359 0000601E 7313                    	jnb	short p_fat
 36360                                  
 36361 00006020 368B36[EA0A]            	mov	si,[ss:CLUSDATA_HW]
 36362 00006025 337502                  	xor	si,[di+2]		; hw of cluster number
 36363                                  					; offset CLUSSAVE+2
 36364 00006028 81E6FF0F                	and	si,0FFFh
 36365 0000602C 317502                  	xor	[di+2],si
 36366 0000602F 8915                    	mov	[di],dx
 36367 00006031 EB17                    	jmp	short PACKIN2
 36368                                  p_fat:
 36369                                  	;;;
 36370                                  
 36371                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h

 36374 0000603B 81E600F0                	AND	SI,0F000h		; MZ leave in upper 4 bits of original

 36502                                  
 36503                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36504                                  
 36505                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 36506                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36507                                  ;
 36508                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 36509                                  ;
 36510                                  ; Inputs:
 36511                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 36512                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 36513                                  ; Function:
 36514                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 36515                                  ; Outputs:
 36516                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 36517                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 36518                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 36519                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 36520                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 36521                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 36522                                  ;
 36523                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36524                                  
 36525                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36526                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36527                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36528                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36529                                  
 36530                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36531                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A5D7h
 36532                                  
 36533                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 36534                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 36535 000060C8 C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 36536                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 36537 000060CD 50                      	push	ax
 36538 000060CE 53                      	push	bx
 36539 000060CF 51                      	push	cx
 36540 000060D0 52                      	push	dx
 36541                                  	; 02/03/2024
 36542                                  	;MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 36543                                  
 36544                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36545                                  	;;;
 36546                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36547 000060D1 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx
 36548 000060D3 8B16[E80A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36549                                  	;
 36550 000060D7 52                      	push	dx ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36551                                  	;
 36552 000060D8 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 36553 000060DA E8D6FF                  	call	IsFAT32
 36554 000060DD 730E                    	jnc	short mapcl1 ; not FAT32
 36555                                  	; FAT32
 36556 000060DF D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36557 000060E1 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36558 000060E3 D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36559 000060E5 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36560 000060E7 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36561 000060E9 D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36562                                  	; DI:DX:AX = 4*(DX:AX)
 36563 000060EB EB14                    	jmp	short Map16		; 32 bit FAT	
 36564                                  mapcl1:
 36565                                  	;;;
 36566 000060ED 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 36567                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36568                                  	;JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 36569                                  	;SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 36570                                  	;
 36571                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36572                                  	;;;
 36573 000060F3 7304                    	jae	short mapcl2		; 16 bit FAT
 36574                                  	; 12 bit FAT
 36575 000060F5 D1EA                    	shr	dx,1
 36576 000060F7 D1D8                    	rcr     ax,1
 36577                                  mapcl2:
 36578 000060F9 01D8                    	add     ax,bx
 36579 000060FB 1316[E80A]              	adc     dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36580 000060FF 11FF                    	adc	di,di
 36581                                  	;;;
 36582                                  Map16:	
 36583                                  
 36584                                  ; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36585                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36586                                  %if 0
 36587                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 36588                                  	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 36589                                  	
 36590                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36591                                  	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 36592                                  	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 36593                                  %endif
 36594                                  
 36595 00006101 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 36596                                  
 36597                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36598                                  ;
 36599                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 36600                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 36601                                  ;
 36602                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 36603                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 36604                                  ;
 36605                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 36606                                  
 36607 00006105 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 36608 00006109 751C                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 36609                                  
 36610                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36611                                  %if 0
 36612                                  	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 36613                                  	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 36614                                  	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 36615                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 36616                                  	;shr	al,1
 36617                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 36618                                  	shr	di,1			; 2
 36619                                  	rcr	al,1			; 2
 36620                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36621                                  	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 36622                                  %else
 36623                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36624                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36625                                  	;;;
 36626 0000610B 50                      	push	ax
 36627 0000610C D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36628 0000610E D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1
 36629 00006110 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 36630 00006112 88E0                    	mov	al,ah			; 9 bit shift to right
 36631 00006114 88D4                    	mov	ah,dl
 36632 00006116 88F2                    	mov	dl,dh
 36633 00006118 30F6                    	xor	dh,dh
 36634 0000611A D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36635 0000611C 10F6                    	adc	dh,dh
 36636 0000611E 87FA                    	xchg	dx,di		; DI:AX = sector contains requested cluster data
 36637 00006120 5A                      	pop	dx
 36638 00006121 81E2FF01                	and	dx,1FFh			; offset in sector
 36639                                  	;;;
 36640                                  %endif
 36641 00006125 EB07                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 36642                                  
 36643                                  _DoDiv:
 36644                                  ;ENDIF
 36645                                  
 36646                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36647                                  %if 0
 36648                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36649                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 36650                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36651                                  	mov	dx,di			; 2
 36652                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36653                                  	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 36654                                  %else
 36655                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36656                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36657                                  	;;;
 36658 00006127 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 36659 00006128 92                      	xchg	ax,dx
 36660 00006129 F7F1                    	div	cx
 36661 0000612B 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 36662 0000612C F7F1                    	div	cx
 36663                                  	;jmp	short DivDone
 36664                                  	;;;
 36665                                  %endif
 36666                                  
 36667                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36668                                  DivDone:
 36669                                  ;ENDIF
 36670                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 36671 0000612E 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 36672                                  	
 36673                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36674                                  	;;;
 36675 00006132 83D700                  	adc	di,0
 36676                                  	;;;
 36677                                  
 36678 00006135 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 36679                                  
 36680                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 36681                                  
 36682                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36683                                  	;;;
 36684 00006136 57                      	push	di ; 4*
 36685                                  	;;;
 36686 00006137 50                      	push	ax ; 3*
 36687 00006138 52                      	push	dx ; 2*

 36691                                  
 36692                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36693                                  	; mov [HIGH_SECTOR],di ; *!* ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36694 0000613C 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 36695                                  	;
 36696

 36698                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36699                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 36700                                  	;
 36701                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)

 36705                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *

 36707 0000613E E83D04                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *! ; *!* ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36708                                  
 36709                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 36710 00006141 59                      	pop	cx ; 1*

 36713                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 36716                                  	;;;

 36722                                  	;;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0

 36774                                  	;;;

 36781

 36820                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>

 36822                                  ;
 36823                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 36824                                  ;
 36825                                  ; Inputs:
 36826                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 36827                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 36828                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 36829                                  ; Function:
 36830                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 36831                                  ;	if disk changed.
 36832                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 36833                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 36834                                  ; Outputs:
 36835                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36836                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 36837                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 36838                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 36839                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 36840                                  ;
 36841                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36842                                  
 36843                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 36844 000061AA 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 36845                                  
 36846                                  fatread_gotdpb:	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36847                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36848                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36849                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36850 000061AE 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36851 000061B2 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36852 000061B5 E8BEA4                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 36853                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36854                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36855 000061B8 E99C00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36856                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 36857                                  	;retn
 36858                                  
 36859                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36860                                  ;
 36861                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 36862                                  ;
 36863                                  ; Inputs:
 36864                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 36865                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 36866                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 36867                                  ; Function:
 36868                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 36869                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 36870                                  ; Outputs:
 36871                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 36872                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 36873                                  ;	THISDRV set
 36874                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36875                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 36876                                  ;
 36877                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36878                                  
 36879                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36880                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36881                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36882                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36883                                  
 36884                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36885                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A6D8h
 36886                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C644h)
 36887                                  
 36888                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 36889 000061BB 06                      	PUSH	ES
 36890 000061BC 57                      	PUSH	DI
 36891                                  
 36892                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 36893 000061BD 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36894                                  
 36895                                  ; 03/03/2024
 36896                                  %if 0
 36897                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36898                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36899                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36900                                  	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36901                                  	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36902                                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 36903                                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36904                                  %else
 36905                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36906                                  	;;;
 36907 000061C1 E8EAFF                  	call	fatread_gotdpb
 36908                                  	;;;
 36909                                  %endif

 36911 000061C5 07                      	POP	ES

 36913 000061C8 7542                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 36914                                  
 36915                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 36916                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 36917                                  
 36918                                  MED_CHANGE:

 36923

 36927                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 36928 000061D4 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 36929                                  
 36930                                  ;hkn; SS override
 36931                                  
 36932                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 36933                                  ;
 36934                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 36935                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 36936                                  
 36937 000061D8 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 36938                                  frcd20: 
 36939                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 36940                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet

 36943                                  
 36944                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36945                                  	;push	es
 36946                                  	;push	di
 36947                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 36948                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36949                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 36950                                  	;pop	di
 36951                                  	;pop	es
 36952                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 36953                                  
 36954                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36955 000061E4 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36956 000061E8 751C                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 36957 000061EA 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 36958 000061EC 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 36959 000061F0 7514                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 36960

 36966                                  		; !!! jz short frcd25

 36969                                  		; jz short frcd25

 36972 000061F6 7506                    	jnz	short frcd24

 36975                                  	;;;

 36980                                  	;;;

 36984                                  	;;;

 36987                                  	;;;

 36989                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3

 36992 00006209 E2D2                    	LOOP	frcd20
 36993 0000620B 1F                      	POP	DS
 36994                                  NO_CHANGE:

 36996 00006210 F8                      	CLC
 36997 00006211 C3                      	retn

 36999                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 37000                                  ; 05/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0

 37002                                  ;;;
 37003                                  chk_set_first_access:

 37005 00006212 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0

 37021 00006233 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],1
 37022                                  chk_set_fa_3:
 37023 00006238 C3                      	retn
 37024                                  ;;;

 37034                                  
 37035                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 37040                                  FAT_operation:
 37041                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37042                                  FATERR:
 37043                                  
 37044                                  ; 03/03/2024
 37045                                  %if 0
 37046                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 37047                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 37048                                  	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 
 37049                                  					; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 37050                                  %else
 37051                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37052                                  	;;;
 37053 00006239 E8D6FF                  	call    chk_set_first_access
 37054                                  	;;;
 37055                                  %endif
 37056                                  	;and	di,0FFh
 37057 0000623C 81E7FF00                	AND	DI,STECODE		; Put error code in DI
 37058                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 37059 00006240 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 37060                                  	;mov	ah,1Ah
 37061 00006245 B41A                    	MOV	AH,2+Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY ; While trying to read FAT
 37062 00006247 A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Tell which drive
 37063 0000624A E8F2FA                  	call	FATAL1
 37064 0000624D C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 37065 00006251 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3

 37501 00006408 E92EFE                  	jmp	FATERR
 37502

 37602 000064A7 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx
 37603                                  gotgetbuf7:
 37604 000064A9 7308                    	jnb	short gotgetbuf8	; yes, invalid value (must be 0FFFFFFFFh)
 37605

 37724                                  ; BUF.ASM

 37726                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37727                                  ; Retro DOS v2.0 - 12/03/2018
 37728                                  ;
 37729                                  ; buffer management for MSDOS
 37730                                  ;
 37731                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'
 37732                                  ;       ASSUME  SS:DOSGROUP,CS:DOSGROUP
 37733                                  ;
 37734                                  ;SUBTTL SETVISIT,SKIPVISIT -- MANAGE BUFFER SCANS
 37735                                  ;
 37736                                  ;SETVISIT:
 37737                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37738                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 37739                                  ;; Inputs:
 37740                                  ;;      None
 37741                                  ;; Function:
 37742                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers
 37743                                  ;; Outputs:
 37744                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 37745                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 37746                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 37747                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 37748                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 37749                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37750                                  ;
 37751                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37752                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 37753                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37754                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 37755                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 37756                                  ;SETLOOP:
 37757                                  ;       ;;MOV	[DI+7],AL ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37758                                  ;	;and	[DI+5],al
 37759                                  ;	AND	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],AL
 37760                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 37761                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37762                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP
 37763                                  ;       POP     AX ; 09/09/2018
 37764                                  ;	LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37765                                  ;SVISIT_RETN:
 37766                                  ;       RETN
 37767                                  ;
 37768                                  ;SKIPVISIT:
 37769                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37770                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CC8h
 37771                                  ;
 37772                                  ;; Inputs:
 37773                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to a buffer
 37774                                  ;; Function:
 37775                                  ;;      Skip visited buffers
 37776                                  ;; Outputs:
 37777                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to next unvisited buffer
 37778                                  ;;      Zero is set if skip to LAST buffer
 37779                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37780                                  ;
 37781                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37782                                  ;       ;retz
 37783                                  ;       JZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37784                                  ;
 37785                                  ;	;;CMP	BYTE [DI+7],1 ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37786                                  ;       ;;;retnz
 37787                                  ;       ;;JNZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37788                                  ;
 37789                                  ;	;test	byte [di+5],20h
 37790                                  ;	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_visit	
 37791                                  ;	JNZ	short SKIPLOOP
 37792                                  ;	
 37793                                  ;	push	ax
 37794                                  ;	or	al,1
 37795                                  ;	pop	ax
 37796                                  ;	retn	
 37797                                  ;
 37798                                  ;SKIPLOOP:
 37799                                  ;	LDS     DI,[DI]
 37800                                  ;       JMP     SHORT SKIPVISIT
 37801                                  
 37802                                  ;============================================================================
 37803                                  ; BUF.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 37804                                  ;============================================================================
 37805                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37806                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37807                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 37808                                  
 37809                                  ;	TITLE	BUF - MSDOS buffer management
 37810                                  ;	NAME	BUF
 37811                                  
 37812                                  ;**	BUF.ASM - Low level routines for buffer cache management
 37813                                  ;
 37814                                  ;	GETCURHEAD
 37815                                  ;	ScanPlace
 37816                                  ;	PLACEBUF
 37817                                  ;	PLACEHEAD
 37818                                  ;	PointComp
 37819                                  ;	GETBUFFR
 37820                                  ;	GETBUFFRB
 37821                                  ;	FlushBuf
 37822                                  ;	BufWrite
 37823                                  ;	SET_RQ_SC_PARMS
 37824                                  ;
 37825                                  ;	Revision history:
 37826                                  ;
 37827                                  ;		AN000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 37828                                  ;		A004   PTM 3765 -- Disk reset failed
 37829                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk write optimization
 37830                                  ;		I001   5.0 PTR 722211 - Preserve CY when in buffer in HMA
 37831                                  
 37832                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 37833                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37834                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 37835                                  ; Inputs:
 37836                                  ;	 No Inputs
 37837                                  ; Function:
 37838                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37839                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 37840                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 37841                                  ; Outputs:
 37842                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37843                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 37844                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 37845                                  ; No other registers altered
 37846                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37847                                  
 37848                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37849                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37850                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37851                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37852                                  
 37853                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37854                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AA4Bh
 37855                                  
 37856                                  GETCURHEAD:
 37857 00006519 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 37858 0000651E 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 37859 00006525 36893E[1711]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 37860 0000652A C3                      	retn
 37861                                  
 37862                                  ;Break	<SCANPLACE, PLACEBUF -- PUT A BUFFER BACK IN THE POOL>
 37863                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37864                                  ; Procedure Name : ScanPlace
 37865                                  ; Inputs:
 37866                                  ;	Same as PLACEBUF
 37867                                  ; Function:
 37868                                  ;	Save scan location and call PLACEBUF
 37869                                  ; Outputs:
 37870                                  ;	DS:DI Points to saved scan location
 37871                                  ; All registers, except DS:DI, preserved.
 37872                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37873                                  ;M039: Rewritten to preserve registers.
 37874                                  
 37875                                  ;SCANPLACE:
 37876                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37877                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5DDCh
 37878                                  ;	push	es
 37879                                  ;	les	si,[di]
 37880                                  ;	;les	si,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_link]
 37881                                  ;	call	PLACEBUF
 37882                                  ;	push	es
 37883                                  ;	pop	ds
 37884                                  ;	mov	di,si
 37885                                  ;	pop	es
 37886                                  ;scanplace_retn:
 37887                                  ;	retn	
 37888                                  	
 37889                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37890                                  SCANPLACE:
 37891 0000652B FF35                    	push	word [di]
 37892                                  	;push	word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ;Save scan location
 37893 0000652D E80200                  	call	PLACEBUF
 37894 00006530 5F                      	pop	di
 37895 00006531 C3                      	retn
 37896                                  
 37897                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37898                                  ; Procedure Name : PlaceBuf
 37899                                  ; Input:
 37900                                  ;	DS:DI points to buffer (DS->BUFFINFO array, DI=offset in array)
 37901                                  ; Function:
 37902                                  ;	Remove buffer from queue and re-insert it in proper place.
 37903                                  ; NO registers altered
 37904                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37905                                  
 37906                                  ;procedure PLACEBUF,NEAR
 37907                                  
 37908                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37909                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37910                                  PLACEBUF:
 37911                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37912                                  
 37913                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37914 00006532 50                      	push	AX			;Save only regs we modify	;AN000;
 37915 00006533 53                      	push	BX							;AN000;
 37916                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37917                                  	;push	SI							;AN000;
 37918                                  	
 37919 00006534 8B05                    	mov	ax,[di]
 37920                                  	;mov	ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 37921 00006536 368B1E[6D00]            	mov	bx,[ss:BufferQueue]	; bx = offset of head of list;smr;SS Override
 37922                                  	
 37923 0000653B 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx				;Buf = last?		;AN000;
 37924 0000653D 7422                    	je	short nret			;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37925 0000653F 39DF                    	cmp	di,bx				;Buf = first?		;AN000;
 37926 00006541 7506                    	jne	short not_first 		;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37927 00006543 36A3[6D00]              	mov	[ss:BufferQueue],ax		;smr;SS Override
 37928 00006547 EB18                    	jmp	short nret 			;Continue with repositioning;AN000;
 37929                                  not_first:
 37930                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37931 00006549 56                      	push	si
 37932                                  	;mov	si,[di+2]
 37933 0000654A 8B7502                  	mov	SI,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;No, SI = prior Buf	;AN000;
 37934 0000654D 8904                    	mov	[si],ax
 37935                                  	;mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],AX	; ax has di->buf_next	;AN000;
 37936 0000654F 96                      	xchg	si,ax
 37937                                  	;mov	[si+2],ax
 37938 00006550 894402                  	mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],AX	;			;AN000;
 37939                                  	
 37940 00006553 8B7702                  	mov	SI,[BX+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;SI-> last buffer	;AN000;
 37941 00006556 893C                    	mov	[si],di
 37942                                  	;mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],DI	;Add Buf to end of list ;AN000;
 37943 00006558 897F02                  	mov	[BX+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],DI				;AN000;
 37944 0000655B 897502                  	mov	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],SI	;Update link in Buf too	;AN000;
 37945 0000655E 891D                    	mov	[di],bx
 37946                                  	;mov	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],BX				;AN000;
 37947                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37948 00006560 5E                      	pop	si
 37949                                  nret:	
 37950                                  	; 23/09/2023							;AN000;
 37951                                  	;pop	SI							;AN000;
 37952 00006561 5B                      	pop	BX							;AN000;
 37953 00006562 58                      	pop	AX							;AN000;

 38088                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 38089                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38090                                  ;
 38091                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 38092                                  ; Inputs:
 38093                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 38094                                  ; Function:
 38095                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 38096                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 38097                                  ;	   same segment
 38098                                  ;
 38099                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 38100                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 38101                                  ; No Registers altered
 38102                                  ;
 38103                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38104                                  
 38105                                  POINTCOMP:
 38106                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38107                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h
 38108 0000656F 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 38109 00006571 750A                    	jnz	short _ret_label	; return if nz
 38110                                  	;jnz	short placehead_retn 
 38111 00006573 51                      	PUSH	CX
 38112 00006574 52                      	PUSH	DX
 38113 00006575 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 38114 00006577 8CC2                    	MOV	DX,ES
 38115 00006579 39D1                    	CMP	CX,DX
 38116 0000657B 5A                      	POP	DX
 38117 0000657C 59                      	POP	CX
 38118                                  _ret_label:
 38119 0000657D C3                      	retn

 38121                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38122                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 38123                                  
 38124                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 38125                                  
 38126                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38127                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38128                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 38129                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38130                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 38131                                  ; 
 38132                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38133                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38134                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 38135                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38136                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38137                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38138                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38139                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38140                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38141                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38142                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38143                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38144                                  
 38145                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38146                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38147                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 38148                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38149                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 38150                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 38151                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 38152                                  ; 
 38153                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38154                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38155                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 38156                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 38157                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38158                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38159                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38160                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38161                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38162                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38163                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38164                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38165                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38166                                  
 38167                                  	; 22/09/2023 - RetroDOS v4.2 MSDOS.SYS (optimization)

 39047                                  ;**	Set_RQ_SC_Parms - Set Secondary Cache Parameters
 39048                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39049                                  ;	Set_RQ_SC_Parms sets the sector size and drive number value
 39050                                  ;	for the secondary cache. This updates SC_SECTOR_SIZE &
