 39146                                  ;============================================================================
 39147                                  ; MSPROC.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 39148                                  ;============================================================================
 39149                                  ; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39150                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39151                                  ; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 39152                                  
 39153                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 39154                                  
 39155                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 39156                                  
 39157                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 39158                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 39159                                  
 39160                                  ; =========================================================================
 39161                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 39162                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 39163                                  ;
 39164                                  ;	$WAIT
 39165                                  ;	$EXEC
 39166                                  ;	$Keep_process
 39167                                  ;	Stay_resident
 39168                                  ;	$EXIT
 39169                                  ;	$ABORT
 39170                                  ;	abort_inner
 39171                                  ;
 39172                                  ;	Modification history:
 39173                                  ;
 39174                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 39175                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 39176                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 39177                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 39178                                  ;
 39179                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 39180                                  ;
 39181                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 39182                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 39183                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 39184                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 39185                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 39186                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 39187                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 39188                                  ;
 39189                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 39190                                  ;
 39191                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 39192                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 39193                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 39194                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 39195                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 39196                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 39197                                  ;
 39198                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 39199                                  ;
 39200                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 39201                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 39202                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 39203                                  ;
 39204                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 39205                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 39206                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 39207                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 39208                                  ;
 39209                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 39210                                  ;
 39211                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 39212                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 39213                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 39214                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 39215                                  ;
 39216                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 39217                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 39218                                  ;		       UMBs.
 39219                                  ;
 39220                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 39221                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 39222                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 39223                                  ;
 39224                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 39225                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 39226                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 39227                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 39228                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 39229                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 39230                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 39231                                  ;
 39232                                  ; =========================================================================
 39233                                  
 39234                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 39235                                  
 39236                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 39237                                  ; =========================================================================
 39238                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 39239                                  ;
 39240                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 39241                                  ;
 39242                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 39243                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 39244                                  ;
 39245                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 39246                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 39247                                  ;	USES	all
 39248                                  ; =========================================================================
 39249                                  
 39250                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39251                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 39252                                  
 39253                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39254                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 39255                                  
 39256                                  	; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 39257                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AD78h	
 39258                                  
 39259                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:9B55h)
 39260                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:944Ch)
 39261                                  
 39262                                  _$WAIT:
 39263                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39264                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 39265                                  
 39266 0000683E 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 39267 00006840 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 39268 00006845 E9379E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 39270                                  ; =========================================================================
 39271                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 39272                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 39273                                  ;
 39274                                  ;
 39275                                  ; Assembler usage:
 39276                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 39277                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 39278                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 39279                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 39280                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 39281                                  ;
 39282                                  ;	AL  Function
 39283                                  ;	--  --------
 39284                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 39285                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 39286                                  ;	    begin execution.
 39287                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 39288                                  ;
 39289                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 39290                                  ;
 39291                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39292                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39293                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39294                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39295                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39296                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39297                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39298                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39299                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39300                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39301                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39302                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39303                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39304                                  ;
 39305                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 39306                                  ;
 39307                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39308                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39309                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39310                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39311                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39312                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39313                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39314                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39315                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39316                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39317                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39318                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39319                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39320                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39321                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 39322                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39323                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39324                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 39325                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39326                                  ;
 39327                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 39328                                  ;
 39329                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39330                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 39331                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 39332                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39333                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 39334                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 39335                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39336                                  ;
 39337                                  ; Returns:
 39338                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 39339                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 39340                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 39341                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 39342                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 39343                                  ; =========================================================================
 39344                                  ;
 39345                                  ;   Revision history:
 39346                                  ;
 39347                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 39348                                  ;
 39349                                  ; =========================================================================
 39350                                  
 39351                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 39352                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 39353                                  
 39354                                  ; =========================================================================
 39355                                  
 39356                                  ;IF1		; warning message on buffers
 39357                                  ;%out	Please make sure that the following are contiguous and of the
 39358                                  ;%out	following sizes:
 39359                                  ;%out
 39360                                  ;%out	OpenBuf     128
 39361                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128
 39362                                  ;%out	SearchBuf    53
 39363                                  ;%out	DummyCDS    curdirLen
 39364                                  ;ENDIF

 39398                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_Block	,WORD

 39400                                  	;LocalVar    ExecNameLen 	,WORD
 39401                                  	;LocalVar    ExecName		,DWORD

 39406                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)

 39429                                  	; ==================================================================
 39430                                  	; validate function
 39431                                  	; ==================================================================
 39432                                  		      	
 39433                                  	; M068 - Start
 39434                                  	;
 39435                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a
 39436                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 39437                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep
 39438                                  	; the A20 off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 39439                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 39440                                  
 39441                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39442 00006848 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 39443                                  
 39444                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack
 39445                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 39446                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExecReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 39447                                  
 39448 0000684E 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 39449                                  	;jne	short @f
 39450 00006850 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 39451                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 39452 00006852 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 39453 00006853 B9[0A04]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 39454 00006856 51                      	push	cx
 39455                                  ;@@:
 39456                                  Exec_@f:
 39457                                  	; M068 - End
 39458                                  	
 39459                                  	;Enter
 39460                                  
 39461 00006857 55                      	push	bp
 39462 00006858 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 39463                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 39464                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 39465                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 6.22 & PCDOS 7.1 ; 07/03/2024
 39466                                  	; 17/12/2022
 39467                                  	; 20/05/2019

 39469                                  
 39470                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39471 0000685D 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 39472                                  					; M030
 39473 0000685F 7611                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 39474                                  
 39475                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 39476                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 39477                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 39478

 39533

 41039                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41040                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 41041                                  ;
 41042                                  ; Input:    DX is an offset from CurrentPDB at which to
 41043                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 41044                                  ;
 41045                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 41046                                  ;	    paragraphs long. An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 41047                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 41048                                  ;
 41049                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41050                                  
 41051                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41052                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41053                                  
 41054                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41055                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41056                                  
 41057                                  	; 09/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 41058                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B3BCh
 41059                                  
 41060                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 41061 00006E54 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 41062                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 41063 00006E55 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 41064 00006E5B 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 41065 00006E60 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 41066 00006E63 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 41067                                  
 41068 00006E65 BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 41069                                  
 41070                                  Keep_Shrink:
 41071 00006E68 89D3                    	mov	BX,DX
 41072 00006E6A 53                      	push	BX
 41073 00006E6B 06                      	push	ES
 41074 00006E6C E82F02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 41075 00006E6F 1F                      	pop	DS
 41076 00006E70 5B                      	pop	BX
 41077 00006E71 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 41078                                  
 41079 00006E73 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 41080 00006E75 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 41081                                  	;mov	[2],ax
 41082 00006E77 A30200                  	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],AX	;PBUGBUG
 41083                                  
 41084                                  Keep_Done:
 41085 00006E7A 58                      	pop	AX
 41086 00006E7B EB26                    	jmp	SHORT exit_inner	; and let abort take care of the rest
 41087

 41142                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 41143                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41144                                  ; Inputs:
 41145                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 41146                                  ; Function:
 41147                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 41148                                  ;	to the terminate address
 41149                                  ; Returns:
 41150                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 41151                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41152                                  
 41153                                  _$ABORT:
 41154 00006EB0 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 41155                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 41156                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],AL ; = 0
 41157 00006EB2 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_ABORT
 41158                                  
 41159                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 41160                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 41161                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 41162                                  
 41163                                  abort_inner:
 41164 00006EB8 368A26[7C05]            	mov	AH,[SS:EXIT_TYPE]
 41165 00006EBD 36A3[3403]              	mov	[SS:exit_code],AX
 41166 00006EC1 E8C795                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 41167                                  
 41168                                  	;mov	ds,[si+14h]
 41169 00006EC4 8E5C14                  	mov	DS,[SI+user_env.user_CS] ; set up old interrupts ;PBUGBUG
 41170 00006EC7 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 41171 00006EC9 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 41172                                  	;mov	si,10
 41173 00006ECB BE0A00                  	mov	SI,SAVEXIT
 41174                                  	;mov	di,88h

 41180 00006ED5 A5                      	movsw
 41181 00006ED6 A5                      	movsw
 41182 00006ED7 E975EF                  	jmp	reset_environment

 41289                                  ; arena data
 41290                                  ;
 41291                                  ;       i_need  arena_head,WORD         ; seg address of start of arena
 41292                                  ;       i_need  CurrentPDB,WORD         ; current process data block addr
 41293                                  ;       i_need  FirstArena,WORD         ; first free block found
 41294                                  ;       i_need  BestArena,WORD          ; best free block found
 41295                                  ;       i_need  LastArena,WORD          ; last free block found

 41371

 41376                                  ;	BREAK	<Arena Helper Routines>
 41377                                  
 41378                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 41379                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41380                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 41381                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41382                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 41383                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 41384                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41385                                  
 41386                                  arena_next:
 41387 00006F14 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 41388 00006F16 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 41389 00006F1A 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 41390                                  
 41391                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 41392                                  ;
 41393                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 41394                                  ;       RETN
 41395                                  
 41396                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 41397                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41398                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 41399                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41400                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 41401                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 41402                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 41403                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 41404                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41405                                  
 41406                                  check_signature:        
 41407                                  
 41408 00006F1B 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 41409                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 41410 00006F1D 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 41411                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 41412 00006F21 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41413                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41414 00006F23 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 41415                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 41416 00006F27 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41417 00006F29 F9                              STC                             ; set error
 41418                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 41419                                  ;AFP_RETN:	; 10/03/2024
 41420                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 41421                                  check_signature_ok:
 41422                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 41423 00006F2A C3                      	RETN
 41424                                  
 41425                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 41426                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41427                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 41428                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 41429                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 41430                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 41431                                  ;
 41432                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 41433                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41434                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41435                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 41436                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 41437                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 41438                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 41439                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41440                                          
 41441                                  Coalesce:
 41442                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41443 00006F2B 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 41444                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 41445                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 41446 00006F2E 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 41447 00006F30 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 41448                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 41449 00006F33 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 41450                                  
 41451                                  coalesce_check:
 41452                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 41453 00006F35 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 41454                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 41455 00006F3A 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 41456                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 41457 00006F3C 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 41458 00006F41 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 41459                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 41460 00006F42 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 41461 00006F46 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 41462 00006F49 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 41463 00006F4B EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again
 41464                                  
 41465                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41466                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 41467                                  
 41468                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 41469                                  
 41470                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41471                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41472                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 41473                                  ;
 41474                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 41475                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 41476                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 41477                                  ;
 41478                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 41479                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 41480                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 41481                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 41482                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 41483                                  ;
 41484                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 41485                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 41486                                  ;
 41487                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 41488                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41489                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41490                                  ;           INT     21h
 41491                                  ;
 41492                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 41493                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 41494                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 41495                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 41496                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 41497                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 41498                                  ;
 41499                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 41500                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 41501                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 41502                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 41503                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 41504                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 41505                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 41506                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 41507                                  ;	USES	All
 41508                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41509                                  
 41510                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41511                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41512                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 41513                                  ;
 41514                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41515                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41516                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41517                                  ;           INT     21h
 41518                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 41519                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 41520                                  ;
 41521                                  ;   Description:
 41522                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 41523                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 41524                                  ;
 41525                                  ;   Error return:
 41526                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 41527                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41528                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41529                                  
 41530                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41531                                  
 41532                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41533                                  ; DOSCODE:A22Eh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41534

 41765 00007009 7505                    	JNZ	SHORT alloc_best

 41767                                  alloc_best:
 41768 00007010 36833E[4203]00                  CMP     WORD [SS:BestArena],0
 41769 00007016 740E                            JZ      SHORT alloc_make_best	; initial best
 41770 00007018 06                              PUSH	ES
 41771 00007019 368E06[4203]                    MOV     ES,[SS:BestArena]
 41772 0000701E 26390E0300                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.SIZE],CX	; is size of best larger than found?

 41781                                  ; split the block high
 41782                                  ;
 41783                                  alloc_do_split_high:
 41784 00007033 368E1E[4403]                    MOV     DS,[SS:LastArena]
 41785 00007038 8B0E0300                        MOV     CX,[ARENA.SIZE]

 41793 00007049 EB2B                            JMP     SHORT alloc_set_sizes	; cx has upper (requested) size
 41794                                  ;
 41795                                  ; we have scanned memory and have found all appropriate blocks
 41796                                  ; check for the type of allocation desired; first and best are identical
 41797                                  ; last must be split high
 41798                                  ;

 41867                                  
 41868                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41869                                  
 41870                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41871                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41872                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 41873                                  ;
 41874                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 41875                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 41876                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 41877                                  ;
 41878                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 41879                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 41880                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 41881                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 41882                                  ;
 41883                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 41884                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 41885                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 41886                                  ;		code.
 41887                                  ;
 41888                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 41889                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 41890                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 41891                                  ;
 41892                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41893                                  ;		'C' set if error
 41894                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 41895                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 41896                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 41897                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 41898                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 41899                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 41900                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41901                                  
 41902                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41903                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41904                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41905                                  ;
 41906                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41907                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 41908                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 41909                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 41910                                  ;           INT     21h
 41911                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 41912                                  ;         size possible
 41913                                  ;   Error return:
 41914                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 41915                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41916                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 41917                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 41918                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41919                                  
 41920                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 41921                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41922                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 41923 0000709E E8F7A7                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 41924                                  
 41925 000070A1 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 41926 000070A4 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 41927 000070A6 48                              DEC     AX
 41928 000070A7 E871FE                          CALL    check_signature
 41929 000070AA 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 41930                                  
 41931                                  setblock_bad:
 41932 000070AC E905FF                          JMP     alloc_trashed
 41933                                  
 41934                                  setblock_grab:
 41935 000070AF 8ED8                            MOV     DS,AX

 42015                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42016                                  
 42017                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42018                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42019                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 42020                                  ;
 42021                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42022                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42023                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42024                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42025                                  ;           INT     21h
 42026                                  ;
 42027                                  ;	ENTRY	
 42028                                  ;		(al) = 0
 42029                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 42030                                  ;
 42031                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 42032                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 42033                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 42034                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 42035                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 42036                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 42037                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 42038                                  ;
 42039                                  ;		(al) = 2
 42040                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 42041                                  ;
 42042                                  ;		(al) = 3
 42043                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 42044                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 42045                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 42046                                  ;
 42047                                  ;
 42048                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42049                                  ;
 42050                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 42051                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 42052                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 42053                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 42054                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 42055                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 42056                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 42057                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 42058                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 42059                                  ;
 42060                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42061                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 42062                                  ;
 42063                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 42064                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 42065                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 42066                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 42067                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 42068                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42069                                  
 42070                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42071                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42072                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42073                                  ;
 42074                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42075                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42076                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42077                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42078                                  ;           INT     21h
 42079                                  ;
 42080                                  ;   Error return:
 42081                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 42082                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42083

 42240                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42241                                  %if 0

 42303                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42304                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42305                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 42306                                  ;
 42307                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 42308                                  ;
 42309                                  ;
 42310                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 42311                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 42312                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 42313                                  ;		   else
 42314                                  ;			DS = last arena
 42315                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 42316                                  ;
 42317                                  ;		   CY if error
 42318                                  ;
 42319                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 42320                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42321                                  
 42322                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42323                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42324                                  
 42325                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42326                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42327                                  
 42328                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42329                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B6D9h
 42330                                  
 42331                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A4D6h)
 42332                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:9F25h)
 42333                                  
 42334                                  GetLastArena:
 42335 00007167 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 42336                                  
 42337 00007168 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 42338 0000716C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 42339 0000716E 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 42340                                  
 42341 00007170 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42342                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42343 00007174 7416                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES
 42344                                  
 42345                                  GLA_next:
 42346 00007176 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42347 00007178 E899FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42348                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42349                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42350                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42351 0000717B 7222                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42352                                  
 42353                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42354                                  %if 0
 42355                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42356                                  	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is
 42357                                  					;    umb_head
 42358                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 42359                                  %else
 42360                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42361                                  	;;;
 42362 0000717D E85BFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42363 00007180 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb
 42364                                  	;;;
 42365                                  %endif
 42366 00007182 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42367                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42368 00007186 EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 42369                                  GLA_chkumb:
 42370 00007188 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42371                                  GLA_@f:
 42372 0000718A 75EA                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 42373                                  
 42374                                  GLA_done:
 42375                                  
 42376                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42377                                  %if 0
 42378                                  					; M061 - Start
 42379                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42380                                  	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 42381                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next
 42382                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 42383                                  %else
 42384                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42385                                  	;;;
 42386 0000718C E84CFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42387 0000718F 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret ; cf=0
 42388                                  	;;;
 42389                                  %endif
 42390 00007191 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42391 00007193 E87EFD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42392                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42393 00007196 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42394 00007198 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42395 0000719A 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 42396                                  					; M061 - End
 42397                                  GLA_ret:
 42398                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42399                                  	;clc
 42400                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42401                                  	;clc
 42402 0000719C 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 42403 0000719D C3                      	retn				; M061
 42404                                  
 42405                                  GLA_err:
 42406 0000719E F9                      	stc				; M061
 42407                                  GLA_err2:
 42408 0000719F 58                      	pop	ax
 42409                                  
 42410                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 42411                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42412                                  	;;;
 42413 000071A0 58                      	pop	ax	; return address to _$ALLOCOPER (the caller)
 42414 000071A1 E83DA1                  	call	set_exerr_locus_mem
 42415 000071A4 E910FE                  	jmp	alloc_trashed2	; (error return from _$ALLOCOPER)
 42416                                  	;;;
 42417                                  
 42418                                  	; 10/03/2024
 42419                                  	;retn

 42455                                  ; DOSCODE:A517h (MSDOS 6.22, MSDOS.SYS) ; Retro DOS v4.2

 42463                                  
 42464 000071A7 [AB71]                  SERVERTAB:	dw	SERVER_DISP
 42465 000071A9 [FA71]                  SERVERLEAVE:	dw	SERVERRETURN
 42466 000071AB 0B                      SERVER_DISP:	db	(SERVER_DISP_END-SERVER_DISP-1)/2 ; = 11
 42467 000071AC [6072]                  		dw	SRV_CALL	; 0
 42468 000071AE [FB71]                  		dw	COMMIT_ALL	; 1
 42469 000071B0 [3172]                  		dw	CLOSE_NAME	; 2
 42470 000071B2 [3A72]                  		dw	CLOSE_UID	; 3

 42487                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42488                                  ;
 42489                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 42490                                  ;
 42491                                  ; Inputs:
 42492                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 42493                                  ; Function:
 42494                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 42495                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 42496                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 42497                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 42498                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 42499                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 42500                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 42501                                  ;			CX User Index
 42502                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 42503                                  ;			BX = UID
 42504                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 42505                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 42506                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 42507                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 42508                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 42509                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 42510                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 42511                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 42512                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 42513                                  ;
 42514                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42515                                  
 42516                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42517                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B735h
 42518                                  
 42519                                  _$ServerCall:
 42520                                  	; 13/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42521                                  	; DOSCODE:A4D2h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)		
 42522                                  	; 10/06/2019
 42523                                  	; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42524                                  	; DOSCODE:A532h (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 42525                                  
 42526                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42527                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 657Bh
 42528 000071C2 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7
 42529 000071C4 7204                    	JB	short SET_STUFF
 42530 000071C6 3C09                    	CMP	AL,9
 42531 000071C8 761A                    	JBE	short NO_SET_ID		; No DPL on calls 7,8,9
 42532                                  SET_STUFF:

 42548

 42550 000071DC 8B5C14                  	MOV	BX,[SI+DPL.PID]
 42551 000071DF 36891E[3C03]            	MOV	[SS:PROC_ID],BX		; Set process ID
 42552                                  NO_SET_ID:
 42553                                  	; 10/06/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42554 000071E4 2EFF36[A971]            	PUSH	word [cs:SERVERLEAVE]	; push return address
 42555 000071E9 2EFF36[A771]            	PUSH	word [cs:SERVERTAB]	; push table address

 42558

 42564

 42566                                  	;mov	al,1
 42567 000071F5 B001                    	MOV	AL,error_invalid_function
 42568                                  servercall_error:
 42569 000071F7 E98F94                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR
 42570                                  
 42571                                  SERVERRETURN:
 42572 000071FA C3                      	retn
 42573                                  
 42574                                  ; Commit - iterate through the open file list and make sure that the
 42575                                  ; directory entries are correctly updated.
 42576                                  
 42577                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42578                                  COMMIT_ALL:
 42579 000071FB 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; for (i=0; ThisSFT=getSFT(i); i++)
 42580 000071FD 16                      	push	ss
 42581 000071FE 1F                      	pop	ds
 42582 000071FF E896A6                  	call	ECritSFT		; Gonna scan SFT cache, lock it down
 42583                                  CommitLoop:
 42584 00007202 53                      	push	bx
 42585 00007203 E82201                  	call	SFFromSFN
 42586 00007206 7222                    	JC	short CommitDone
 42587 00007208 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 42588                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0
 42589                                  					; if (ThisSFT->refcount != 0)
 42590 0000720C 7418                    	JZ	short CommitNext
 42591                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 42592 0000720E 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 42593                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],sf_busy  
 42594                                  					; BUSY SFTs have god knows what
 42595 00007212 7412                    	JZ	short CommitNext	;   in them.
 42596                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42597 00007214 26F6450680              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8) ; 80h
 42598                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet ; 8000h
 42599 00007219 750B                    	JNZ	short CommitNext	; Skip Network SFTs so the SERVER
 42600                                  					;      doesn't deadlock
 42601 0000721B 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI
 42602 0000721F 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES

 42695                                  SRV_CALL:

 42704                                  ; ES:DI point to DPL
 42705

 42707

 42709                                  ; ES:DI point to stack
 42710                                  ;

 42712

 42719 00007274 A5                      	MOVSW				; ES
