 42840                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 42841                                  
 42842                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 42843                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42844                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 42845                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 42846                                  ;
 42847                                  ;	NOTE:
 42848                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42849                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42850                                  ;
 42851                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 42852                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 42853                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 42854                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42855                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 42856                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 42857                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42858                                  
 42859                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42860                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42861                                  
 42862                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 42863                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42864                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42865 000072F5 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42866                                  	
 42867                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 42868 000072FA 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 42869                                  
 42870                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 42871 000072FF 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 42872 00007304 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 42873                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42874                                  	;mov	al,6
 42875 00007306 B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42876                                  ReturnCarry:
 42877 00007308 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 42878 00007309 C3                      	retn				; go back
 42879                                  pjfn10: 
 42880                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 42881 0000730A 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 42882 0000730F 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 42883                                  	;clc
 42884                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 42885 00007311 C3                      	retn
 42886                                  
 42887                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 42888                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42889                                  ;
 42890                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 42891                                  ;
 42892                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 42893                                  ;
 42894                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 42895                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 42896                                  ;                   AX has error code
 42897                                  ;               Carry Reset
 42898                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 42899                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 42900                                  ; NOTE:
 42901                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42902                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42903                                  ;
 42904                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42905                                  
 42906                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42907                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42908                                  
 42909                                  SFFromHandle:
 42910 00007312 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 42911                                  	;retc				; return if error
 42912 00007315 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 42913 00007317 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 42914                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42915                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42916                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42917                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42918                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42919                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42920 0000731B 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 42921                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42922                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42923                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42924                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42925                                  GetSF:
 42926 0000731D 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 42927 0000731E 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 42928 00007321 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 42929 00007323 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 42930 00007326 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 42931 00007327 C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 42932                                  
 42933                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 42934                                  
 42935                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 42936                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42937                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 42938                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 42939                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 42940                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 42941                                  ;
 42942                                  ;   NOTE:
 42943                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 42944                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42945                                  ;
 42946                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 42947                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42948                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 42949                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 42950                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 42951                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42952                                  
 42953                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42954                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42955                                  
 42956                                  SFFromSFN:
 42957                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42958                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42959 00007328 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42960                                  
 42961                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 42962 0000732D 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 42963                                  sfsfn5:	
 42964                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 42965 00007332 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 42966 00007336 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 42967                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 42968 00007338 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 42969 0000733C 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 42970                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 42971 0000733F 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 42972 00007342 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 42973 00007344 F9                      	STC
 42974 00007345 C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 42975                                  sfsfn7:
 42976 00007346 50                      	push	ax
 42977                                  	;;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 42978                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 5.0 to PCDOS 7.1 (to Win ME) ; 11/03/2024
 42979                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 42980                                  	
 42981                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42982 00007347 B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 42983                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42984                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 42985                                  	
 42986 00007349 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 42987 0000734B 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 42988 0000734D 58                      	pop	ax
 42989                                  	;add	di,6
 42990 0000734E 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 42991 00007351 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 42992                                  
 42993                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 42994                                  
 42995                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 42996                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42997                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 42998                                  ;
 42999                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43000                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43001                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 43002                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 43003                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43004                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43005                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 43006                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43007                                  
 43008                                  JFNFree:
 43009 00007352 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 43010                                  jfnf1:	
 43011 00007354 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 43012 00007357 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 43013 00007359 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 43014 0000735D 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 43015 0000735F 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 43016 00007360 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 43017                                  
 43018                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 43019                                  jfnf5:	
 43020                                  	;mov	al,4
 43021 00007362 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 43022                                  jfnfx:	
 43023 00007364 C3                      	retn				; bye
 43024                                  
 43025                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 43026                                  
 43027                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 43028                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43029                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 43030                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43031                                  ;
 43032                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 43033                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 43034                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 43035                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 43036                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 43037                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 43038                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 43039                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 43040                                  ;
 43041                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 43042                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 43043                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 43044                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 43045                                  ;
 43046                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43047                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 43048                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 43049                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43050                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43051                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43052                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43053                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 43054                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43055                                  
 43056                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43057                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43058                                  
 43059                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43060                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B8DEh
 43061                                  
 43062                                  SFNFree:
 43063                                  	; 12/08/2018
 43064                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43065                                  	;
 43066                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43067 00007365 50                      	push	ax
 43068 00007366 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 43069                                  sfnf5:	
 43070 00007368 53                      	push	bx
 43071 00007369 E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 43072 0000736C 5B                      	pop	bx
 43073 0000736D 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 43074 0000736F 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 43075                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 43076 00007373 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 43077                                  	
 43078                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 43079 00007375 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43080                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43081 00007379 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 43082                                  sfnf7:	
 43083 0000737B 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 43084 0000737C EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 43085                                  
 43086                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 43087                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 43088                                  ;
 43089                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43090                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43091                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43092                                  
 43093                                  sfnf10:	
 43094 0000737E 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43095                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43096 00007382 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43097 00007386 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 43098 00007388 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43099                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 43100 0000738C 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43101 00007390 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 43102                                  
 43103                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 43104                                  ;
 43105                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43106                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43107                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43108                                  
 43109                                  sfnf20:
 43110                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43111                                  
 43112                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 43113 00007392 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43114                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 43115                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43116                                  
 43117 00007397 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43118                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43119 0000739B 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43120 0000739F 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43121                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 43122 000073A3 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43123                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43124                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43125                                  	;pop	ax
 43126                                  	;;clc
 43127                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 43128                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43129 000073A7 58                      	pop	ax
 43130                                  	;clc
 43131 000073A8 C3                      	retn
 43132                                  
 43133                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 43134                                  ;
 43135                                  ;	'C' set
 43136                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 43137                                  
 43138                                  sfnf95: 
 43139 000073A9 58                      	pop	ax
 43140                                  
 43141                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43142                                  %if 0
 43143                                  	;mov	al,4
 43144                                  	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 43145                                  	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 43146                                  %else
 43147                                  	; 11/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43148                                  	;;;
 43149 000073AA EBB6                    	jmp	short jfnf5
 43150                                  	;;;
 43151                                  %endif

 43154                                  ; HANDLE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 43155                                  ;============================================================================
 43156                                  ; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43157                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43158                                  ; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 43159                                  
 43160                                  ; DOSCODE:A72Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 43161                                  
 43162                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 43163                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43164                                  ;
 43165                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 43166                                  ;
 43167                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 43168                                  ;		path
 43169                                  ;
 43170                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43171                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43172                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 43173                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43174                                  ;
 43175                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43176                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 43177                                  ;	USES	all
 43178                                  ;
 43179                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43180                                  
 43181                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43182                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43183                                  
 43184                                  ; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43185                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B926h
 43186                                  
 43187                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A145h)
 43188                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A72Bh)
 43189                                  
 43190                                  _$CLOSE:
 43191                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 43192                                  
 43193 000073AC E8F602                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 43194 000073AF 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 43195 000073B1 16                      	push	ss
 43196 000073B2 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 43197 000073B3 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 43198 000073B7 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43199                                  
 43200                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 43201                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 43202                                  ;

 43671                                  ;	AND	DX,0Fh			; normalize offset
 43672                                  ;	MOV	[ss:DMAADD],DX		; use user DX as offset	;smr;SS Override
 43673                                  ;	MOV	[ss:DMAADD+2],DS 	; use user DS as segment for DMA
 43674                                  ;						;smr;SS Override
 43675                                  ;	retn
 43676                                  
 43677                                  ; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43678                                  Align_Buffer:
 43679                                  	MOV	BX,DX			; copy offset
 43680                                  	push	cx			; don't stomp on count
 43681                                  	MOV	CL,4			; bits to shift bytes->para
 43682                                  	SHR	BX,CL			; get number of paragraphs
 43683                                  	pop	cx			; get count back
 43684                                  	MOV	AX,DS			; get original segment
 43685                                  	ADD	AX,BX			; get new segment
 43686                                  	MOV	DS,AX			; in seg register
 43687                                  	AND	DX,0Fh			; normalize offset
 43688                                  	MOV	[ss:DMAADD],DX		; use user DX as offset	;smr;SS Override
 43689                                  	MOV	[ss:DMAADD+2],DS 	; use user DS as segment for DMA
 43690                                  						;smr;SS Override
 43691                                  	retn
 43692                                  
 43693                                  %endif

 44293                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 44294                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44295                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 44296                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 44297                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 44298                                  ;   that it does not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 44299                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 44300                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 44301                                  ;
 44302                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 44303                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 44304                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 44305                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 44306                                  ;	USES	none
 44307                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44308                                  
 44309                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44310                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44311                                  CheckOwner:
 44312                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44313                                  
 44314 000076A5 E86AFC                  	call	SFFromHandle
 44315 000076A8 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 44316                                  
 44317 000076AA 50                      	push	ax
 44318                                  
 44319                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 44320

 44357                                  
 44358                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 44359                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 44360                                  
 44361                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 44362                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 44363                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 44364                                  
 44365                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 44366                                  ;
 44367                                  ;	$AssignOper
 44368                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 44369                                  ;	InitCDS
 44370                                  ;	$UserOper
 44371                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 44372                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 44373                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 44374                                  ;
 44375                                  ;   Revision history:
 44376                                  ;
 44377                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 44378                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 44379                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 44380                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 44381                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 44382                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 44383                                  ;				    aliasing.
 44384                                  ;
 44385                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 44386                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 44387                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 44388                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 44389                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 44390                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 44391                                  ;
 44392                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 44393                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 44394                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 44395                                  ;
 44396                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 44397                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 44398                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 44399                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 44400                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 44401                                  ;
 44402                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 44403                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 44404                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 44405                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 44406                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 44407                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 44408                                  ;
 44409                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 44410                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 44411                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 44412                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 44413                                  ;   number.
 44414                                  ;
 44415                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 44416                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 44417                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 44418                                  ;   TransPath.
 44419                                  ;
 44420                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 44421                                  
 44422                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 44423                                  
 44424                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 44425                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 44426                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 44427                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 44428                                  ;					; current drive)
 44429                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 44430                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 44431                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 44432                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 44433                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 44434                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 44435                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 44436                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 44437                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error

 44439                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 44440                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44441                                  ; Inputs:
 44442                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 44443                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 44444                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 44445                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 44446                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 44447                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 44448                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 44449                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 44450                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 44451                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 44452                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44453                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 44454                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 44455                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44456                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 44457                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 44458                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 44459                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 44460                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 44461                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 44462                                  ; Function:
 44463                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 44464                                  ; Returns:
 44465                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 44466                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44467                                  
 44468                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 44542                                  ;

 44582                                  ; DOSCODE:A9FDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44583

 44585                                  ; DOSCODE:A99Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 44586                                  
 44587                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 44588                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BC91h
 44589

 44591                                  	; 19/08/2018
 44592                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 44639                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 44640                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44641                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 44642                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 44643                                  ;
 44644                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 44645                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 44646                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 44647                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 44648                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 44649                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 44650                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 44651                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 44652                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 44653                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 44654                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 44655                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44656                                  
 44657                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 44658                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 44951                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 44952                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44953                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 44954                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 44955                                  ;
 44956                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 44957                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 44958                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 44959                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 44960                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 44961                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 44962                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 44963                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44964                                  
 44965                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44966                                  TransFCB:
 44967                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44968                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44969                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 44970                                  	;ENTER
 44971 0000783B 55                      	push	bp
 44972 0000783C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 44973                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 44974 0000783E 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 44975 00007841 16                      	push	ss
 44976 00007842 07                      	pop	es
 44977 00007843 06                      	push	es
 44978 00007844 57                      	push	di
 44979                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 44980                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 44981 00007845 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 44982 00007848 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 44983 0000784E 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 44984 00007854 E8A9A9                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 44985                                  	; 06/12/2022
 44986 00007857 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 44987 00007859 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 44988 0000785C 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 44989 00007860 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 44990                                  GetDrive:
 44991 00007866 AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 44992 00007867 E862FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 44993 0000786A 722A                    	jc	short BadPack
 44994 0000786C E86F03                  	call	TextFromDrive           ; convert 0-based drive to text
 44995                                  
 44996                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 44997                                  
 44998                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 44999 0000786F B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 45000 00007872 56                      	push	si			; back over name, ext
 45001                                  FCBScan:
 45002 00007873 AC                      	lodsb				; get a byte
 45003                                  	
 45004                                  	; 09/08/2018
 45005                                  	;;xlat	byte [es:bx]
 45006                                  	;es	xlat
 45007                                  
 45008                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 45009 00007874 E8B8E1                  	call	GetCharType		; get flags
 45010                                  
 45011                                  	;test	al,8	
 45012 00007877 A808                    	test	al,FFCB
 45013 00007879 741B                    	jz	short BadPack
 45014                                  NextCh: 
 45015 0000787B E2F6                    	loop	FCBScan
 45016 0000787D 5E                      	pop	si
 45017 0000787E 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 45018 00007880 E8DAAD                  	call	PackName                ; crunch the path
 45019 00007883 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 45020 00007884 07                      	pop	es
 45021 00007885 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 45022 00007886 1F                      	pop	ds
 45023                                  	;lea	si,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45024                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname
 45025 00007887 8D76F0                  	lea	si,[bp-16]
 45026 0000788A 803F00                  	cmp	byte [bx],0
 45027 0000788D 7407                    	jz	short BadPack
 45028 0000788F 55                      	push	bp
 45029 00007890 E80E00                  	call	TransPathSet            ; convert the path
 45030 00007893 5D                      	pop	bp
 45031 00007894 7303                    	jnc	short FCBRet		; bye with transPath error code
 45032                                  BadPack:
 45033 00007896 F9                      	STC
 45034                                  	;mov	al,3
 45035 00007897 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found
 45036                                  FCBRet: 
 45037                                  	;LEAVE
 45038 00007899 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 45039 0000789B 5D                      	pop	bp
 45040                                  TransPath_retn:
 45041 0000789C C3                      	retn
 45042                                  
 45043                                  ; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45044                                  
 45045                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 45046                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45047                                  ;
 45048                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 45049                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 45050                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 45051                                  ;       exactly.
 45052                                  ;
 45053                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 45054                                  ;       matches splice.
 45055                                  ;
 45056                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 45057                                  ;
 45058                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 45059                                  ;
 45060                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 45061                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 45062                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 45063                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 45064                                  ;
 45065                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 45066                                  ;
 45067                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 45068                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 45069                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 45070                                  ;
 45071                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 45072                                  ;
 45073                                  ;       if fSharing then
 45074                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45075                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45076                                  ;           splice
 45077                                  ;           fatRead
 45078                                  ;           return
 45079                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 45080                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 45081                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45082                                  ;           return
 45083                                  ;       if device then
 45084                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45085                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45086                                  ;           return
 45087                                  ;       if file then
 45088                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 45089                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 45090                                  ;           Copy current dir
 45091                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 45092                                  ;           splice
 45093                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 45094                                  ;           if local then
 45095                                  ;               fatread
 45096                                  ;           return
 45097                                  ;
 45098                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45099                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 45100                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45101                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 45102                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 45103                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 45104                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 45105                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45106                                  ;
 45107                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45108                                  
 45109                                  ; 22/05/2019
 45110                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45111                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45112                                  
 45113                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45114                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45115                                  
 45116                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45117                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BE1Dh
 45118                                  
 45119                                  TransPath:
 45120 0000789D 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 45121 0000789F EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 45122                                  TransPathSet:
 45123 000078A1 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45124                                  SetSplice:

 45127                                  TransPathNoSet:
 45128 000078A9 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		; fSplice = TRUE;	;smr;SS Override

 45131 000078B8 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 45132 000078BF 16                      	push	ss
 45133 000078C0 07                      	pop	es
 45134                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45135 000078C1 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 45136                                  ;
 45137                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 45138                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 45139                                  ;
 45140                                  	;TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 45141                                  	;JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 45142                                  	; 13/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45143                                  	;;;
 45144 000078C5 36803E[7205]00          	cmp	byte [ss:FSHARING],0
 45145 000078CB 7435                    	jz	short CheckUNC
 45146                                  	;;;
 45147                                  ;
 45148                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 45149                                  ;
 45150 000078CD E8F802                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 45151 000078D0 E8F9FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 45152 000078D3 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 45153 000078D5 E80603                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 45154 000078D8 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 45155 000078DB E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 45156 000078DE 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 45157                                  ;
 45158                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 45159                                  ;
 45160 000078E0 16                      	push	ss
 45161 000078E1 1F                      	pop	ds
 45162 000078E2 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 45163 000078E6 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45164 000078EB 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 45165 000078ED E82D02                  	CALL    Splice
 45166                                  NoServerSplice:
 45167 000078F0 16                      	push	ss
 45168 000078F1 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 45169 000078F2 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 45170 000078F6 E89F9F                  	call	ECritDisk
 45171 000078F9 E8BFE8                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 45172 000078FC E8C69F                  	call	LCritDisk
 45173                                  NoPath:
 45174                                  	;mov	al,3
 45175 000078FF B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45176 00007901 C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 45177                                  
 45178                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 45179                                  ; the name if so.
 45180                                  
 45181                                  CheckUNC:
 45182 00007902 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 45183                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 45184 00007909 B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 45185 0000790C CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 45186                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 45187                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 45188                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 45189 0000790E 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 45190                                  
 45191                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 45192                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 45193                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 45194                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 45195                                  
 45196                                  NO_CHECK:
 45197 00007910 E8B502                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 45198 00007913 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 45199 00007914 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 45200 00007916 E831E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45201 00007919 86C4                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 45202 0000791B E82CE1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45203 0000791E 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 45204 00007920 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 45205 00007922 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 45206                                  
 45207                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 45208                                  ; local machine root path
 45209                                  
 45210 00007924 58                      	POP     AX
 45211 00007925 A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 45212                                  UNCCpy:
 45213 00007926 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 45214 00007927 E8CDE0                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 45215 0000792A 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45216 0000792C 740E                    	JZ	short UNCTerm		; end of string. All done.
 45217 0000792E E819E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?
 45218 00007931 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; backup position
 45219 00007933 AA                      	STOSB
 45220 00007934 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 45221 00007936 E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 45222                                  UNCDone:
 45223 00007939 16                      	push	ss
 45224 0000793A 1F                      	pop	ds
 45225 0000793B C3                       	retn				; return error code
 45226                                  UNCTerm:
 45227 0000793C AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 45228 0000793D EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 45229                                  
 45230                                  CheckDevice:
 45231                                  
 45232                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 45233                                  
 45234 0000793F 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 45235 00007940 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 45236 00007943 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 45237                                  	;mov	al,2 
 45238 00007945 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 45239 00007947 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 45240 00007948 C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 45241                                  CheckPath:
 45242 00007949 50                      	push	ax
 45243 0000794A 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 45244                                  
 45245                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45246                                  %if 0
 45247                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45248                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 45249                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 45250                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 45251                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 45252                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 45253                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 45254                                  ;;;
 45255                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 45256                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 45257                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 45258                                  ;;;
 45259                                  ;;;More info:
 45260                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 45261                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 45262                                  ;;;
 45263                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45264                                  start5Dhack:
 45265                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 45266                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 45267                                  
 45268                                  %endif
 45269                                  
 45270                                  ; 13/03/2024
 45271                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BECBh
 45272                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC47h)
 45273                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6C2h))
 45274                                  %if 0
 45275                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45276                                  %else
 45277                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45278                                  
 45279                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45280                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 45281 0000794B E8C0D3                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 45282                                  %endif
 45283 0000794E 5D                      	pop	bp
 45284 0000794F 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 45285 00007950 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 45286                                  
 45287                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 45288                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 45289                                  ; call.
 45290                                  
 45291 00007952 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 45292 00007958 E871FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 45293 0000795B 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 45294                                  
 45295                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 45296                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 45297                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 45298                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 45299                                  ; a device.
 45300                                  
 45301 00007961 E87A02                  	CALL    TextFromDrive
