 45303 00007966 AA                      	STOSB
 45304 00007967 E8389E                  	call	StrCpy			; move remainder of string
 45305                                  
 45306 0000796A F8                      	CLC                             ; everything OK.
 45307 0000796B 16                      	push	ss
 45308 0000796C 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 45309                                  DoFile_retn:
 45310 0000796D C3                      	retn
 45311                                  
 45312                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45313                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BEEEh
 45314                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC6Ah)
 45315                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6F2h))
 45316                                  ;%if 1
 45317                                  
 45318                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45319                                  %if 0
 45320                                  
 45321                                  no5Dshere:
 45322                                  	; 10/08/2018
 45323                                  	jmp	CheckThisDevice		; snoop for device
 45324                                  %endif
 45325                                  
 45326                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 45327                                  
 45328                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.
 45329                                  
 45330                                  DoFile:
 45331                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45332                                  
 45333 0000796E E83FFE                  	call	GetVisDrv               ; get proper CDS
 45334                                  	;mov	al,3 
 45335 00007971 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad file error
 45336 00007973 72F8                    	jc	short DoFile_retn  ; CARRY set -> bogus drive/spliced
 45337                                  
 45338                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 45339                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 45340                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 45341                                  
 45342                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.
 45343 00007975 1E                      	push	ds
 45344 00007976 56                      	push	si
 45345 00007977 06                      	push	es
 45346 00007978 57                      	push	di
 45347 00007979 E8C5D2                  	call	ValidateCDS             ; poke CDS and make everything OK
 45348                                  	;RESTORE <DI,ES,SI,DS>		; get back pointers
 45349 0000797C 5F                      	pop	di
 45350 0000797D 07                      	pop	es
 45351 0000797E 5E                      	pop	si
 45352 0000797F 1F                      	pop	ds
 45353                                  	;mov	al,3
 45354 00007980 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45355                                  	;retc				; someone failed an operation
 45356 00007982 72E9                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45357                                  
 45358                                  ; ThisCDS points to correct CDS. It contains the correct text of the
 45359                                  ; current directory. Copy it in.
 45360                                  
 45361 00007984 1E                      	push	ds
 45362 00007985 56                      	push	si
 45363 00007986 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		; point to CDS	;smr;SS Override
 45364 0000798B 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; point to destination
 45365                                  	;add	bx,[si+79] ; MSDOS 6.0
 45366 0000798D 035C4F                  	ADD     BX,[SI+curdir.end]	; point to backup limit
 45367                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45368 00007990 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; regenerate end of buffer
 45369                                  					;AN000;
 45370 00007994 E81A9E                  	call	FStrCpy                 ; copy string. ES:DI point to end
 45371 00007997 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to NUL byte
 45372                                  
 45373                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 45374                                  
 45375 00007998 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 45376 0000799A 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 45377 0000799E 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 45378 000079A0 AA                      	STOSB
 45379                                  
 45380                                  ; Now get original string.
 45381                                  
 45382                                  GetOrig:
 45383 000079A1 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 45384 000079A2 5E                      	pop	si
 45385 000079A3 1F                      	pop	ds
 45386                                  
 45387                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 45388                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 45389                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 45391 000079A4 E8CE00                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 45392 000079A7 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 45393 000079A9 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 45394 000079AB 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 45395                                  ;
 45396                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 45397                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 45398                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 45399                                  ;
 45400 000079AD 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 45401                                  SkipPath:
 45402 000079AF AC                      	LODSB
 45403 000079B0 E897E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 45404 000079B3 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 45405 000079B5 4E                      	DEC     SI
 45406 000079B6 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45407 000079B8 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 45408                                  
 45409                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 45410                                  ; for yucks.
 45411                                  
 45412                                  PathAssure:
 45413 000079BA B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 45414 000079BC AA                      	STOSB
 45415                                  
 45416                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 45417                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 45418                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 45419                                  
 45420                                  DoCanon:
 45421 000079BD E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 45422                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 45423 000079C0 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45424                                  
 45425                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 45426                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 45427                                  ; buffer.
 45428                                  
 45429 000079C2 16                      	push	ss
 45430 000079C3 1F                      	pop	ds
 45431 000079C4 8B3E[B205]              	MOV     DI,[WFP_START]		; DS:SI point to string
 45432 000079C8 C536[A205]              	LDS     SI,[THISCDS]		; point to CDS
 45433 000079CC E81702                  	CALL    PathPref                ; is there a prefix?
 45434 000079CF 7514                    	JNZ	short DoSplice		; no, do splice
 45435                                  
 45436                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 45437                                  
 45438 000079D1 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]		; last char to match
 45439 000079D4 E873E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; did we end on a path char? (root)
 45440 000079D7 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 45441                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK
 45442 000079D9 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		; end at NUL?
 45443 000079DD 7406                    	JZ	short DoSplice
 45444 000079DF 47                      	INC     DI                      ; point to after current path char
 45445 000079E0 36893E[B605]            	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],DI	; point to correct spot ;smr;SS Override
 45446                                  
 45447                                  ; Splice the result.
 45448                                  
 45449                                  DoSplice:
 45450 000079E5 16                      	push	ss
 45451 000079E6 1F                      	pop	ds			; back to DOSDATA
 45452 000079E7 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START]		; point to beginning of string
 45453 000079EB 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 45454 000079ED F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45455 000079F2 7403                    	JZ	short SkipSplice
 45456 000079F4 E82601                  	CALL    Splice                  ; replaces in place.
 45457                                  SkipSplice:
 45458                                  
 45459                                  ; The final thing is to assure ourselves that a FATREAD is done on the local
 45460                                  ; device.
 45461                                  
 45462 000079F7 16                      	push	ss
 45463 000079F8 1F                      	pop	ds
 45464 000079F9 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; point to correct drive
 45465                                  	;test	word [es:di+67],8000h
 45466                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45467                                  	;test	byte [es:di+68],80h
 45468 000079FD 26F6454480              	test	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],curdir_isnet>>8 ; 04/12/2022
 45469                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; 8000h
 45470 00007A02 750D                    	JNZ	short Done		; net, no fatread necessary (retnz)
 45471 00007A04 E30B                    	JCXZ    Done
 45472 00007A06 E88F9E                  	call	ECritDisk
 45473 00007A09 E8AFE7                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 45474 00007A0C E8B69E                  	call	LCritDisk
 45475                                  	;mov	al, 3
 45476 00007A0F B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45477                                  Done:   
 45478 00007A11 C3                      	retn                         ; any errors in carry flag.
 45479                                  
 45480                                  ; 13/07/2018
 45481                                  
 45482                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 45483                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45484                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 45485                                  ;
 45486                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45487                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 45488                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 45489                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 45490                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45491                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 45492                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 45493                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 45494                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 45495                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 45496                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45497                                  
 45498                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45499                                  
 45500                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45501                                  
 45502                                  Canonicalize:
 45503                                  
 45504                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 45505                                  
 45506 00007A12 AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 45507 00007A13 E834E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 45508 00007A16 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 45509 00007A18 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 45510 00007A1A 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 45511 00007A1C AA                      	STOSB
 45512 00007A1D EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 45513                                  CanonDec:
 45514 00007A1F 4E                      	DEC     SI
 45515                                  
 45516                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 45517                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 45518                                  ; buffer.
 45519                                  
 45520                                  CanonLoop:
 45521                                  
 45522                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 45523                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 45524                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 45525                                  
 45526 00007A20 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 45527 00007A22 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {
 45528 00007A24 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 45529 00007A26 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 45530 00007A2B 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 45531 00007A2D B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 45532 00007A2F AA                      	STOSB
 45533 00007A30 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH
 45534                                  DoTerminate:
 45535 00007A32 AA                      	STOSB                           ;           *d++ = 0;
 45536 00007A33 F8                      	CLC                             ;           return (0);
 45537 00007A34 C3                      	retn
 45538                                  
 45539                                  CanonBad:
 45540 00007A35 E8C701                  	CALL	ScanPathChar            ; check for path chars in rest of string
 45541                                  	;mov	al,3
 45542 00007A38 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for bad path error
 45543 00007A3A 7402                    	JZ	short PathEnc		; path character encountered in string
 45544                                  	;mov	al,2
 45545 00007A3C B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; Set bad file error
 45546                                  PathEnc:
 45547 00007A3E F9                      	STC
 45548                                  CanonBad_retn:
 45549 00007A3F C3                      	retn
 45550                                  
 45551                                  ; We have a textual component that we must copy. We uppercase it and truncate
 45552                                  ; it to 8.3
 45553                                  
 45554                                  DoComponent:                            ;           }
 45555 00007A40 E84C00                  	CALL    CopyComponent		;       if (!CopyComponent (s, d))
 45556 00007A43 72FA                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn	;           return (-1);
 45557                                  
 45558                                  ; We special case the . and .. cases. These will be backed up.
 45559                                  
 45560                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'.' + (0 SHL 8)
 45561 00007A45 26833D2E                	CMP	WORD [ES:DI],002Eh
 45562 00007A49 7408                    	JZ	short Skip1

 45564 00007A4B 26813D2E2E              	CMP     WORD [ES:DI],2E2Eh
 45565 00007A50 7508                    	JNZ	short CanonNormal
 45566 00007A52 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           d--;
 45567                                  Skip1:  
 45568 00007A53 E82800                  	CALL    SkipBack                ;           SkipBack ();
 45569                                  	;;mov	al,3
 45570                                  	; 07/07/2024 (*)
 45571                                  	;MOV    AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45572 00007A56 72E7                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn ; AL=3 (*)
 45573 00007A58 EB02                    	JMP     short CanonPath         ;           }
 45574                                  
 45575                                  ; We have a normal path. Advance destination pointer over it.
 45576                                  
 45577                                  CanonNormal:                            ;       else
 45578 00007A5A 01CF                    	ADD     DI,CX                   ;           d += ct;
 45579                                  
 45580                                  ; We have successfully copied a component. We are now pointing at a path
 45581                                  ; sep char or are pointing at a nul or are pointing at something else.
 45582                                  ; If we point at something else, then we have an error.
 45583                                  
 45584                                  CanonPath:
 45585 00007A5C E81600                  	CALL    PathSep
 45586 00007A5F 75D4                    	JNZ	short CanonBad		; something else...
 45587                                  
 45588                                  ; Copy the first path char we see.
 45589                                  
 45590 00007A61 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get the char
 45591 00007A62 E8E5DF                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it path char?

 45593 00007A67 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ; beyond buffer end?
 45594 00007A69 73CA                    	JAE	short CanonBad		; yep, error.
 45595 00007A6B AA                      	STOSB                           ; copy the one byte
 45596                                  
 45597                                  ; Skip all remaining path chars
 45598                                  
 45599                                  CanonPathLoop:
 45600 00007A6C AC                      	LODSB                           ; get next byte
 45601 00007A6D E8DADF                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; path char again?

 45603 00007A72 4E                      	DEC     SI                      ; back up
 45604 00007A73 EBAB                    	JMP	short  CanonLoop	; go copy component

 45606                                  ;BREAK <PathSep - determine if char is a path separator>
 45607                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45608                                  ;   PathSep - look at DS:SI and see if char is / \ or NUL
 45609                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to a char
 45610                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has char from DS:SI (/ => \)
 45611                                  ;               Zero set if AL is / \ or NUL
 45612                                  ;               Zero reset otherwise
 45613                                  ;   Registers modified: AL
 45614                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45615                                  
 45616                                  PathSep:

 45622                                  	;retn				; and return HIS determination

 45627                                  ;BREAK <SkipBack - move backwards to a path separator>
 45628                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45629                                  ;   SkipBack - look at ES:DI and backup until it points to a / ;   Inputs:     ES:DI - point to a char
 45631                                  ;               BX has current directory back up limit (point to a / \)
 45632                                  ;   Outputs:    ES:DI backed up to point to a path char
 45633                                  ;               AL has char from output ES:DI (path sep if carry clear)
 45634                                  ;               Carry set if illegal backup
 45635                                  ;               Carry Clear if ok
 45636                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AL

 45639                                  SkipBack:

 45642 00007A82 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           goto err;

 45644 00007A86 E8C1DF                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ;           break;
 45645 00007A89 75F3                    	JNZ	short SkipBack		;       }
 45646                                  	;CLC				;   return (0);

 45648                                  	; cf=0

 45650                                  SkipBad:                                ;err:

 45658                                  ;Break <CopyComponent - copy out a file path component>
 45659                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45660                                  ;   CopyComponent - copy a file component from a path string (DS:SI) into ES:DI
 45661                                  ;
 45662                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source path
 45663                                  ;               ES:DI - destination
 45664                                  ;               ES:BP - end of buffer
 45665                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - too long
 45666                                  ;               Carry Clear - DS:SI moved past component
 45667                                  ;                   CX has length of destination
 45668                                  ;   Registers modified: AX,CX,DX
 45669                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45670                                  
 45671                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 45675                                  CopyComponent:
 45676

 45776                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 45777                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45778                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 45779                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 45780                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 45781                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 45782                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 45783                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 45784                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 45785                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 45786                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 45787                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise
 45788                                  ;               ThisCDS points to proper CDS if spliced, otherwise it is
 45789                                  ;                   left alone
 45790                                  ;               ThisDPB points to proper DPB
 45791                                  ;   Registers modified: DS:SI, ES:DI, BX,AX,CX
 45792                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45793                                  
 45794                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45795                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C0A6h
 45796                                  
 45797                                  Splice:
 45798 00007B1D 36F606[5A00]FF          	TEST	byte [SS:SPLICES],-1	;smr;SS Override

 45873                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 45874                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45875                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 45876                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 45877                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 45878                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 45879                                  ;
 45880                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 45881                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 45882                                  ;   Outputs:
 45883                                  ;       Carry Clear
 45884                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 45885                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 45886                                  ;       Carry Set
 45887                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 45888                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 45889                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45890                                  
 45891                                  _$NameTrans:
 45892 00007BA3 1E                      	push	ds
 45893 00007BA4 56                      	push	si
 45894 00007BA5 06                      	push	es
 45895 00007BA6 57                      	push	di
 45896 00007BA7 51                      	push	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 45897                                  	
 45898                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45899                                  ; M027 - Start
 45900                                  ;
 45901                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 45902                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 45903                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 45904                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 45905                                  ; and restore CX.
 45906                                  
 45907                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 45908 00007BA8 B516                    	mov     ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 45909 00007BAA E8EE02                  	call	SetAttrib
 45910                                  
 45911                                  ; M027 - End
 45912                                  
 45913                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45914 00007BAD BF[BE03]                	MOV     DI,OPENBUF
 45915 00007BB0 E8EAFC                  	CALL    TransPath               ; to translation (everything)
 45916 00007BB3 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 45917 00007BB4 5F                      	pop     di
 45918 00007BB5 07                      	pop	es
 45919 00007BB6 5E                      	pop     si
 45920 00007BB7 1F                      	pop     ds
 45921 00007BB8 7303                    	JNC	short TransOK
 45922 00007BBA E9CC8A                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 45923                                  TransOK:
 45924 00007BBD BE[BE03]                	MOV     SI,OPENBUF
 45925 00007BC0 16                      	push	ss
 45926 00007BC1 1F                      	pop	ds
 45927                                  ;GotText:
 45928 00007BC2 E8EC9B                  	call	FStrCpy
 45929 00007BC5 E9B78A                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 45932                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45933                                  ;   DriveFromText - examine DS:SI and remove a drive letter, advancing the
 45934                                  ;   pointer.

 45936                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to a text string

 45962                                  ;   TextFromDrive - turn AL into a drive letter: and put it at es:di with
 45963                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 45964                                  ;

 45980                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 45981                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45982                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 45983                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 45984                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 45985                                  ;
 45986                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 45987                                  ;               ES:DI string
 45988                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 45989                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 45990                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 45991                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 45992                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45993                                  
 45994                                  PathPref:

 45996 00007BE9 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 45997 00007BEA F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 45998 00007BEC 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 45999 00007BEE 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 46000 00007BEF 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 46001 00007BF2 E855DE                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 46002 00007BF5 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 46003                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK

 46006                                  Prefix:
 46007 00007BFD 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 46008 00007BFE C3                      	retn

 46044                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>

 46046                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46047                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 46048                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 46049                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 46050                                  ;           INT     int_command
 46051                                  ;
 46052                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 46053                                  ;       ------          --------
 46054                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 46055                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 46056                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 46057                                  ;
 46058                                  ;   Error returns:
 46059                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 46060                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 46061                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 46062                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 46063                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 46066                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>

 46068                                  ;
 46069                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 46070                                  ;
 46071                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 46072                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 46073                                  ;
 46074                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 46075                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 46076                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 46077                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 46078                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46079                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46080                                  ;	USES	all
 46081                                  ;
 46082                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46083                                  
 46084                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46085                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 46360                                  ;**	$CHMOD - Change File Attributes
 46361                                  ;
 46362                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46363                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 46364                                  ;	    MOV     CX, attributes
 46365                                  ;	    MOV     AL,func (0=get, 1=set)
 46366                                  ;	    INT     21h
 46367                                  ;   Error returns:
 46368                                  ;	    AX = error_path_not_found
 46369                                  ;	    AX = error_access_denied
 46370                                  ;
 46371                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46372                                  
 46373                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46374                                  
 46375                                  	; 14/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46376                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C27Ch
 46377                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0AFF4h)
 46378                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0AAB2h)
 46379                                  
 46380                                  _$CHMOD:
 46381                                  	; 14/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46382                                  	;;;
 46383 00007CED 3CFF                    	cmp	al,0FFh		; MS-DOS 7.20 (Win98) - EXTENDED-LENGTH FILENAME OPERATIONS
 46384                                  				; AX = 43FFh
 46385                                  				; BP = 5053h ('PS')
 46386                                  				; CL = function
 46387                                  				; 39h "mkdir" create directory
 46388                                  				; DS:DX -> ASCIZ pathname
 46389                                  				; 56h rename file
 46390                                  				; DS:DX -> ASCIZ filename of existing file (no wildcards)
 46391                                  				; ES:DI -> ASCIZ new filename (no wildcards)
 46392                                  				;
 46393                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
 46394 00007CEF 7520                    	jnz	short std_chmod
 46395 00007CF1 81FD5350                	cmp	bp,5053h
 46396 00007CF5 7515                    	jnz	short chmod_x_2
 46397 00007CF7 88CC                    	mov	ah,cl
 46398                                  	;mov	word [ss:PATHNAMELEN],128
 46399 00007CF9 36C606[0C11]80          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN],128 ; Retro DOS v5.0
 46400 00007CFF 80F939                  	cmp	cl,39h
 46401 00007D02 7503                    	jne	short chmod_x_1
 46402 00007D04 E9D1AA                  	jmp	mkdir_x
 46403                                  chmod_x_1:
 46404 00007D07 80F956                  	cmp	cl,56h
 46405 00007D0A 7472                    	je	short rename_x
 46406                                  chmod_x_2:
 46407 00007D0C B001                    	mov	al,1
 46408                                  	;jmp	short NORERR

 46501                                  ;
 46502                                  ;**	$UNLINK - Delete a File
 46503                                  ;
 46504                                  ;
 46505                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 46506                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 46507                                  ;	    IF VIA SERVER DOS CALL
 46508                                  ;	     MOV     CX,SEARCH_ATTRIB
 46509                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Unlink
 46510                                  ;	    INT     21h
 46511                                  ;
 46512                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = path name
 46513                                  ;		(cx) = search_attribute, if via server_dos
 46514                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 46515                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46516                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46517                                  ;			= error_file_not_found
 46518                                  ;			= error_access_denied
 46519                                  ;
 46520                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46521                                  
 46522                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46523                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C2E4h
 46524                                  
 46525                                  _$UNLINK:

 46527 00007D53 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; Point at input string
 46528 00007D55 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; temp spot for path
 46529 00007D58 E846FB                  	call	TransPathSet		; go get normalized path
 46530 00007D5B 59                      	pop	cx
 46531 00007D5C 7216                    	JC	short ChModErr		; badly formed path
 46532 00007D5E 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1	; meta chars?	;smr;SS Override
 46533 00007D64 750E                    	JNZ	short NotFound
 46534 00007D66 16                      	push	ss
 46535 00007D67 1F                      	pop	ds
 46536                                  	;mov	ch,6
 46537 00007D68 B506                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system ; unlink appropriate files
 46538 00007D6A E82E01                  	call	SetAttrib
 46539 00007D6D E8AAAD                  	call	DOS_DELETE		; remove that file
 46540                                  	;JC	short UnlinkE 		; error is there
 46541                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46542 00007D70 729C                    	jc	short NORERR
 46543

 46687                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 46688                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46689                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry. Return a file handle if there
 46690                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 46691                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 46692                                  ;
 46693                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 46694                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 46695                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 46696                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 46697                                  ;		Carry Set:
 46698                                  ;		    AX has error code
 46699                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 46700                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46701                                  
 46702                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 46703 00007DEC 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack
 46704 00007DED B9[D530]                	MOV	CX,DOS_Create_New	; routine to call
 46705 00007DF0 E9F1FE                  	JMP	AccessSet		; use good ol' open
 46706                                  
 46707                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 46708                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46709                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 46710                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 46711                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 46712                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 46713                                  ;
 46714                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 46715                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 46716                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 46717                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 46718                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46719                                  
 46720                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 46721                                  ;BinToAscii:
 46722                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 46723                                  ;bta5:
 46724                                  ;	push    cx
 46725                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 46726                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 46727                                  ;	push    ax
 46728                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 46729                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 46730                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 46731                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 46732                                  ;	add     al,7
 46733                                  ;bta6: 
 46734                                  ;	stosb
 46735                                  ;	pop     ax
 46736                                  ;	pop     cx
 46737                                  ;	loop    bta5
 46738                                  ;	retn
 46739                                  
 46740                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46741                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 & Windows ME
 46742                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0B0D9h)
 46743                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0ABA4h)
 46744                                  %if 0
 46745                                  
 46746                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46747                                  BinToAscii:
 46748                                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 46749                                  bta5:	
 46750                                  	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 46751                                  	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 46752                                  	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 46753                                  	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 46754                                  	STOSB				; drop in the character
 46755                                  	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 46756                                  	dec	ch
 46757                                  	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 46758                                  	retn
 46759                                  %else
 46760                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46761                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C385h
 46762                                  
 46763                                  BinToAscii:
 46764 00007DF3 50                      	push	ax		; convert a number to a string ; ax = value
 46765 00007DF4 86C4                    	xchg	ah,al
 46766                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46767 00007DF6 D410                    	aam	10h		; AH = AL / 16 and AL = remainder
 46768 00007DF8 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; 'AA'
 46769 00007DFB AB                      	stosw
 46770 00007DFC 58                      	pop	ax
 46771                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46772 00007DFD D410                    	aam	10h
 46773 00007DFF 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; add ax,'AA'
 46774 00007E02 AB                      	stosw
 46775 00007E03 C3                      	retn	
 46776                                  %endif
 46777                                  
 46778                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 46779                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46780                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 46781                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 46782                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 46783                                  ;
 46784                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 46785                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 46786                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 46787                                  ;		AX has handle
 46788                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 46789                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46790                                  
 46791                                  	; 10/07/2024
 46792                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46793                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46794                                  
 46795                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 46796                                  	;Enter
 46797 00007E04 55                      	push	bp
 46798 00007E05 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 46799                                  
 46800                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 46801                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 46802                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 46803                                  
 46804 00007E07 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 46805                                  
 46806                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 46807 00007E0A F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 46808 00007E0E 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 46809                                  
 46810                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 46811                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 46812                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 46813                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 46814                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 46815                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 46816                                  
 46817                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 46818 00007E10 B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 46819 00007E13 EB7A                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 46820                                  
 46821                                  OKatts:
 46822                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 46823 00007E15 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 46824                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 46825 00007E18 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 46826                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 46827 00007E1B 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 46828                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir
 46829 00007E1E 8C5EFE                  	mov	[bp-2],ds
 46830 00007E21 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 46831 00007E22 07                      	POP	ES			; destination for nul search
 46832 00007E23 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 46833 00007E25 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 46834 00007E27 F7D9                    	NEG	CX			; number of bytes remaining in segment
 46835                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46836 00007E29 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;AN000;MS. cx=0 ? ds:dx on segment boundary
 46837 00007E2B 7501                    	JNZ	short okok		;AN000;MS. no
 46838                                  	;MOV	CX,-1			;AN000;MS.
 46839                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46840                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46841 00007E2D 49                      	dec	cx  ; mov cx,-1
 46842                                  	;mov	cx,-1 ; 0FFFh
 46843                                  okok:					;AN000;
 46844 00007E2E 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			;AN000;
 46845 00007E30 F2AE                    	REPNZ	SCASB			;AN000;
 46846                                  					;AN000;
 46847 00007E32 4F                      	DEC	DI			; point back to the null
 46848 00007E33 268A45FF                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI-1]		; Get char before the NUL
 46849 00007E37 E810DC                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; Is it a path separator?
 46850 00007E3A 7403                    	JZ	short SETENDPTR		; Yes
 46851                                  STOREPTH:
 46852 00007E3C B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 46853 00007E3E AA                      	STOSB				; Add a path separator (and INC DI)
 46854                                  SETENDPTR:
 46855                                  	; 10/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 46856                                  	;MOV	EndPtrL,DI		; pointer to the tail
 46857                                  	; 09/07/2024 (Retro DOS v4 BugFix - Erdogan Tan - Istanbul)
 46858                                  	; (Note: I find this Retro DOS v4 Kernel bug while searching the reason
 46859                                  	;  of the AutoCAD R12 running/startup problem. Now it is solved here.)
 46860                                  	;mov	[bp-4],dl ; (Retro DOS v4 !Bug!)
 46861 00007E3F 897EFC                  	mov	[bp-4],di ; !Fix!
 46862                                  CreateLoop:
 46863 00007E42 16                      	push	ss			; let ReadTime see variables
 46864 00007E43 1F                      	pop	ds
 46865 00007E44 55                      	push	bp
 46866 00007E45 E8338D                  	call	READTIME		; go get time
 46867 00007E48 5D                      	pop	bp
 46868                                  ;
 46869                                  ; Time is in CX:DX. Go drop it into the string.
 46870                                  ;
 46871                                  	;les	di,EndPtr		; point to the string
 46872 00007E49 C47EFC                  	les	di,[BP-4]
 46873 00007E4C 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx

 46875 00007E51 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx
 46876 00007E53 E89DFF                  	call	BinToAscii		; store lower word

 46878 00007E58 AA                      	STOSB				; nul terminate
 46879                                  	;LDS	DX,FilPtr		; get name
 46880 00007E59 C556F8                  	lds	dx,[bp-8]
 46881                                  	;MOV	CX,Attr 		; get attr
 46882 00007E5C 8B4EF6                  	mov	cx,[bp-10]
 46883 00007E5F 55                      	push	bp
 46884 00007E60 E889FF                  	CALL	_$CreateNewFile		; try to create a new file
 46885 00007E63 5D                      	pop	bp
 46886 00007E64 732A                    	JNC	short CreateDone	; failed, go try again
 46887                                  
 46888                                  ; The operation failed and the error has been mapped in AX. Grab the extended
 46889                                  ; error and figure out what to do.
 46890                                  
 46891                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3			; M049 - start
 46892                                  ;;	mov	ax,[ss:EXTERR]				;smr;SS Override
 46893                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_file_exists
 46894                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; file existed => try with new name
 46895                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_access_denied
 46896                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; access denied (attr mismatch)
 46897                                  
 46898                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46899                                  	;cmp	al,50h
 46900 00007E66 3C50                    	CMP	AL,error_file_exists	; Q: did file already exist
 46901 00007E68 74D8                    	JZ	short CreateLoop	; Y: try again
 46902                                  	;cmp	al,5
 46903 00007E6A 3C05                    	CMP	AL,error_access_denied	; Q: was it access denied
 46904 00007E6C 7521                    	JNZ	short SETTMPERR		; N: Error out
 46905                                  					; Y: Check to see if we got this due
 46906                                  					;    to the network drive. Note that
 46907                                  					;    the redir will set the exterr
 46908                                  					;    to error_cannot_make if this is 
 46909                                  					;    so.
 46910                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46911                                  %if 0
 46912                                  	CMP	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_net_access_denied ; M069
 46913                                  					; See if it's REALLY an att mismatch
 46914                                  	je	short SETTMPERR		; no, network error, stop
 46915                                  ;M070
 46916                                  ; If the user failed on an I24, we do not want to try again
 46917                                  ;
 46918                                  	cmp	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_FAIL_I24 ;User failed on I24? ;M070
 46919                                  	;je	short SETTMPERR		;yes, do not try again ;M070
 46920                                  
 46921                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop	;attr mismatch, try again ;M070
 46922                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46923                                  	jne	short CreateLoop ; 10/06/2019 
 46924                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46925                                  	;jz	short SETTMPERR
 46926                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop
 46927                                  %else
 46928                                  	; 15/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46929                                  	;;;

 46931 00007E72 3C41                    	cmp	al,41h			; error_net_access_denied

 46934 00007E78 7415                    	je	short SETTMPERR

 46936 00007E7C 74C4                    	je	short CreateLoop
 46937 00007E7E 36C43E[A205]            	les	di,[ss:THISCDS]
 46938 00007E83 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh ; -1
 46939 00007E86 74BA                    	je	short CreateLoop	; No CDS

 46942 00007E88 26F6454480              	test	byte [es:di+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)

 46945                                  %endif

 46960                                  ;   SetAttrib will set the search attribute (SAttrib) either to the normal
 46961                                  ;   (CH) or to the value in CL if the current system call is through
 46962                                  ;   serverdoscall.

 46965                                  ;		fSharing == TRUE => set sattrib to CL

 46995                                  ;Break	<Extended_Open- Extended open the file>
 46996                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46997                                  ; Input: AL= 0 reserved  AH=6CH
 46998                                  ;	 BX= mode
 46999                                  ;	 CL= create attribute  CH=search attribute (from server)
 47000                                  ;	 DX= flag
 47001                                  ;	 DS:SI = file name
 47002                                  ;	 ES:DI = parm list
 47003                                  ;			   DD  SET EA list (-1) null
 47004                                  ;			   DW  n  parameters
 47005                                  ;			   DB  type (TTTTTTLL)
 47006                                  ;			   DW  IOMODE
 47007                                  ; Function: Extended Open
 47008                                  ; Output: carry clear
 47009                                  ;		     AX= handle
 47010                                  ;		     CX=1 file opened
 47011                                  ;			2 file created/opened
 47012                                  ;			3 file replaced/opened
 47013                                  ;	  carry set: AX has error code
 47014                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47015                                  
 47016                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47017                                  	; 16/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47018                                  
 47019                                  _$Extended_Open:			  ;AN000;

 47238                                  ;BREAK <$LockOper - Lock Calls>
 47239                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47240                                  ;
 47241                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47242                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle	       (DOS 3.3)
 47243                                  ;	    MOV     CX, OffsetHigh
 47244                                  ;	    MOV     DX, OffsetLow
 47245                                  ;	    MOV     SI, LengthHigh
 47246                                  ;	    MOV     DI, LengthLow
 47247                                  ;	    MOV     AH, LockOper
 47248                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 47249                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47250                                  ;
 47251                                  ;   Error returns:
 47252                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47253                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47254                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47255                                  ;
 47256                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47257                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 5C??	       (DOS 4.00)
 47258                                  ;
 47259                                  ;				    0? lock all
 47260                                  ;				    8? lock write
 47261                                  ;				    ?2 lock multiple
 47262                                  ;				    ?3 unlock multiple
 47263                                  ;				    ?4 lock/read
 47264                                  ;				    ?5 write/unlock
 47265                                  ;				    ?6 add (lseek EOF/lock/write/unlock)
 47266                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 47267                                  ;	    MOV     CX, count or size
 47268                                  ;	    LDS     DX, buffer
 47269                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47270                                  ;
 47271                                  ;   Error returns:
 47272                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47273                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47274                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
