 47745                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47746                                  ;   ShareEnd - terminate sharing info on a particular SFT/UID/PID. This does
 47747                                  ;       NOT perform a close, it merely asserts that the sharing information
 47748                                  ;       for the SFT/UID/PID may be safely released.
 47749                                  ;
 47750                                  ;   Inputs:     ES:DI points to an SFT
 47751                                  ;   Outputs:    None
 47752                                  ;   Registers modified: all except DS,ES,DI
 47753                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47754                                  
 47755                                  ShareEnd:
 47756                                  	; 26/07/2019
 47757 000080C3 FF1E[9800]              	call	far [JShare+(2*4)]	; 2 = MFTClose
 47758 000080C7 C3                      	retn
 47759                                  
 47760                                  ;Break <ShareEnter - attempt to enter a node into the sharing set>
 47761                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47762                                  ;   ShareEnter - perform a retried entry of a nodde into the sharing set. If
 47763                                  ;   the max number of retries is exceeded, we notify the user via int 24.
 47764                                  ;
 47765                                  ;   Inputs:     ThisSFT points to the SFT
 47766                                  ;               WFP_Start points to the WFP
 47767                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry clear => successful entry
 47768                                  ;               Carry set => failed system call
 47769                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 47770                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47771                                  
 47772                                  ShareEnter:
 47773 000080C8 51                      	push	cx
 47774                                  retry:
 47775 000080C9 8B0E[1A00]              	mov     cx,[RetryCount]
 47776                                  attempt:
 47777 000080CD C43E[9E05]              	les     di,[THISSFT]		; grab sft
 47778 000080D1 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 47779                                   	;mov	[es:di+51],ax
 47780 000080D3 26894533                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],AX ; indicate free SFT
 47781 000080D7 51                      	push	cx
 47782 000080D8 E8ABFF                  	call    SHARE_CHECK             ; attempt to enter into the sharing set
 47783 000080DB 59                      	pop	cx
 47784 000080DC 730A                    	jnc	short done		; success, let the user see this
 47785 000080DE E8F496                  	call	Idle                    ; wait a while
 47786 000080E1 E2EA                    	loop    attempt                 ; go back for another attempt
 47787 000080E3 E8A5FF                  	call    SHARE_VIOLATION         ; signal the problem to the user
 47788 000080E6 73E1                    	jnc	short retry		; user said to retry, go do it
 47789                                  done:
 47790 000080E8 59                      	pop	cx
 47791 000080E9 C3                      	retn
 47792                                  
 47793                                  ;============================================================================
 47794                                  ; EXEPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 47795                                  ;============================================================================
 47796                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 47797                                  ; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 47798                                  
 47799                                  ;** EXEPATCH.ASM 
 47800                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47801                                  ;	Contains the foll:
 47802                                  ;
 47803                                  ;		- code to find and overlay buggy unpack code
 47804                                  ;		- new code to be overlayed on buggy unpack code 
 47805                                  ;		- old code sequence to identify buggy unpack code
 47806                                  ;
 47807                                  ;	Revision history:
 47808                                  ;
 47809                                  ;		Created: 5/14/90
 47810                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47811                                  
 47812                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47813                                  ;
 47814                                  ; M020 : Fix for rational bug - for details see routine header
 47815                                  ; M028 : 4b04 implementation
 47816                                  ; M030 : Fixing bug in EXEPACKPATCH (EXEC_CS is an un-relocated value)
 47817                                  ; M032 : set turnoff bit only if DOS in HMA.
 47818                                  ; M033 : if IP < 2 then not exepacked.
 47819                                  ; M046 : support for a 4th version of exepacked files.
 47820                                  ; M068 : support for copy protected apps.
 47821                                  ; M071 : use A20OFF_COUNT of 10.
 47822                                  ;
 47823                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47824                                  
 47825                                  PATCH1_COM_OFFSET	EQU	06CH
 47826                                  PATCH1_OFFSET		EQU	028H
 47827                                  PATCH1_CHKSUM		EQU	0EF4EH
 47828                                  CHKSUM1_LEN		EQU	11CH/2 ; 142
 47829                                  
 47830                                  PATCH2_COM_OFFSET	EQU	076H
 47831                                  PATCH2_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47832                                  
 47833                                  	; The strings that start at offset 076h have two possible 
 47834                                  	; check sums that are defined as PATCH2_CHKSUM PATCH2A_CHKSUM
 47835                                  
 47836                                  PATCH2_CHKSUM		EQU	78B2H
 47837                                  CHKSUM2_LEN		EQU	119H/2
 47838                                  PATCH2A_CHKSUM		EQU	1C47H		; M046
 47839                                  CHKSUM2A_LEN		EQU	103H/2		; M046
 47840                                  
 47841                                  PATCH3_COM_OFFSET	EQU	074H
 47842                                  PATCH3_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47843                                  PATCH3_CHKSUM		EQU	4EDEH
 47844                                  CHKSUM3_LEN		EQU	117H/2
 47845                                  
 47846                                  ;**	Data structure passed for ExecReady call
 47847                                  ;
 47848                                  ;struc ERStruc
 47849                                  ; .ER_Reserved:	resw	1	; reserved, should be zero
 47850                                  ; .ER_Flags:	resw	1
 47851                                  ; .ER_ProgName:	resd	1	; ptr to ASCIIZ str of prog name
 47852                                  ; .ER_PSP:	resw	1	; PSP of the program
 47853                                  ; .ER_StartAddr: resd	1	; Start CS:IP of the program
 47854                                  ; .ER_ProgSize:	resd	1	; Program size including PSP
 47855                                  ; .size:
 47856                                  ;endstruc
 47857                                  
 47858                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 47859                                  
 47860                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47861                                  	; DOSCODE:B3DDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 47862                                  
 47863                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47864                                  	; DOSCODE:B37Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 47865                                  
 47866                                  	; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47867                                  	; DOSCODE:C697h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 47868                                  
 47869                                  ; M028 - BEGIN
 47870                                  
 47871                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47872                                  ;
 47873                                  ;	Procedure Name		: ExecReady
 47874                                  ;
 47875                                  ;	Input			: DS:DX -> ERStruc (see exe.inc)
 47876                                  ;
 47877                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47878                                  
 47879                                  ExecReady:
 47880 000080EA 89D6                    	mov	si,dx			; move the pointer into a friendly one
 47881                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47882                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47883 000080EC F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47884                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; COM or EXE ?
 47885 000080F0 7418                    	jz	short er_setver		; only setver for .COM files
 47886                                  
 47887                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47888 000080F2 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47889 000080F5 83C010                  	add	ax,10h
 47890 000080F8 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 47891                                  
 47892                                  	;mov	cx,[si+10]
 47893 000080FA 8B4C0A                  	mov	cx,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr]   ; M030
 47894                                  	;mov	ax,[si+12]	; 11/04/2024
 47895 000080FD 8B440C                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr+2] ; M030
 47896                                  
 47897                                  	;call	[ss:FixExePatch]
 47898 00008100 36FF16[670D]            	call	word [ss:FixExePatch] ; 28/12/2022
 47899                                  	
 47900                                  	; 20/03/2024
 47901                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47902 00008105 36FF16[4612]            	call	word [ss:Rational386PatchPtr]
 47903                                  
 47904                                  er_setver:
 47905                                  	;;test	word [si+2],2		; Q: is this an overlay
 47906                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47907 0000810A F6440202                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY ; 2
 47908                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY
 47909 0000810E 7518                    	jnz	short er_chkdoshi	; Y: set A20OFF_COUNT if DOS high
 47910                                  					; N: set up lie version first
 47911 00008110 1E                      	push	ds
 47912 00008111 56                      	push	si
 47913                                  	;lds	si,[si+4]
 47914 00008112 C57404                  	lds	si,[si+ERStruc.ER_ProgName]
 47915 00008115 E8DCEC                  	call	Scan_Execname1
 47916 00008118 E8EDEC                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 47917 0000811B 5E                      	pop	si
 47918 0000811C 1F                      	pop	ds
 47919                                  	;mov	es,[si+8]
 47920 0000811D 8E4408                  	mov	es,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47921 00008120 36A1[BB0E]              	mov	ax,[ss:SPECIAL_VERSION]
 47922                                  	;mov	[es:40h],ax ; 11/04/2024
 47923 00008124 26A34000                	mov	[es:PDB.Version],ax
 47924                                  
 47925                                  er_chkdoshi:
 47926 00008128 36803E[660D]00          	cmp	byte [ss:DosHasHMA],0	; M032: Q: is dos in HMA (M021)
 47927 0000812E 741E                    	je	short er_done		; M032: N: done
 47928                                  
 47929                                  					; M068 - Start
 47930                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47931 00008130 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]	; ax = PSP
 47932                                  
 47933                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],4
 47934 00008133 36800E[8600]04          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECA20OFF ; Set bit to signal int 21
 47935                                  					; ah = 25 & ah= 49. See dossym.inc 
 47936                                  					; under TAG M003 & M009 for 
 47937                                  					; explanation
 47938                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47939                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47940 00008139 F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47941                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; Q: COM file
 47942 0000813D 7506                    	jnz	short er_setA20		; N: inc a20off_count, set 
 47943                                  					;    a20off_psp and ret
 47944                                     	; 07/03/2025
 47945                                  	;push	ds
 47946                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; DS = load segment of com file.
 47947                                  	;call	IsCopyProt ; !*!	; check if copy protected
 47948                                  	;pop	ds
 47949                                  
 47950                                  	; 07/03/2025 (MiniDOS 1.0)
 47951 0000813F 36C606[8500]0A          	mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0Ah ; *!*
 47952                                  
 47953                                  er_setA20:
 47954                                  	; We need to inc the A20OFF_COUNT here. Note that if the count
 47955                                  	; is non-zero at this point it indicates that the A20 is to be 
 47956                                  	; turned off for that many int 21 calls made by the app. In 
 47957                                  	; addition the A20 has to be turned off when we exit from this 
 47958                                  	; call. Hence the inc.
 47959                                  
 47960 00008145 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]		
 47961 0000814A 36A3[6300]              	mov	[ss:A20OFF_PSP],ax	; set the PSP for which A20 is to be
 47962                                  					; turned OFF.
 47963                                  er_done:				; M068 - End
 47964 0000814E 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 47965 00008150 C3                      	retn
 47966

 47997                                  
 47998                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47999                                  ; DOSCODE:B76Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 48000                                  
 48001                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48002                                  ; DOSCODE:CCE1h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48003                                  
 48004                                  ; Convert AX from a number of bytes to a number of paragraphs (round up).
 48005                                  
 48006                                  ParaRound:
 48007 00008154 83C00F                  	add	ax, 15
 48008 00008157 D1D8                    	rcr	ax, 1
 48009 00008159 D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1

 48020                                  
 48021                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48022                                  ;
 48023                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 48024                                  ;
 48025                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 48026                                  ;
 48027                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 48028                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 48029                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 48030                                  ;
 48031                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 48032                                  ;
 48033                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48034                                  
 48035                                  WhatCPUType:
 48036                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48037                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 48038                                  
 48039                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 48040                                  
 48041                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 48042                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 48043                                  ;
 48044                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 48045                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 48046                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 48047                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 48048                                  
 48049                                  	; 04/11/2022
 48050                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 48051                                  
 48052                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48053                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0CCEDh
 48054                                  
 48055                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 48056 00008160 9C                      	pushf
 48057 00008161 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 48058 00008162 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 48059                                  
 48060 00008164 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 48061 00008166 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 48062 00008167 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 48063 00008168 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 48064 00008169 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 48065 0000816A 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 48066 0000816D 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 48067 00008170 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 48068                                  
 48069 00008172 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 48070 00008175 50                      	push	ax
 48071 00008176 9D                      	popf
 48072 00008177 9C                      	pushf
 48073 00008178 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 48074 00008179 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 48075 0000817C 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 48076                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 48077 0000817E 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 48078                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 48079 0000817F 43                      	inc	bx
 48080                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 48081 00008180 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 48082 00008182 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 48083 00008183 9D                      	popf
 48084                                  	
 48085                                  	;endm
 48086                                  
 48087                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48088 00008184 C3                      	retn	; 19/09/2023
 48089                                  
 48090                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48091                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022

 48095                                  ; MAIN ENTRY FOR DOS INITIALIZATION

 48099                                  
 48100                                  	; 23/03/2024
 48101                                  	; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48102                                  	; DOSCODE:CCEDh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48103                                  
 48104                                  	; DOSCODE:BA57h (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS)
 48105                                  	; BIOSCODE:CF81h (Windows ME IO.SYS)
 48106                                  	
 48107                                  	; 30/05/2019
 48108                                  	; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48109                                  	; 07/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 48110                                  	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 03/03/2018
 48111                                  	; 03/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48112                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 79A9h
 48113                                  DOSINIT:
 48114                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 7C77h
 48115                                  	;
 48116                                  	; Far call from SYSINIT
 48117                                  	; DX = Memory size in paragraphs
 48118                                  	; DS:SI = [DEVICE_LIST] (SYSINIT.S) 
 48119                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v2.0, 16/03/2018)
 48120                                  	;
 48121                                  	; ES:DI = ptr to BIOS communication block (sysinit3.s)
 48122                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v4.0, 20/04/2019)
 48123                                  
 48124 00008185 FA                              CLI
 48125 00008186 FC                              CLD
 48126                                  
 48127                                  	; 03/11/2022
 48128                                  	;push	dx ; 30/05/2019		; save parameters from BIOS
 48129                                  	
 48130                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48131                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48132                                  	;push	dx ; =*=		; save parameters from BIOS
 48133                                  	
 48134 00008187 56                      	push	si
 48135 00008188 1E                      	push	ds
 48136 00008189 57                      	push	di			;save di (ptr to BiosComBlock)
 48137                                  
 48138 0000818A 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			;bx:di = ptr to BiosComBlock
 48139                                  
 48140                                  ; First, move the DOS data segment to its final location in low memory
 48141                                  
 48142                                  	;;;mov	ax,0BF69h ; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 7C7Fh
 48143                                  	;;mov	ax,0BC77h ; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 79B1h
 48144                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48145                                  	;mov	ax,0D20Fh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, file offset 92FFh
 48146 0000818C B8[FC85]                	mov	ax,MEMSTRT		; get offset of end of init code
 48147                                  
 48148                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48149 0000818F 83C00F                  	add	ax,15			; round to nearest paragraph
 48150                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; boundary
 48151                                  	; 12/04/2024
 48152 00008192 24F0                    	and	al,0F0h
 48153                                  
 48154 00008194 89C6                    	mov	si,ax			; si = offset of DOSDATA in current
 48155                                  					; code segment
 48156                                  	; 05/12/2022
 48157                                  	; 30/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48158                                  	;xor	si,si
 48159                                  	
 48160                                  	;mov	ax,cs
 48161                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; ds = current code segment
 48162                                  					; DS:SI now points to dosdata
 48163                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48164 00008196 0E                      	push	cs
 48165 00008197 1F                      	pop	ds
 48166                                  
 48167                                  	;mov	es,[cs:0BA49h] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, offset 7C8Eh 
 48168                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]	; First access to DosDataSg in
 48169                                  					;  BData segment. Cannot use
 48170                                  					;  getdseg macro here!!!
 48171                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48172 00008198 8E06[5281]              	mov	es,[InitBioDataSeg]
 48173                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48174                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]  ; ds = cs !
 48175                                  
 48176                                  	;mov	es,[es:3]
 48177 0000819C 268E060300              	mov	es,[es:DosDataSg]	; Get free location in low memory
 48178                                  
 48179 000081A1 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; ES:DI now points to RAM data
 48180                                  
 48181                                  	;mov	cx,4970  ; Offset 0BA78h in MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 48182                                  	;mov	cx,4976  ; 25/05/2019
 48183                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48184                                  	;mov	cx,4934	 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 48185                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48186                                  	;mov	cx,4962
 48187                                  	;mov	cx,MSDAT001E		; get end of dosdata = size of dosdata
 48188 000081A3 B94812                  	mov	cx,DOSDATASIZE	; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 48189                                  				; = 4934 for PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM ; 01/07/2024
 48190 000081A6 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; move data to final location
 48191                                  	
 48192 000081A8 5F                      	pop	di			; restore ptr to BiosComBlock
 48193 000081A9 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore parms from BIOS
 48194 000081AA 5E                      	pop	si
 48195                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48196                                  	;pop	dx ; 30/05/2019	
 48197                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48198                                  	;pop	dx ; =*=
 48199                                  
 48200 000081AB 06                      	push	es
 48201 000081AC 1E                      	push	ds
 48202 000081AD 07                      	pop	es			; es:si -> device chain
 48203 000081AE 1F                      	pop	ds			; ds points to dosdata
 48204                                  
 48205                                  ;SR;
 48206                                  ;We get a ptr to the BIOS exchange data block. This has been setup right 
 48207                                  ;now so that the EXEC call knows when SysInit is present to do the special
 48208                                  ;lie table handling for device drivers. This can be expanded later on to
 48209                                  ;establish a communication block from the BIOS to the DOS.
 48210                                  
 48211                                  	;mov	[1040h],di	; Offset 0BA87h in MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 48212                                  	;mov	[1042h],bx
 48213 000081AF 893E[2B12]              	mov	[BiosDataPtr],di
 48214 000081B3 891E[2D12]              	mov	[BiosDataPtr+2],bx	; save ptr to BiosComBlock
 48215

 49035                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49036                                  ;
 49037                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 49038                                  ;
 49039                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 49040                                  ;
 49041                                  ;	USED:	none
 49042                                  ;
 49043                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49044                                  
 49045                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 49046                                  ;
 49047                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 49048                                  ;
 49049 00008483 50                      	push	ax
 49050                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 49051 00008484 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 49052 00008487 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49053                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 49054                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 49055                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 49056 00008489 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 49057 0000848B 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 49058                                  ;
 49059                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 49060                                  ; need to call it later.
 49061                                  ;
 49062 0000848D 53                      	push	bx
 49063 0000848E 52                      	push	dx
 49064 0000848F 1E                      	push	ds
 49065 00008490 06                      	push	es
 49066                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 49067 00008491 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 49068 00008494 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49069                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 49070                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 49071                                  
 49072 00008496 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 49073                                  
 49074 0000849B 891E[4D10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 49075 0000849F 8C06[4F10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 49076                                  cXMMexit:
 49077 000084A3 F8                      	clc
 49078 000084A4 07                      	pop	es
 49079 000084A5 1F                      	pop	ds
 49080 000084A6 5A                      	pop	dx
 49081 000084A7 5B                      	pop	bx
 49082 000084A8 58                      	pop	ax
 49083 000084A9 C3                      	retn				; done
 49084                                  ;
 49085                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 49086                                  ;
 49087                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 49088 000084AA F9                      	stc
 49089 000084AB 58                      	pop	ax
 49090 000084AC C3                      	retn

 49092                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49093                                  ;
 49094                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 49095                                  ;
 49096                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 49097                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 49098                                  ;
 49099                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 49100                                  ;		   if AX =0
 49101                                  ;		      if first entry
 49102                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 49103                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 49104                                  ;		      else
 49105                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 49106                                  ;
 49107                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 49108                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES
 49109                                  ;
 49110                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 49111                                  ;
 49112                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx
 49113                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49114                                  
 49115 000084AD 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 49116                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 49117                                  
 49118                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 49119                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 49120                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 49121                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 49122                                  
 49123                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (ref: PCDOS 7.1)
 49124                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D07Eh
 49125                                  
 49126                                  seg_reinit:	; proc	far
 49127 000084AE 1E                      	push	ds
 49128                                  
 49129 000084AF 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 49130                                  
 49131 000084B4 E87A00                  	call	patch_misc_segments	; patch in segments for sharer and 
 49132                                  					; other tables with seg in ES.
 49133                                  	
 49134                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49135                                  	; cx = 0
 49136 000084B7 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; 0
 49137                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 49138 000084B9 7531                    	jne	short patch_vec_seg	; patch vectors with segment in es
 49139                                  	; 23/03/2024
 49140                                  	;or	ax, ax
 49141                                  	;jnz	short patch_vec_seg
 49142                                  
 49143                                  	; 23/03/2024
 49144                                  	;cmp	[cs:num_entry],al ; 0

 49592                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49593                                  ;
 49594                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 49595                                  ;
 49596                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 49597                                  ;
 49598                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 49599                                  ;
 49600                                  ;	Description:
 49601                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 49602                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 49603                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 49604                                  ;
 49605                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49606                                  
 49607                                  	; 04/11/2022
 49608                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BC50h
 49609                                  
 49610                                  	; 23/03/2024
 49611                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BF42h
 49612                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 49613                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D1E9h
 49614                                  
 49615                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 49616                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 49617                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 49618                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 49619                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 49620                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 49621                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 49622                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 49623                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 49624 000085D6 [700F]                  	dw	i0patch
 49625 000085D8 [7A0F]                  	dw	i20patch
 49626 000085DA [840F]                  	dw	i21patch
 49627 000085DC [8E0F]                  	dw	i25patch
 49628 000085DE [980F]                  	dw	i26patch
 49629 000085E0 [A20F]                  	dw	i27patch
 49630 000085E2 [AC0F]                  	dw	i2fpatch
 49631 000085E4 [B60F]                  	dw	cpmpatch
 49632                                  
 49633                                  patch_table_size equ ($-patch_table)/2
 49634                                  
 49635                                  patch_in_nops:
 49636 000085E6 50                      	push	ax
 49637 000085E7 56                      	push	si
 49638 000085E8 BE[D685]                	mov	si,patch_table

 49862                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49863                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 49864                                  ;;
 49865                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 49866                                  ;;
 49867                                  ;;	on return:
 49868                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 49869                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 49870                                  ;;
 49871                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 49872                                  ;;
 49873                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49874                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49875                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 49876                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 49877                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 49878                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 49879                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 49880                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 49881                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 49882                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 49883                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 49884                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 49885                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 49886                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 49887                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 49888                                  ;;
 49889                                  ;;***************************************************************************

 50097                                  ;============================================================================
 50098                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50099                                  ;============================================================================
 50100                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 50101                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 50102                                  
 50103                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 50104                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50105                                  
 50106                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 50107                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 50108                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 50109                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 50110                                  ;
 50111                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 50112                                  ; describing that data item.
 50113                                  
 50114                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50115                                  
 50116                                  ;
 50117                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 50118                                  ;
 50119                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 50120                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 50121                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 50122                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 50123                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 50124                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 50125                                  ;
 50126                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 50127                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 50128                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 50129                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 50130                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 50131                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 50132                                  ;   as EOF).
 50133                                  
 50134                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 50135                                  
 50136                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 50137                                  
 50138                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 50139 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 50140 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 50141                                  		;dw 5 ; 24/03/2024
 50142 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 50143                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0 ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 24/03/2024
 50144 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 50145                                  
 50146                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 50147                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 50148                                  ; console.

 50150 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin

 50152                                  					;	   of buffered input call

 50154 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 50155                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1
 50156 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 50157 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 50158 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b ; 3	; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 50159                                  switch_character:
 50160 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 50161 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 50162 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 50163 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 50164 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name

 50375                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)

 50377                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 50378                                  
 50379                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 50380                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 50381                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 50382                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 50383                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 50384                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 50385                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 50386                                  ; **********************************************************
 50387                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 50388                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 50389                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 50390                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 50391                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 50392                                  ; **********************************************************	
 50393                                  
 50394                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 50395                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50396                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50397                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 50398                                  
 50399                                  ; 	ORG     0
 50400                                  
 50401                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 50402                                  
 50403                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 50404                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 50405 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 50406 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 50407                                  
 50408                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 50409                                  
 50410                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 50411                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 50412 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 50413                                  RENBUF:	
 50414 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 50415                                  
 50416                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 50417                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 50418 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 50419                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 50420 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 50421                                  
 50422                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 50423                                   
 50424                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 50425                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.

 50430                                  
 50431                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 50432                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 50433                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 50434                                  
 50435                                  NAME1:	
 50436 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 50437                                  NAME2:

 50442                                  	;times	5  db	0

 50994                                  ;
 50995                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 50996                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 50997                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 50998                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 50999                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 51000                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51001                                  ; Example:
 51002                                  
 51003                                  MAP_CASE:
 51004                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 51005                                  
 51006 00000D6B 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 51007                                  	;JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51008                                  	;RETF
 51009                                  	; 24/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 51010                                  	;;;
 51011 00000D6D 720C                    	jb	short L_RET     ;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51012                                  	;;;
 51013                                  Map1:
 51014 00000D6F 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 51015 00000D71 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 51016 00000D72 53                      	PUSH	BX
 51017 00000D73 BB[FC0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 51018                                  FINISH:
 51019 00000D76 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 51020 00000D77 1F                      	POP	DS
 51021 00000D78 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 51022 00000D79 5B                      	POP	BX
 51023 00000D7A 1F                      	POP	DS
 51024                                  L_RET:	
 51025 00000D7B CB                      	RETF
 51026                                  
 51027                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 51028                                  
 51029                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51030

 51375                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51376                                  ; 24/03/2024
 51377                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0DDBh
 51378                                  
 51379                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51380                                  ;
 51381                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 51382                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 51383                                  ;
 51384                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 51385                                  ;
 51386                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 51387                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 51388                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 51389                                  ;
 51390                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51391                                  
 51392                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 51393                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 51394                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 51395                                  ;ELSE
 51396                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 51397                                  ;ENDIF
 51398                                  ;ENDM

 51818                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51819                                  ;
 51820                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 51821                                  ;
 51822                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 51823                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 51824                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 51825                                  ;
 51826                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 51827                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 51828                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 51829                                  ;	   4. else 
 51830                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 51831                                  ;	   6. endif
 51832                                  ;	7. else
 51833                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 51834                                  ;	9. endif
 51835                                  ;
 51836                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51837                                  
 51838                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 51839                                  
 51840                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51841                                  
 51842                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 51843                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0F9Eh
 51844                                  
 51845                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51846                                  ;
 51847                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 51848                                  ;
 51849                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51850                                  
 51851                                  ldivov:
 51852                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51853                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51854                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51855                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51856                                  i0patch:
 51857 00000F70 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 51858                                  
 51859 00000F72 E8E200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51860                                  divov_cont:
 51861 00000F75 2EFF2E[4C0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 51862                                  
 51863                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51864                                  ;
 51865                                  ; INT 20h Handler
 51866                                  ;
 51867                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 51868                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 51869                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 51870                                  ; will be restored then.
 51871                                  ;
 51872                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51873                                  
 51874                                  lquit:
 51875                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51876                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51877                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51878                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51879                                  i20patch:
 51880 00000F7A EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 51881                                  
 51882 00000F7C E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51883                                  quit_cont:
 51884 00000F7F 2EFF2E[500F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 51885                                  
 51886                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51887                                  ;
 51888                                  ; INT 21h Handler
 51889                                  ;
 51890                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51891                                  
 51892                                  lcommand:
 51893                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51894                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51895                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51896                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51897                                  i21patch:
 51898 00000F84 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 51899                                  
 51900 00000F86 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51901                                  command_cont:
 51902 00000F89 2EFF2E[540F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 51903                                  
 51904                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51905                                  ;
 51906                                  ; INT 25h
 51907                                  ;
 51908                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51909                                  
 51910                                  labsdrd:
 51911                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51912                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51913                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51914                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51915                                  i25patch:
 51916 00000F8E EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 51917                                  
 51918 00000F90 E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51919                                  absdrd_cont:
 51920 00000F93 2EFF2E[580F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 51921                                  
 51922                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51923                                  ;
 51924                                  ; INT 26h
 51925                                  ;
 51926                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51927                                  
 51928                                  labsdwrt:
 51929                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51930                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51931                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51932                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51933                                  i26patch:
 51934 00000F98 EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont
 51935                                  
 51936 00000F9A E8BA00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51937                                  absdwrt_cont:
 51938 00000F9D 2EFF2E[5C0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 51939                                  
 51940                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51941                                  ;
 51942                                  ; INT 27h
 51943                                  ;
 51944                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51945                                  
 51946                                  lstay_resident:
 51947                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51948                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51949                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51950                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51951                                  i27patch:
 51952 00000FA2 EB03                    	jmp	short sr_cont
