 51957                                  
 51958                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51959                                  ;
 51960                                  ; INT 2Fh
 51961                                  ;
 51962                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51963                                  
 51964                                  lint2f:
 51965                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51966                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51967                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51968                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51969                                  i2fpatch:
 51970 00000FAC EB03                    	jmp	short int2f_cont
 51971                                  
 51972 00000FAE E8A600                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51973                                  int2f_cont:
 51974 00000FB1 2EFF2E[640F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+24]	; jmp to DOS
 51975                                  
 51976                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51977                                  ;
 51978                                  ; CPM entry
 51979                                  ;
 51980                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51981                                  
 51982                                  lcall_entry:
 51983                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51984                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51985                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51986                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51987                                  cpmpatch:
 51988 00000FB6 EB03                    	jmp	short callentry_cont
 51989                                  
 51990 00000FB8 E89C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51991                                  callentry_cont:
 51992 00000FBB 2EFF2E[680F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 51993                                  
 51994                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51995                                  
 51996                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 51997                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 51998                                  %if 0
 51999                                  
 52000                                  lirett:
 52001                                  	iret
 52002                                  
 52003                                  %endif
 52004                                  
 52005                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52006                                  ;
 52007                                  ; LowIntXX:
 52008                                  ;
 52009                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 52010                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 52011                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 52012                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 52013                                  ;
 52014                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 52015                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 52016                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 52017                                  ;
 52018                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 52019                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 52020                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 52021                                  ;
 52022                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52023                                  
 52024                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52025                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0FEEh
 52026                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:10DBh)
 52027                                  
 52028 00000FC0 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 52029 00000FC4 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 52030                                  
 52031                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52032                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52033                                  %if 0
 52034                                  DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 52035                                  %endif
 52036                                  
 52037                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 52038                                  LowInt23:
 52039                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52040                                  					; the stack
 52041 00000FC8 2E8F06[C00F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 52042 00000FCD 2E8F06[C20F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 52043                                  
 52044 00000FD2 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 52045                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52046                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52047                                  
 52048 00000FD4 E88000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52049                                  
 52050 00000FD7 2EFF2E[C00F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 52051                                  
 52052                                  
 52053                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 52054                                  LowInt24:
 52055                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52056                                  					; the stack
 52057 00000FDC 2E8F06[C40F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 52058 00000FE1 2E8F06[C60F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 52059                                  
 52060 00000FE6 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 52061                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52062                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52063                                  
 52064 00000FE8 E86C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52065                                  
 52066 00000FEB 2EFF2E[C40F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 52067                                  
 52068                                  
 52069                                   
 52070                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 52071                                  LowInt28:
 52072 00000FF0 CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 52073                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52074                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52075                                  
 52076 00000FF2 E86200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52077                                  
 52078 00000FF5 CB                      	retf
 52079                                  
 52080                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52081                                  
 52082                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52083                                  ;
 52084                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 52085                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 52086                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 52087                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 52088                                  ;
 52089                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 52090                                  
 52091                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52092                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1024h
 52093                                  
 52094                                  disa20_xfer:
 52095 00000FF6 E84800                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 52096                                  
 52097                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 52098                                  
 52099                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 52100                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 52101                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 52102                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 52103                                  
 52104 00000FF9 FA                      	cli
 52105 00000FFA 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 52106                                  
 52107                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52108                                  	;;;
 52109 00001000 36C606[C011]00          	mov     byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG],0
 52110                                  	;;;
 52111                                  
 52112 00001006 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 52113 00001008 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 52114 0000100A FB                      	sti
 52115                                  
 52116 0000100B 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 52117 0000100C 56                      	push	SI
 52118 0000100D 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 52119 0000100F 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 52120 00001011 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 52121 00001013 CB                      	retf
 52122                                  
 52123                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52124                                  ;
 52125                                  ; M003:
 52126                                  ;
 52127                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 52128                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 52129                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 52130                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 52131                                  ; more info.
 52132                                  ;
 52133                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 52134                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 52135                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 52136                                  ;
 52137                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52138                                  
 52139                                  disa20_iret:
 52140 00001014 E82A00                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 52141 00001017 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 52142                                  
 52143                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52144                                  	;;;
 52145 0000101B FE0E[C011]              	dec	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
 52146                                  	;;;
 52147                                  
 52148 0000101F 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 52149 00001023 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 52150 00001027 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 52151                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 52152 00001029 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 52153                                  	
 52154                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52155                                  %if 0
 52156                                  	mov	AX,[NSP]
 52157                                  	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 52158                                  	mov	AX,[NSS]
 52159                                  	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 52160                                  %else
 52161                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52162                                  	;;;
 52163                                  	;les	ax, dword ptr ds:NSS
 52164 0000102C C406[F005]              	les	ax,[NSS]
 52165 00001030 8C06[8405]              	mov	[USER_SP],es
 52166 00001034 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],ax
 52167                                  	;;;
 52168                                  %endif
 52169 00001037 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 52170 00001038 5B                      	pop	BX
 52171 00001039 59                      	pop	CX
 52172 0000103A 5A                      	pop	DX
 52173 0000103B 5E                      	pop	SI
 52174 0000103C 5F                      	pop	DI
 52175 0000103D 5D                      	pop	BP
 52176 0000103E 1F                      	pop	DS
 52177 0000103F 07                      	pop	ES
 52178                                  lirett:		; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52179 00001040 CF                      	iret
 52180                                  
 52181                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52182                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 52183                                  ;
 52184                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 52185                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52186                                  ;
 52187                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 52188                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 52189                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 52190                                  ;
 52191                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52192                                  
 52193                                  XMMDisableA20:
 52194 00001041 53                      	push	bx
 52195 00001042 50                      	push	ax
 52196                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 52197 00001043 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 52198 00001045 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52199 0000104A 58                      	pop	ax
 52200 0000104B 5B                      	pop	bx
 52201 0000104C C3                      	retn
 52202                                  
 52203                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 52204                                  
 52205                                  XMMcontrol:
 52206 0000104D 00000000                	dd	0
 52207                                  
 52208                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52209                                  ; 24/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52210                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:107Fh
 52211                                  ;;;
 52212 00001051 00000000                	dd	0
 52213                                  SC_STATUS:
 52214 00001055 0000                    	dw	0
 52215                                  ;;;
 52216                                  
 52217                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52218                                  ;
 52219                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 52220                                  ;
 52221                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 52222                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52223                                  ;
 52224                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 52225                                  ;
 52226                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 52227                                  ;		
 52228                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 52229                                  ;
 52230                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52231                                  
 52232                                  ; 19/09/2023
 52233                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 52234                                  ;	dw	00080h
 52235                                  ;	dw	00000h
 52236                                  ;
 52237                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 52238                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 52239                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 52240                                  
 52241                                  	; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52242                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1085h
 52243                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:116Fh)
 52244                                  
 52245                                  EnsureA20ON:
 52246 00001057 9C                      	pushf
 52247 00001058 1E                      	push    ds
 52248 00001059 06                      	push	es
 52249 0000105A 51                      	push	cx
 52250 0000105B 56                      	push	si
 52251 0000105C 57                      	push	di
 52252                                  
 52253                                  	; 19/09/2023
 52254                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 52255                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 52256                                  
 52257                                  	; 25/03/2024 
 52258                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52259                                  	;;;
 52260 0000105D 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 52261 0000105F 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 52262 00001061 4E                      	dec	si
 52263 00001062 BF9000                  	mov	di,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 52264 00001065 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
 52265 00001067 BE8000                  	mov	si,80h	; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 52266                                  	;;;	
 52267                                  
 52268 0000106A B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 52269 0000106D FC                      	cld
 52270 0000106E F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 52271                                  
 52272 00001070 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 52273                                  EA20_RET:
 52274 00001072 5F                      	pop	di
 52275 00001073 5E                      	pop	si
 52276 00001074 59                      	pop	cx
 52277 00001075 07                      	pop	es
 52278 00001076 1F                      	pop	ds
 52279 00001077 9D                      	popf
 52280 00001078 C3                      	retn
 52281                                  
 52282                                  EA20_OFF:
 52283                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 52284                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 52285                                  
 52286 00001079 53                      	push	bx
 52287 0000107A 50                      	push	ax
 52288                                  
 52289                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52290                                  %if 0
 52291                                  	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 52292                                  	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 52293                                  	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52294                                  	mov	ax,cs
 52295                                  	mov	ss,ax
 52296                                  %else
 52297                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52298                                  	;;;
 52299 0000107B 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 52300 0000107D 2E8C16[6C0F]            	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ss
 52301 00001082 2E8926[6E0F]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52302 00001087 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 52303                                  	;;;
 52304                                  %endif
 52305 00001089 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 52306                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 52307                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 52308 0000108C B405                    	mov	ah,5
 52309 0000108E 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52310 00001093 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 52311 00001095 740E                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 52312                                  
 52313                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 52314                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 52315                                  	;  25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52316                                  	;;;
 52317 00001097 2E8E16[6C0F]            	mov	ss,[cs:SS_Save]
 52318                                  	;;;
 52319 0000109C 2E8B26[6E0F]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 52320                                  
 52321 000010A1 58                      	pop	ax
 52322 000010A2 5B                      	pop	bx
 52323                                  
 52324 000010A3 EBCD                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 52325                                  
 52326                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 52327 000010A5 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 52328 000010A7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52329 000010A9 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 52330 000010AB 7405                    	je	short XMMcont		; Y: do not change mode
 52331                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 0		; set video mode
 52332                                  	;mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 52333                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52334                                  	;;;
 52335 000010AD B80200                  	mov     ax,2
 52336                                  	;;;
 52337 000010B0 CD10                    	int	10h
 52338                                  XMMcont:
 52339                                  	;mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 52340                                  	;xor	al,al			; page 0
 52341                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52342                                  	;;;
 52343 000010B2 B80005                  	mov     ax,500h
 52344                                  	;;;
 52345 000010B5 CD10                    	int	10h
 52346                                  	
 52347 000010B7 BE[1911]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 52348 000010BA 0E                      	push	cs
 52349 000010BB 1F                      	pop	ds
 52350 000010BC FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 52351                                  XMMprnt:
 52352 000010BD AC                      	lodsb
 52353 000010BE 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 52354 000010C0 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh
 52355 000010C2 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 52356 000010C4 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 52357 000010C7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52358 000010C9 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 52359                                  
 52360                                  XMMStall:
 52361 000010CB FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 52362 000010CC EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 52363

 52535                                  ; DOSDATA:12CFh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52536                                  
 52537                                  ; Retro DOS v5.0
 52538                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1180h
 52539                                  
 52540                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 52541                                  ; DOSDATA:12CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 52542                                  
 52543                                  ; first and second DOS patches
 52544                                  ;	Non-console device read/write (system calls 3Fh and 40h)
 52545                                  ;
 52546                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 2 locations, one for read, one for write
 52547                                  ;	DVRDLP:
 52548                                  ;	DVWRTLP:
 52549                                  ;
 52550                                  ;
 52551                                  ; 036h	lds	si,SS:[????]				  ; ThisSFT
 52552                                  ;	lds	si,si+7 				  ; sf_devptr
 52553                                  ; 0E8h	call	????		<- "simulate" int28 event ; DSKSTATCHK
 52554                                  
 52555                                  DOSP1_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52556                                  DOSP1_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52557                                  DOSP1_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52558                                  
 52559                                  		db	90h, 90h
 52560                                  
 52561                                  DOSP12_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52562                                  DOSP12_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52563                                  DOSP12_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52564                                  
 52565                                  ; DOSDATA:12E3h
 52566                                  
 52567                                  ; Third/Fourth DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) from console
 52568                                  ;
 52569                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52570                                  ;	GETBUF:
 52571                                  ;
 52572                                  ; 051h	push	cx	<- begin special int28 mode
 52573                                  ;	push	es
 52574                                  ;	push	di
 52575                                  ;	mov	dx,???? ; offset dosgroup:CONBUF
 52576                                  ;	call	????	; $STD_CON_STRING_INPUT
 52577                                  ;	pop	di
 52578                                  ;	pop	es
 52579                                  ; 059h	pop	cx	<- end special int28 mode
 52580                                  
 52581                                  DOSP3_ID:	db	051h,006h,057h,0BAh
 52582                                  DOSP3_CONBUF:	db	029h,002h,0E8h
 52583                                  DOSP3_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP3_ID
 52584                                  		db	09Ah,0E3h,05Fh,007h	; ???? , pop di, pop es
 52585                                  DOSP4_ID:	db	059h			; pop cx
 52586                                  DOSP4_ID_OFF	equ	(DOSP4_ID - DOSP3_ID)
 52587                                  	
 52588                                  ; DOSDATA:12EFh
 52589                                  
 52590                                  ; Fifth DOS patch - System call 40h (Write) to console
 52591                                  ;
 52592                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52593                                  ;
 52594                                  ;		push	cx
 52595                                  ;      WRCONLP: lodsb
 52596                                  ;		cmp	al,1Ah
 52597                                  ;		jz	????
 52598                                  ;		call	????	<- "simulate" int28 event
 52599                                  ;		loop	WRCONLP
 52600                                  ;      CONEOF:	pop	ax
 52601                                  
 52602                                  DOSP5_ID:	db	051h			; push cx
 52603                                  		db	0ACh,03Ch,01Ah,074h,005h
 52604                                  		db	0E8h			; call
 52605                                  DOSP5_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP5_ID
 52606                                  
 52607                                  ; DOSDATA:12F6h
 52608                                  
 52609                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 52610                                  ;
 52611                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 52612                                  ;
 52613                                  ;
 52614                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 52615                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 52616                                  ;	mov bx,cs
 52617                                  ;	mov ds,bx
 52618                                  ;	inc [indos]
 52619                                  ;	xor ax,ax
 52620                                  ;	mov [USER_ID],AX	<- Patch to set USER_ID to VMID
 52621                                  
 52622                                  DOSP7_ID:	db	02Eh,08Ch,01Eh
 52623                                  DOSP7_SAVEDS:	db	07Eh,05h		; mov [SaveDS],ds
 52624                                  		db	02Eh,089h,01Eh
 52625                                  DOSP7_SAVEBX:	db	07Ch,05h		; mov [SaveBX],bx
 52626                                  		db	08Ch,0CBh		; mov bx,cs
 52627                                  		db	08Eh,0DBh		; mov ds,bx
 52628                                  		db	0FEh,006h
 52629                                  DOSP7_INDOS:	db	0CFh,002h		; inc [indos]
 52630                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 52631                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID
 52632                                  
 52633                                  ; DOSDATA:130Ah
 52634                                  
 52635                                  ; Eighth DOS patch - OWNER check in handle calls. For share, need to NOP test
 52636                                  ;
 52637                                  ; Code in handle.asm, 1 location in routine CheckOwner
 52638                                  ;
 52639                                  ;
 52640                                  ;
 52641                                  ;	push	ax
 52642                                  ;	mov	ax,ss:[USER_ID]     <- patch to XOR AX,AX to set zero
 52643                                  ;	cmp	ax,es:[di.sf_UID]   <- NOP
 52644                                  ;	pop	ax
 52645                                  ;	jz	????
 52646                                  
 52647                                  DOSP8_ID:	db	050h			; push ax
 52648                                  		db	036h,0A1h
 52649                                  DOSP8_USER_ID:	db	0EAh,002h		; mov  ax,ss:[USER_ID]
 52650                                  		db	026h,03Bh,045h		; cmp  ax,es:[di+2F]
 52651                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 52652                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 52653                                  
 52654                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 52655                                  
 52656                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 52657                                  ;
 52658                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 52659                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 52660                                  ;
 52661                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 52662                                  ;
 52663                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 52664                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 52665                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52666                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 52667                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 52668                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 52669                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 52670                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 52671                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 52672                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 52673                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 52674                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 52675                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 52676                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 52677                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 52678                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52679                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 52680                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52681                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 52682                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52683                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 52684                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 52685                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52686                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 52687                                  ;
 52688                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 52689                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 52690                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 52691                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 52692                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 52693                                  ;
 52694                                  ;   CRDROK:
 52695                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 52696                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52697                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 52698                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 52699                                  
 52700                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 52701                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52702                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 52703                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52704                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 52705                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52706                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 52707                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52708                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 52709                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 52710                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52711                                  			db	009H,003H
 52712                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 52713                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 52714                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 52715                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52716                                  			db	05FH
 52717                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52718                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 52719                                  
 52720                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52721                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 52722                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 52723                                  
 52724                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 52725                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 52726                                  ;
 52727                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 52728                                  ;
 52729                                  ;
 52730                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 52731                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 52732                                  ;	    je l1
 52733                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 52734                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 52735                                  ;	    int 10h
 52736                                  ;	    jmp l0
 52737                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 52738                                  
 52739                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 52740                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 52741                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 52742                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 52743                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 52744                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 52745                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 52746                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 52747                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID
 52748

 52802                                  ;############################################################################
 52803                                  ;
 52804                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 52805                                  ;
 52806                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 52807                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 52808                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 52809                                  ;
 52810                                  ; MARK3 SHOULD NOT BE > 122AH

 52812                                  ; As of 9/6/90, this area is FULL!

 52818                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52819                                  
 52820                                  ; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52821                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52822                                  
 52823                                  ; 17/01/2024
 52824                                  ; MSDOS 5.0  MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52825                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52826                                  ; 09/03/2024
 52827                                  ; Windows ME    IO.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52828                                  
 52829                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 52830                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 52831                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 52832                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 52833                                  
 52834                                  ; country and code page information
 52835                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52836                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 52837 00001132 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 52838 0000113A 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 52838 00001143 53595300           
 52839                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 52840 00001147 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 52841                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52842                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 52843                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 52844                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 52845                                  ;  endif
 52846                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 52847                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 52848                                  ;  endif
 52849                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 52850                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 52851                                  ;  endif
 52852                                  ;else
 52853 0000117A B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 52854                                  ;endif
 52855                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52856 0000117C 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 52857                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_76: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 76 
 52858 0000117E 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 52859 0000117F [FA0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 52860 00001181 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52861 00001183 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 52862 00001184 [7C0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 52863 00001186 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52864 00001188 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 52865 00001189 [280D]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 52866 0000118B 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52867 0000118D 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 52868 0000118E [FE0B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 52869 00001190 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52870 00001192 07                      	db   SetDBCS	; 7		;AN000; DBCS Ev			2/12/KK
 52871 00001193 [000D]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 52872 00001195 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 52873 00001197 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 52874 00001198 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size
 52875                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52876                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 52877                                  ;	......
 52878                                  ;else
 52879                                  	; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52880                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1292h
 52881                                  _COUNTRY_ID:
 52882 0000119A 0100                    	dw   1				; USA country id
 52883 0000119C B501                    	dw   437			; USA system code page id
 52884                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_108: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 108	
 52885 0000119E 0000                    	dw   0 				; date format
 52886 000011A0 2400000000              	db   '$',0,0,0,0		; currency symbol
 52887 000011A5 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator
 52888 000011A7 2E00                    	db   '.',0			; decimal separator
 52889 000011A9 2D00                    	db   '-',0			; date separator
 52890 000011AB 3A00                    	db   ':',0			; time separator
 52891 000011AD 00                      	db   0				; currency format flag
 52892 000011AE 02                      	db   2				; # of digits in currency
 52893 000011AF 00                      	db   0 				; time format
 52894 000011B0 [6B0D]                  	dw   MAP_CASE			; mono case routine entry point
 52895 000011B2 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of entry point
 52896 000011B4 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; data list separator
 52897 000011B6 000000000000000000-     	dw   0,0,0,0,0			; reserved
 52897 000011BF 00                 
 52898                                  ;endif

 52987                                  ;============================================================================
 52988                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 52989                                  ;============================================================================
 52990                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 52991                                  
 52992                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 52993                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 52994                                  ;
 52995                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 52996                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 52997                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 52998                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 52999                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 53000                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 53001                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 53002                                  ; to call out here.
 53003                                  ;
 53004                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 53005                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 53006                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 53007                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 53008                                  ;
 53009                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 53010                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 53011                                  ;
 53012                                  ;Exported Functions
 53013                                  ;==================
 53014                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 53015                                  
 53016                                  ; DosData Segment
 53017                                  
 53018                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 53019                                  
 53020                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53021                                  
 53022                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 53023                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 53024                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 53025                                  ; 'patch' related.
 53026                                  
 53027                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 53028 00001246 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 53029                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53030                                  
 53031                                  ; 25/03/2024
 53032                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1340h
 53033                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:133Eh)
 53034                                  
 53035                                  ; 07/03/2025
 53036                                  %if 0
 53037                                  MagicPatch:
 53038                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 53039                                          retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 53040                                          nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 53041                                          nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 53042                                          nop             ; call far ?:?     
 53043                                          nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 53044                                          nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 53045                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 53046                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 53047                                  %endif
 53048                                  
 53049                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53050                                  
 53051                                  ;DosData Ends
 53052                                  
 53053                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:136Ah
 53054                                  ;
 53055                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 53056                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1346h
 53057                                  
 53058                                  ;; Windows ME IO.SYS
 53059                                  ;; db 12 dup(0)
 53060

 53084                                  ;MSDAT001E:	; label byte
 53085                                  
 53086                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 53087                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 53088                                  DOSDATAEND equ $
 53089                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 53090                                  					; = 4970 for MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS
 53091                                  MSDAT001E equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4934 for PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 53092                                  					; (= 4944 for Windows ME IO.SYS)
